loans.name: Dependable God Group

texts.en: Margaret is fifty-two years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Margaret is a trader. She trades in pastries. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Dependable God. The group members are engaged in farming and/or trading activities. They sell to and supply their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Marie Aimee

texts.en:
Marie Aimee U. N. operates a retail business selling new clothes.  She started this business in 2004. Aimee employs one person. The business hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m daily. Before starting her clothing business she was a full-time housewife.

Marie Aimee is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 12.She lives in Kimironko, an area of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

With the loan requested by Aimee, she plans to expand her business through purchasing more variety of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: clothing inventory

loans.name: Anzhella

texts.en:
Anzhella is divorced and has one child. She sells women's shoes at Mukachevo open market. Her income is about 3,000 UAH per month.

Anzhella has been in this business for 4 years. High demand provides her with many clients. Anzhella has a good pricing and a discount policy that helps her to retain old clients and to attract new ones. This business is the only source of income for Anzhella and her son. She really wants to develop it even further.

Anzhella would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to purchase more seasonal inventory. She will use additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory.

loans.name: Joseph Shikuku

texts.en: Joseph is a 36-year-old businessman who runs a retail shop in Eldoret town near Lusweti primary school. He sells different consumer goods like cooking fat, soap, sugar, rice, soft drinks and other items. Joseph heard about KADET and he went to find out more by himself. After meeting with the KADET officers he decided to join as a member of an existing group. Joseph has since applied for a loan which he intends to use to add more stock in his retail shop. His future plans are to expand his business into a supermarket and create employment opportunities for his relatives. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock like cooking fat, rice and sugar

loans.name: Nerea Albertina

texts.pt:
Nerea Albertina D. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 28 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 4 anos de idade. Estuda 12ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano de Boane. Vive na casa própria em Boane com seu irmão, e para alem de filho não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane em 2002 com seus pais, porque antes viviam numa casa de aluguer. É oficial numa organização de apoio humanitária (Kulima) há mais de 2 anos, faz em media cerca de 8 horas de trabalho por dia, aufere um salário de 4.300.00mt por mes consegue poupar na conta bancária e através de sistema de poupança rotativo (Xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições bancárias, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º crédito no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, areia, ferro e outros). Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 5.000.00 e 10.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro, pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma nova residência, onde passara os momentos de lazer com a sua família.
texts.en:
Nerea Albertina D. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. She is 28, single, and the mother of a 4-year-old son. She studied through 12th grade at the Joaquim Chissano high school in Boane. She lives in her own home in Boane with her brother. She doesn't support anyone else besides her son. She left Maputo for Boane in 2002 with her parents because they lived in a rented home. She has been employed with a humanitarian organization (Kulima) for more than 2 years. She works 8 hours a day on average. She makes a wage of 4,300 meticais per month, and she manages to save some in a bank account through a rotating savings system called Xitique. She has never had a loan with another banking institution. She became familiar with Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is her 3rd loan, and it is for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction material (stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.). Her previous loans were for 5,000 and 10,000 meticais which she used for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to request more loans to construct a new home, where she will spend her free time with her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, sand, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Stock their businesses

loans.name: Liong

texts.en:
Liong J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer.  She is requesting a loan to stock more materials.  Liong is 40 years old and widowed.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more materials

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en:
Omolola, age 42, enjoys her clothes-selling trade. She lives in Lagos and has been in business for 10 years. She is married and has four children: the school-aged ones are enrolled in school. With the proceeds from her business, she is able to assist her husband in providing for the household expenses.

She hopes for a loan of N140,000 in order to purchase more clothes to sell. This will help her to increase her stock, and expects that an expanded inventory will also attract more customers.

She thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Oscar Vicente

texts.es: El señor Oscar Vicente R., tiene 33 años de edad, habita con su familia en el Barrio Buena Vista, es acompañado y su mujer trabaja como comerciante, tiene una hija de 8 años la cual comienza a estudiar la escuela primaria y un hijo de13, ellos se dedican al cultivo de la piña y Granos Básicos desde hace 12 años, uno de los problemas que ha enfrentado en los últimos años, ha sido los problema de  sequía y la afectación de plagas, inicio su negocio gracias a la reforma agraria, su padre se integro a la cooperativa y lo  fue involucrando poco a poco a las actividades del campo, dentro de los planes que tiene son el obtener los recursos necesarios para diversificar su producción, para esto necesita de un préstamo con el que pueda comprar insumos tales como fertilizantes y brindarle los nutrientes necesarios a su cultivo y mejorar la cosecha, esto les traerá a la familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Vicente R. is 33 years old and lives with his family in the Buena Vista neighborhood. His wife works as a vendor, and he has an 8-year old daughter, who is in elementary school, and a 13-year old son. They have grown pineapples and basic grains for 12 years. One of the problems that he has faced in the last few years is draughts and insent infestation. He started his business thanks to agrarian reform. His father joined the cooperative and became involved in rural activities little by little. Oscar's plans include obtaining the necessary resources to diversify his products. This is why he needs the loan, which he will use to buy supplies like fertilizer to provide the necessary nutrients to his crops and improve his harvest. This will help improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies to maintain crops

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef  is 36 years old, married, and has three unemployed children. He has worked in transportation for the past 15 years and has owned his own van since 2000. Youssef offers transportation services for the whole of his region. Today, Youssef is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to perform maintenance on his van as it is in poor condition. This will enable him to continue his work properly and earn income for his family.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mr. Pich C. is a 46-year-old villager in Srae Vong village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Thouk Ouch, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice.

Mr. Pich C. is now requesting 1,400,000 Riel from AMK, a Kiva partner, to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, pesticide and gasoline to support his dry farming season. Aside from farming, he is a palm-juice collector and his wife is a salt seller who can make a small income to support their family life. This couple has six children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory, while three others are attending the local school and the other two are too young to study or work. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Darío Altagracio

texts.es:
El señor Darío es un productor y agricultor de Nagarote el cual junto a su familia ha logrado salir adelante  ya que con los créditos brindados por ceprodel el ha podido mejorar su vivienda ya que le ha permitido aumentar su hato ganadero y así producir más leche la cual vende en su casa.
Este crédito es para la compra de vaquillas preñadas y así aumentar su producción de leche la cual le beneficia ya que con la venta de leche actualmente sus hijos están por graduarse de secundaria y siempre segur apoyándolo en sus estudios
texts.en:
Darío is a farmer and producer in Nagarote. He and his family have managed to get ahead thanks to loans from Ceprodel that have made it possible for him to make improvements to his dwelling and increase the size of his cattle herd which, in turn, has led to increased production of milk, which he sells from his home. He will use these funds to buy young pregnant cows to further increase milk production, which is a great benefit for him because the sale of the milk provides for his children's schooling (they are about to graduate from middle school) and he wants to continue to support their education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pregnant heifers.

loans.name: Khouth

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Mrs. P., 45, who lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia, where she owns a medium-sized kiosk for selling groceries. In addition, she goes to buy fish in bulk to retail in the market. Her husband helps feed the family by investing in a haircutting trade. The couple has been married for many years but have no child yet.

Recently, P. sold all the grocery inventory from her store and she wants to buy more items to continue selling. Because she doesn’t have money, she decided to request a loan to be used to purchase more grocery items for her kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her kiosk

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn B. is very thankful for the opportunity to join ASHI last year. Because of it, she has able to access a loan which was used to sustain the operation of her husband’s transportation business using a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar). The income from this business is her family’s main source for food and other primary needs. Also, this has enabled Roselyn to have savings in ASHI in preparation of her family’s emergency needs and for the education of their only child who is now two years of age.

Presently, Roselyn is again requesting a loan through ASHI. This loan will be used to improve their tricycle and recondition its engine.

loans.use: To pay for reconditioning of her husband's tricycle engine and to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya owns a retail business that sells various agricultural products, including seeds, fertilizers, and bug killers. Yuliya has a large assortment of products, affordable prices, and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Yuliya has been in this business for thirteen years. The business is seasonal; she sells most of her items in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Yuliya's business is very useful to them. 

Yuliya would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories--seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to develop her business even more and to have more clients who will use her services. Yuliya lives with her husband, Alexander, and her son and daughter. Their son is a college student.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Apothi

texts.en:
Apothi A. is a thirty-nine-year-old business woman from Mawa village, Paidha town council in Uganda. She is a single mother of three children who are all in school, and she has six dependents she is taking care of as well. She sells fish and has been in this business for over seven years.

Apothi will use her loan to buy more baskets and fish to sell, and so grow her business. Her dream is to expand her market into neighboring districts like Arua, Nebbi, Pakwach, and even into Congo.

loans.use: To buy more baskets and fish to sell.

loans.name: Barichisu

texts.en:
Barichisu was born in 1972. She is a widow with 4 children. To help raise her family, she began selling cereals in 1994. 

Barichisu has requested a loan from WAGES in Togo of 500,000 CFA to help her purchase 16 sacks of corn. This is her first loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity has been selling fried potatoes and fresh water for three years, retail, door to door and from home. She is married with two children who attend school. With the Kshs 40,000 she would like to pay school fees, pay for a water permit and build a water cubicle where she will then sell to her neighbors and school children. 

Purity would like to supply fresh water wholesale some day. She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to boost her business. Purity owns a home with electricity and piped water.  She clearly mentioned that her greatest monthly expenses are transport and food.

loans.use: To pay school fees, pay for a water licence, and build a water cubicle for selling fresh water

loans.name: Tet Ansnm Des Perchers Group

texts.en:
Jaccius, 29, is the coordinator of his group, Tet Ansnm des Perchers, and his story is representative of his group and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). His group is located in Trou du Nord, an impoverished, agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his parents.

Jaccius is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza and he hopes that his new business will bring him steady income and make him independent. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business buying products in bulk and selling them in his community. He will buy primarily gasoline and rice. He will use the profits to build a small home in the yard next to his parents so that he can be independent.

loans.use: To buy rice and gasoline in bulk for resale

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en: Cheab Y., 62, is widowed and resides with a child in the province of Takeo, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of US $0.30 per day. Her child is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor J. is from the village of Upperville, Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Flor runs a store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase fishe to sell and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Flor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es: Bernabé, de 38 años, es un padre de familia responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Durante los días hábiles de la semana trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, en su motocarro, por los distritos de su ciudad.  Inicia su labor a las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 de la noche, dejando un día de semana para descansar, de esta manera lleva más de 2 años. En un inicio le fue difícil este trabajo por que no conocía las rutas, hoy recorre las calles con mucha tranquilidad. Se  siente muy satisfecho por lo que hace, asimismo constató que este trabajo es rentable,  por ello, para más adelante  planea comprarse otra moto para alquilar y generarse más ingresos económicos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que los considera de gran ayuda para el progreso de su labor, ya que le gustaría contar con posteriores ayudas. Bernabé, con este crédito tiene planeado comprar un par de llantas y repuestos de su motocarro, y de ese modo brindar un servicio eficiente a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Bernabé, 38 years old, is a responsible father of a family. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children. During the working days of the week he works at providing transportation, in his motor car or motorcycle taxi, through the districts of the city. He works from 7:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night, leaving a day of the week to rest. He has been doing this for two years. At the beginning this work was hard for him because he did not know the routes, today he calmly drives the streets. He is very satisfied with what he does, he also affirms that this work is very profitable, and therefore he plans to get another motorcycle to rent and generate more income. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to pay all his installments on time. He considers it to be very helpful to the progress of his work. He would also want to be able to get help in the future if he needs it. With this loan, Bernabé plans to purchase a pair of tires and replacement parts for his motor car, and thus be able to provide efficient service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pair of tires and replacement parts for his motor car.

loans.name: Prak's Group

texts.en:
Four members, who live in Svay village in Takeo province, make up this group loan. Mrs. Prak L., age 30, is the group leader selected by the other members. Each will use their portion of the loan for various goals. 

Mrs. Prak L. is a congee (rice porridge) and Khmer noodle seller in her village. She is able to earn a large profit to support her family. She also raises some pigs. Her husband, Mr. Saret Khoem, is a farmer who owns a 0.2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell and he is also a construction worker. She is the mother of two children who are both too young for school. Her problem is that her home is uncomfortable to live in, but she does not have enough money to make improvements. Therefore, Mrs. Prak L. is requesting a loan to fix her home.

loans.use: To fix her home

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: La señora Judith se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde muy joven, ya que ayuda en la venta a su mama, ahora ella tiene su puesto es en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su esposo trabaja como chofer viven en casa propia en la zona de pacata,  tiene un hijo de 4 años y esta embarazada esperando al otro bebe, el crédito lo necesita para aumentar su capital y agrandar su negocio comprando insumos para ofrecer variedad de refrescos a sus clientes es nueva en la institución, pero la señora es trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Judith has been selling soft drinks since she was very young because she helped her mother sell them. Now she has her own stand on a central street in the city of Cochamba. Her husband works as a driver, and they live in their own house in the Pacata area. She has a four year old child, and she is expecting another baby. She needs the loan to increase her capital and expand her business. She will buy supplies in order to sell a variety of refreshments to her customers. She is new to the institution, but she is a hard-working woman. She is very grateful to the institution for the help offered in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and to buy supplies

loans.name: Karina Patricia

texts.es: karian Tiene 20 años, ella tiene ya 2 años en el negocio de venta de comida y hamburguesas, tiene el negocio instalado en su domicilio lo cual le permite adquirir una gran ganancia que le sirve para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por lo que solicita el credito para poder realizarle ampliaciones a su negocio y poder recibir a mayor fluencia de publico, se lo otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias y capacida de pago.
texts.en: Karina is 20 years old and has had her business selling food and hamburgers for two years. She set up the business in her home, which allows her to bring in great profits that help her provide her family with a better quality of life. She is requesting the loan to make expansions to her business so it can receive a greater number of people. The loan has been authorized due to her strong references and ability to make payments.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 34 years old. Lodivina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lodivina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Max Elías

texts.es: El Sr. Max Elías V. V. él es trabajador activo de la empresa Contratista “Jairo Agustín Vargas Mendoza” desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta empresa, es Acompañado actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Max Elías V. V. is an active employee of the "Jairo Agustín Vargas Mendoza" contracting firm where he has worked as a security guard for two years.  He lives with his partner and two school-aged children.  He has received two loans from CEPRODEL, both of which have been used to purchase construction material for home improvement and expansion.  The CEPRODEL loans have been very beneficial and have allowed him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel

loans.name: Esther Silantoi

texts.en:
Esther Silantoi K. is 26-years-old.  She is married to Tinga Mulas and she is the mother of five school-aged children.  Esther is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last two years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered member in KADET.  This will be her second loan which she is planning to spend thirty thousand shillings to prepare her piece of land and the other thirty to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season.  She hopes to use the profits from this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Esther’s dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence.  She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare her piece of land and purchase seedlings and fertilizers for the next planting season.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean de dieu in Kigali, Rwanda!  Jean de dieu is 27 years old, is single and has adopted two orphans.

Jean de dieu has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He is a hard worker and gets up at 7 am everyday to start transporting people to their work places. 

Jean de dieu has requested a loan of 500,000 RWF to buy his own motorbike taxi. His goal is to cover the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Dora Club Group

texts.en:
Nomasalamuzi is 60 years old and single with three children, aged between 16 and 40 years. She sells shoes in a marketplace in Empangeni in South Africa (KZN). She also earns income from the government’s old age pension. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time.

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy supplies and glue for making shoes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to put her 16-year-old child into computer school. With the help of WDB and Kiva, she would like to see her business grow and get machines for making shoes.

Nomasalamuzi is the leader of her group of five borrwers, and is wearing an orange shirt in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and glue for making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her mother and three siblings. She has worked as a beautician since 2005. Because of her reputation, she has been able to build up a good number of customers who are very satisfied from her work. She is the only provider for her family. She has obtained her first Kiva loan and today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine to be able to accommodate her clients asking her to offer them such type of service.  In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon as her own business.

loans.use: To purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet S., 43, is a divorced father blessed with three kids who all attend school. Yet S. is currently a professional language teacher in a private school. He started his job in 2000 and is able to generate a daily income of $9 to help manage his family's financial problems. S. is taking out this loan to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta P. sells fish and maize. She also sells children's clothing and footwear by moving from one house to the other at Breman near Elmina. Atta has received junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Atta has been in this trade for three years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and bags of maize and children's clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest into the sale of chlidren's clothing.

loans.use: buy more fish and bags of maize and children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en:
M. Ahmadjon is 60 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. Ahmadjon is an animal farmer. He owns sheep and breeds them together with the help of his wife. In order to further develop his business, Ahmadjon wants to take out a loan to buy one or two more sheep and the feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then, Ahmadjon will be able to use the profit from his business towards the well-being of his family.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards the purchase of sheep for business development.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Josiel Rigoberto

texts.es: Josiel Rigoberto se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 28 años, es un hombre muy trabajador. Inicio este medio de vida cuando fue despedido, porque no tenía el medio de ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y necesitaba proporciónale el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar cada día sus ingresos pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y proporcionar lo necesario.
texts.en: Josiel Rigoberto works at a general store. He is more than 28 years old and is a hardworking man. He began this way of life when he was fired, because he didn't have the necessary income to maintain his family and needed to supply the bread every day. The reason for the financing is to buy raw materials such as candy, detergents, basic grains, juices, sodas and other things. He dreams every day of improving his income since he always has enjoyed working and providing the necessities.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, drinks, soap, basic grains and toys, among other products

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina, 55 years old, sells fresh fish and seaweed to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman. Faustina sells his entire catch to the market. She also plants and harvests seaweeds to sell. Faustina is asking for a loan to purchase fish nets and other supplies that she needs for her business.

Faustina works hard to support her family. She has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 24 years old.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other supplies.

loans.name: Akoessiwa Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est mariée à un conducteur de taxi-moto et a 03 enfants en charge. Elle à 34ans et est revendeuse d’habits d’enfants. Il ya de cela 20ans qu’elle a commencé son activité, elle achète  à Lomé et revend au marché d’Agbata (une localité située à 12 km de Lomé).  Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des habits pour vendre pour avoir de bénéfice afin d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, d’assurer  un bon avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Cecile is married to a taxi-motor bike driver,  and has three children under her care. She is 34 and resells children's clothing.

She has been doing this activity for twenty years. 

She buys in Lome and resells at the market of Agbata, a locality 12 km (8 miles) from Lome. 

She requests this first loan to buy clothes to resell for profit, in order to help her husband in the household economy, and to ensure a good future her children.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Socorro

texts.es: Jeaneth Del Socorro tiene 59 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Pues tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, que lo inicio con el motivo de generar ingresos, esa una mujer luchadora pues se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche que llega a su vivienda, para realizar las visitas a su clientes, siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan por encargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes,  ropa para niños, ropa para damas entre otras cosas. Desea llegar a tener su propia tienda.
texts.en: Jeaneth Del Socorro is 59 years old and sells clothing for a living. She has been in this business for six years and started doing it to generate income. She is a very enterprising woman. In order to complete visits to her clients, she wakes up at five in the morning and returns to her house at seven at night. She always pays attention to what her clients want to order. She is requesting funding to buy skirts, pants, shirts, suits, children's clothing, and women's clothing, among other things. She wishes to be able to have her own store someday.

loans.use: buy skirts, pants, shirts, suits, children's clothing and women's clothing, among other things.

loans.name: Marta Daisy

texts.es:
Marta S. S. es una mujer e 57 años de edad vive con su esposo, no pudo terminar la primaria ya que ella cuido a sus hermanos los más pequeños.  Marta es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, es el segundo crédito que solicita a la fundación el cual será para crecimiento de su actividad que es gallinas ponedoras, y el primero fue para la venta x catalogo lo cual aun la tiene pero esta mas dedicada a sus gallinas, 
Capital: Doña Marta Inicio con un compra de 40 gallinas ponedora pequeñas, las cuales fueron con  ahorros de la actividad de venta por catalogo, cuenta con dos gallineros uno grande y otro pequeño

Marta tiene dos gallineros uno para sus gallinas ponedoras que son 40 las que tiene y cada una de ellas pone dos huevos al día, este gallinero es muy amplio para ella, pueden andar cómodamente, el segundo gallinero es para sus gallinas caseras que son 10 cuenta con un gallo. Sus gallineros son de lata y de rejas y maya ya que por donde ella vive rondan muchos los zorros. A la fecha no se han comido ninguna.
Con el crédito podrá comprar más gallinas ponedoras para seguir creciendo su capital, ella se levanta muy temprano a darles de comer y agua, recoge los huevos y los lleva a lavar durante la tarde hace lo mismo 
Con el crédito podrá llegar a más clientes para seguir con el negocio.
texts.en:
Marta S. S. is a 57 year old woman who lives with her husband. She wasn’t able to finish primary school because she had to care for her younger brothers.

Marta is a very hardworking and responsible person. This is the second loan she has applied for from the foundation. It will be used for enlarging her egg production business. The first loan was for a catalogue sales business she still has, but she is more involved with her chickens.

Capital: Doña Marta began with the purchase of 40 small egg laying chickens with savings from her catalogue sales business. She has two chicken coops, one big, the other small.

Marta has two chicken coops. One is for the egg producing chickens. She has 40 of these and each one lays two eggs per day. This chicken coop is very large, and she is able to walk in it comfortably. The second is for her home grown chickens and has 10 chickens and a rooster. Her chicken coops are made from tin, planks, and chicken wire since a lot of foxes hang around where she lives. To date the foxes haven’t eaten any of her chickens.

With the loan she will be able to buy more egg producing chickens in order to continue increasing her capital. She gets up very early to give her chickens food and water, collect the eggs, and clean up. She does the same in the afternoon. With the loan she will be able to obtain more customers and continue with the business.

loans.use: to purchase more egg laying chickens for her business.

loans.name: Yduvina

texts.es:
Yduvina es una madre de familia de  47 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo  a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chepén  y a unas 2 horas de distancia al departamento de La Libertad (Trujillo) .  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su actividad  agrícola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Ha colocado Yduvinda en la parte de adelante de su casa su tiendad de abarrotes donde vende toda clase de productos para el uso doméstico  (pan, huevos, aceite, leche, atún, lejía, detergente y todo tipo de golosinas, etc), con el negocio que tiene desde hace 4 años en su domicilio trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su hija.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más productos y poderles ofrecer a sus clientes con el fin de satisfacer  sus necesidades y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos para su hogar.   Yduvinda es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  trabajdora, dispuesta a seguir mejorando en la vida para brindarle lo que desee a su hija.
texts.en:
Yduvina, 47, lives with her daughter in her own house which has running water and electricity.  It is located in Pueblo Nuevo, about 15 minutes from the province of Chepén and two hours from the department of La Libertad (Trujillo).  The local population in these areas is active mainly in agriculture, livetock farming and tourism.

In the front part of her home, Yduvina hs set up a grocery store where she sells all kinds of products for domestic use (bread, eggs, oil, milk, tuna, bleach, detergent and all types of sweets, etc.).  For four years she has been in business trying to provide a better lifestyle for her daughter.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy products for her store and offer her customers everything they need, in an effort to increase her household income.  Yduvina is known by her neighbors as being a hard-working woman, intent on continuing to improve her lifestyle and giving her daughter all she can.

loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
Deolita earns a living growing corn and raising livestock. She tills land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She raises pigs and chickens in her backyard. Deolita works hard to improve her businesses and increase the family income.

Deolita has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and livestock feed. She hopes to have a stable business soon.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and livestock feed

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is the father of two children. His children are aged 5 and 2, and the first child is already attending school. He has been in mixed farming   for five straight years, producing and selling milk, vegetables, tomatoes, and maize to the local market.

He has requested a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow for 31,200 KES and purchase poultry birds with the balance (30,000 KES). Elias says the loan will enable him to pay the school fees for his children, and he will also be able to produce milk and eggs for their consumption. He adds that he is focused on venturing into the transportation business to make it easier to deliver his produce as well as make additional income.

Elias says he wants to focus on the loan repayment so that he can borrow more in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, 42 years old, is a cake seller. Her husband is doing plantation. Their income is $10 per day. They have 4 children, one is studying and 2 are working in the factory. Their daughter has her own hairdresser shop. 

Every month, Nang spends $40 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy equipment for her daughter's shop. She plan to help her daughter to run her shop well, and will extend the shop when it develops. For her child who is studying, she will always support him if he wants to continue university.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her daughter's hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, age 35, is a very hard-working entrepreneur. For 10 years, she has operated a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale.

She and her husband have three children, all enrolled in school.

In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Cayetano Samuel

texts.es: El señor Cayetano, de 70 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Jinotega, casado y con dos hijos de 24 y 21 años respectivamente, se dedica actualmente a la venta de botas y fajas de cuero desde hace 24 años. Su primer negocio fue la venta de zapatos pero decidió en conjunto con su familia ingresar nuevos productos a su negocio como son las faja y botas. ÈL solicitó su crédito para comprar diferentes estilos de fajas y botas ya que es un producto de alta rotación en el mercado y así ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad y variedad. El señor Cayetano nos cuenta que da a conocer su producto en la feria Expica – Managua, ya que mediante ésta obtiene mejores ganancias. Desea ampliar más su taller con más trabajadores y así tener más productos en su inventario. Su próxima meta es solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertir más a su negocio.
texts.en:
Cayetano, 70, was born in the city of Jinotega.  He is married and has two grown children, 24 and 21 years old respectively.  He has sold leather boots and belts for the past 24 years.
His first business was selling shoes but he decided, together with his family, to include new products such as belts and boots.  He requested a loan to buy different styles of belts and boots and now  these are top sellers in the market and he can offer his customers better quality and variety. 
Cayetano tells us that he learned about his products in the Expica-Managua Market and this is the way he gets a higher income.  He wishes to enlarge his shop and add more workers and thus have more products in his inventory.  His next goal is to request new financing to invest more in his business.

loans.use: to buy belts and boots

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia sells plastic containers and aluminium bowls at Abura, moving from one place to another. Emelia has received junior high education. She is married to an electrician. The loan she hopes to get will be used to buy plastic bowls to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls to expand her business.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Speu, Mr. Pech, age 51, is married to Mrs. SamAn, age 50. He has five children, four of whom are employed as garment workers. The other one attends school.

Mr. Pech is a farmer. Aside this, he has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. He is able to earn a profit of approximately $0.50 each day from his business. He has a life partner in his wife who is a local farmer. Mr. Pech would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to his current savings to build a new house. His current house is becoming older and older now and it is not comfortable for him and his family to live in. With the rest of the loan, he will buy a new cow to replace the old one.

Mr. Pech really hopes with his additional income to add to his crop-planting business and to enlarge his house. Mr. Sam and his wife appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a new house and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Yessenia is the coordinator of her group Jesus es prosperidad 5 & 6, (Jesus is prosperity). She lives in a simple structure with her three children and her long-term partner, also her children's father. She said her most difficult challenges are to help her children to go forward with a good education and a safe living, and to have a successful beauty salon and spa.

Yessenia is excited about her fourth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately five years, starting with her own resources. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing a hair dryer, some other equipment and beauty products. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business. She will use the profits to save, because she wants to make her dream come true: to have a successful beauty salon and spa.

Yessenia's group is located in Santiago, an area known for tobacco and beef production. Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and jewelry. Yessenia thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and some beauty products

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a hard-working father who raised his family in a village. He is now 43 years old and has four school-aged children. The main source of their livelihood is farming. They plant rice and raise fingerlings (fish hatchlings) for sale. He aimed to improve their sources of income in order to continue to send their children to school since they want them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. 

Despite the hardships of life, William is striving hard to support the education of their children. He is asking for an additional capital of P35,000 to buy feed and additional fingerlings to raise. He believes that this loan will help a lot to improve the business. In the future, he hopes that their business will become a viable source of income. He mentioned that through patience and hard work he will able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional fingerlings (fish hatchlings) to raise

loans.name: Nelson Jose

texts.es:
El señor Nelson José se dedica arduamente  a la labor de maestro de primaria en un poblado del municipio, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 20 años. Es soltero y sin hijos.
Una de las necesidades que el señor Nelson atraviesa hoy en día, es de mejorar sus condiciones laborales, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de iniciar la actividad, es por eso que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de una computadora para iniciar su desarrollo laboral, realizando el cambio tecnológico en apoyo a su labor educativa y de esa manera crear mejores condiciones y nivel de vida.
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta actividad le proporcionará un mejoramiento a su actividad educativa.
texts.en:
Nelson José works arduously at his job as an elementary school teacher.  He has done this work for 20 years, and is single with no children.

One of Nelson's current necessities is to improve his working conditions, so he has decided to take action.  For this reason he is going to CEPRODEL for a loan to buy a computer for professional development, to accomplish a technological change in support of his teaching.  In this way he will create better conditions and quality of life.

It is important to emphasize that this action will improve his teaching activity.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Sobeida Yanori

texts.es:
la sra. Sobeida tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera pero se a quedado sola ya que su familia vive en los Estados Unidos, Sobeida se dedica a la venta de refrescos en varios tamaños, tiene varios años de estar atendiendo a sus clientes y este negocio es herencia de familia, Sobeida quiere seguir invirtiendo en el, ya que dichos refrescos se venden rapido y se les obtiene una buena ganancia, sus clientes son sus vecinos  y amigos que tiene en diferentes caserios cercanos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mas refrescos, desea tener mas inventario ya que el carro repartidor solo pasa una vez por semana y en ocasiones a fines de semana se esta quedando sin producto.
el sueño de Sobeida es casarse y tener hijos para formar una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sobeida, 22, is single and lives alone.  Her family lives in the United States.  Sobeida has a retail business, selling various sizes of soft drinks.  She learned the business from her parents and has operated it for several years.  She wants to continue investing in the business because soft drinks sell quickly and she earns a good living from the revenues.  Her customers live in surrounding neighborhoods.  
Sobeida will use the loan to buy more soft drinks.  She wants to keep more inventory because her distributor only passes through the area once a week and she sometimes runs out of product at weekends.  
Sobeida's greatest hope is to marry, have children and shape a happy home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her retail business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica lives in Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. Monica has a business of a liquor store. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Monica sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Monica has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local Gin. She also generates additional income through a restaurant.The main business challenges for Monica include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a build rental rooms and also to educate her children up to university. Monica lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local Gin

loans.name: Cinthia Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar vive la señora Cinthia, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene  hijos, pero tiene una hija de su esposo en otro compromiso que es como si fuera de ella ya que la tiene desde pequeñita. El marido trabaja en cerrajería. Ella estudia Ing. Industrial en una Universidad de Manabí.

Ella a más de dedicarse a sus estudios con mucha devoción y entrega también se  dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de vender por su localidad también les vende a sus compañeras y conocidas en la Universidad, ella les deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene 6 meses  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, con lo que le queda de ganancia ella se ayuda para sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio y además le han ayudado a salir adelante en sus estudios.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión.

En la fotografía aparece nuestra socia con la hija de su esposo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed back then, the “Con Esperanza” (With Hope) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

Cinthia, 22, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has no children yet but she has a daughter her husband had in a previous relationship that’s like her own since she’s had her since she was a baby.  Her husband works in a metal shop.  She’s studying Industrial Engineering at a university in Manabí.

Besides dedicating herself to her studies she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) with much dedication and steadfastness.  She works every day because in addition to selling in her neighborhood she also sells to her classmates and acquaintances at the university.  She sells on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She’s been in this line of work for six months and is doing very well.  She uses her profits to help with her studies.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  This is the fifth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans and they have also helped her get ahead with her studies.  Her dream is to finish her education and start working in her profession.

In the photo she appears with her husband’s daughter.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 47 years old and married with 2 children. With one child in school, Betty works very hard to provide for them.

Betty runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Betty has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, milk, spices, etc. 

In the future, Betty would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Srurn

texts.en:
Srurn, age 31, is married and has three children who are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming and feeding cows as labor for 10 years in a village located in the Prey Chhor district. Her husband is a palm wine producer. 

This is the first loan for Srurn with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and also earn more income from her farming which she will use to build on her savings and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ramona Benita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ramona, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos todos mayores  de edad, el menor aun vive en su casa. Su marido es chofer de una volqueta.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y ama de casa para ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende gas de uso doméstico, para lo cual tiene un local en su casa, pero además de esto también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa donde vende el gas, deja a crédito estos productos  y cobra cada fin de semana,  lleva más de tres años en este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y gas de uso doméstico. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les da la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Emprendedora de Los Cerezos communal bank meets every two weeks in the Los Cerezos residential community of the city of Portoviejo. This is a densely populated marginal urban area.

In this place we meet Ramona, 50 years old. She lives with her partner, with whom she has three children, who are all adults. The youngest still lives in her house. Her partner is a dump truck driver.

In addition to being a great mother and housewife, she also has a business in order to earn something herself. She sells household gas, for which she has a store in her house, but besides that she also sells Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things). She sells door-to-door and in her house where she sells the gas. She sells these products on credit and collects every weekend. She has been in this business for more than three years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and household gas cylinders. This is her sixth cycle with the communal bank, and she likes the bank because of the help it gives the members.

Her dreams are to move forward with her business and her personal life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and household gas

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc is 27-years-old with 4 children who are at school age. Her main business focuses on making pork paste.  She started this business 6 years ago and it creates good income for her to manage family life. Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she  has used loans to expand her business. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more new pork products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more new pork products to sell.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Efrena buys and sells home use products to earn a living and has been in this business for 11 years. Each month, Efrena earns 8,000 PHP. 

Efrena is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Efrena plans to save her profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Denia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and dried fish. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, dried fish and beverages.

Denia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Denia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, dried fish and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Shalehah

texts.en:
Shalehah is a diligent student. She is still 17 years old. 

Before getting a loan from Komida, she was still confused about the costs. She goes to school at Bina Pertiwi Vocational High School. 

She really thanks Komida because it helps her to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay for school costs.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Mr Vergar is a hard working person and head of the household. He began his iron-working workshop 6 years ago and has seen his business grow with time.

\"I have always believed that with true willingness to work, you can improve your station in life. In my workshop, I decorate doors, windows, handrails and many other items from metal. This workshop offers services in my community and contributes to home construction projects. I want to enlargen my workshop in order to supply my existing contracts and to work for others as well, but I lack the machinery and welding equipment, as well as prime materials. I am asking for a loan of $1, 500 dollars to buy the equipment and material that will allow me to grow and to raise my earnings.

Loan Use: To purchase machinery, equipment and prime materials.

El Sr. V. es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con su familia. Desde hace 6 años instaló un taller de herrería y ha visto como su negocio crece con el paso del tiempo. “Siempre he creído que con verdaderas ganas de trabajar puedes salir adelante. En mi taller elaboro puertas, ventanas, barandales, y muchos otros artículos de forja de metal. Este taller brinda un servicio a mi comunidad ya que contribuyo a proyectos de construcción de viviendas. Deseo que mi taller sea más grande para abastecer los pedidos que me hacen y para dar trabajo a otras personas, pero me falta maquinaria y equipo para soldar, así como materia prima. Solicito un crédito de 1,500 dólares para obtener tanto el equipo como el material que me permitan crecer y aumentar mis ganancias.”

loans.use: Maquinaria, equipo y materia prima

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Mr. Moise K. was born in 1979 in Lomé and is a married father of two children. He is trained as a moped and motorcycle mechanic but has had difficulty finding work. He has taken up motorcycle taxi driving but would still like to work as a mechanic. As his wife does not work, he is responsible for all of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan of $800 to trade in his motorcycle, which is very old. He is an enterprising young man who deserves to be supported in his endeavors.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979 à Lomé, Monsieur K. Moïse est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Mécanicien à 2 roues de formation, il a fini par se consacrer à la conduite de taxi moto par manque de travail mais n’a pas abandonné la mécanique. Sa femme n’exerçant aucune activité, tous les besoins de la famille reviennent à lui. Voulant changer sa moto qui est très vieille, il sollicite un crédit de $800 . C’est un garçon très entreprenant qui mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eva Esmeralda

texts.en:
Mrs. Eva Esmeralda is married, she has two small children aged 1 and 8. Previously she worked in a beauty salon. A year ago she decided to start her own business selling groceries in order to have time to see for her children.

Fortunately she's done very well and business has been growing rapidly. Recently she was able to acquire a vehicle which she uses to transport merchandise to her store and keep the store well stocked. However, in purchasing the vehicle she spent a big part of the capital which she employed in the business and is therefore requesting a loan for $457 to purchase merchandise and continue growing the business as up to now. She has committed to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

You can be an important part of the growth of this business and the life of this family. Eva trusts the people who help those in need and sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Eva Esmeralda es casada, tiene dos pequeños hijos, de 1 y 8 años de edad. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una estética, pero para tener mas tiempo para atender a sus hijos decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace un año, afortunadamente le ha ido bien con su negocio y ha estado creciendo rápidamente, hace poco le fue posible adquirir un vehiculo que utiliza para trasladar la mercancía a su tienda que le ha sido de gran ayuda para tener bien surtido, pero gastó una gran parte del capital que invertiría en su negocio, por lo que ahora solicita un crédito de $ 457 dólares para la compra de mercancía y poder continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y el la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más, Eva confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widow and a mother of three. She hails from the Gulu district but lives in Kampala for now. She has been an active artisan at Life in Africa for the past one and a half years. During these past months she got a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings (about US$150) from Kiva through the LIA community guarantee process. With this loan she developed her peanut butter business which continued to do better with more capital. She bought more raw materials to serve more of her ever-increasing customers.

Through her hard work , Florence managed to pay back her loan in three months. She thinks that she has managed to win many customers due to the increase in her production. The only problem she has now is getting enough product to supply them all. Most of these customers are monthly income earners who take delivery and make payments at the end of the month. During the rest of the time she would be waiting without doing anything. Even if there were more customers to be supplied, she would not have the stock at hand, so she says she needs to really increase her stock to meet the needs of all her customers.

She therefore seeks a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$150) to enable her to meet this high demand. She will be able to repay the loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget in full:

1- groundnuts --------- 180,000/=

2- containers --------- 15,000/=

3 - charcoal ---------- 15,000/=

4- simsim --------- 10,000/=

5- milling charges ------- 20,000/=

6- transport ---------- 10,000/=

TOTAL ----------------- 250,000/=

loans.use: Buying more materials.

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: "There has been an increase in my business since I started borrowing from LAPO," says Mrs. Chioma O., who hails from the urban sector in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She 32 years old, married, the mother of three (3) children. She bas been in this business since 2005 and needs the loan amount of $800 to buy more cloths and shoes for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more singlets, boxers shorts and shoes

loans.name: Ni Luh Kasiantini

texts.id:
Ni Luh Kasiantini is a hardworking mother. After giving birth 4 months ago, Ni Luh Kasiantini besides looking after her baby, also opened a retail stall in her home. Every daily household items needs and vegetables are provided. Besides selling main staples, Ni Luh Kasiantini also sells pig's feed, like rice and wheat shell clippings and Konsentrat (local brand). With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (about US$110), Ni Luh Kasiantini started her business. Daily profit could reach Rp50,000 (about $5.50). This profit is used to help her husband, I Komang Suwitra, who is in the cocoa seeds buying & selling business, to pay for daily expenses, and also for education for her 2 school age children, one in 4th grade, the other in kindergarten, while the last is a 4 month old baby. Ni Luh Kasiantini hopes that the with the capital to be obtained from Dinari, she could expand her business forwards. Her house is build on own land, and the building is quite permanent. Daily living expenses could reach Rp25,000 (about US$2.75)/day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Luh Kasiantini seorang Ibu rumah tangga yang rajin bekerja. Setelah melahirkan 4 bulan yang lalu , Ni Luh Kasiantini sambil menjaga bayinya juga membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Segala bahan kebutuhan sehari-hari disediakan seperti sembako,dan sayur mayur. Selain menjual aneka kebutuhan pokok, Ni Luh Kasiantini juga menjual makanan untuk babi seperti dedak gandum, dedak padi dan konsentrat. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Ni Luh Kasiantini memulai usahanya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dalam satu hari bisa mencapai Rp.50.000,-. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membantu suaminya, I Komang Suwitra, yang mempunyai usaha dagang biji kakao, untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk pendidikan 2 anaknya yang baru duduk dikelas 4 SD dan yang kedua baru TK sedangkan yang terakhir masih bayi 4 bulan. Ni Luh Kasiantini berharap dengan modal yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Ni Luh Kasiantini bisa mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih maju. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Biaya untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari bisa mencapai Rp.25.000,- perhari.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Mahija

texts.en:
Welcome to Mwashee Milk & Soft Drinks, run by 32 year-old Mahija N.. At her colourful and well-organised shop you can sample the tasty treats in the front display case; fresh and delicious cakes (top) and ‘egg chops’ (bottom), literally ‘snacks made from eggs’ (and flour), which are a little like mini doughnuts.

Mahija established the business in 2005 and requires a loan of $850 to expand it by purchasing additional stock (and hopefully adding some new scrumptious snacks). The business, in addition to her husband Ally’s salary, helps to support Mahija’s two young children, Jafari, 11 and Mashehe,8.

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Mahija would like to purchase additional stock for her drink and snack store.

loans.name: Fatna

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 46 year-old Fatna S..  She is widowed with three children, aged 7,15, and 17.  In 2005, Fatna established a general store and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti M., 29, is married to Suhaemi and has a daughter who's 5. She has a food stall where she sells fried snacks, noodles, bread, etc. She makes $10 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $75 to buy more goods for her stall. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Twekembe Development Group

texts.en:
Sarah M., 36 and the chairperson of Twekembe Development Group is in a childless marriage with 5 nieces to cater for; the eldest being 13. She has been operating a small retail shop for 6 years in Kikooza as well as selling fresh milk out of the same shop for 1 year.

Sarah is our client of 6 years and with her profits and savings, she has managed to buy a plot of land together with her husband and they are planning to build a house on the same plot. Her husband has 5 children with another wife but this does not stop Sarah from working hand-in-hand with him. She plans to open up a dairy shop in Nasuuti so that her income should increase tremendously.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for re-sale, as well as opening up a diary shop

loans.name: Merri

texts.en:
Merri is 51 years old and a mother of five children. She has been selling cloths and ladies bags for 10 years in Obuasi. Her working capital was low and and so she was not been able to buy good quality cloths and bags in wholesale quantities.  Merri got a loan from Sinapi and was able to purchase quality products for her customers. She now wants to use her new loan to buy more bags as her stock has run out and also to rent a store to stop hawking (carrying her items on her head to sell) since she is growing old.

Merri is a member of the group called Gold. The group uses peer pressure principle on their members to re-pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and rent a store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is a 36 year old living as a housewife in Kampong Cham. Her husband runs a dry wall business operating within their own village and in the surrounding districts. Business is good and he earns $10 per day. They have one child as well. He wants to expand his business to also provide a well-digging service. He needs the start up capital for this venture to be able to afford expensive tools for deep-ground digging. Sok S.'s husband Tuk Thun is pictured here because his wife was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy tools for digging wells.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
For the past 15 years, Aquilina has sold snacks to hundreds of people in her city. Little by little she has expanded her service and she has the satisfaction of having contributed to her home and to the education of her beloved children, who have now turned into good men and women. Her desire to always improve has now led her to request a loan to begin repairs on her humble home.

Translated from Spansh by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Aquilina, acaba D. cumplir quince años dedicada a la venta D. comidas a manera D. bocadillos a cientos D. personas en su ciudad, poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus servicios y tiene la satisfacción D. haber contribuido con su hogar y con la educación D. sus amados hijos que se han convertido en hombres y mujeres D. bien. Su deseo D. mejorar siempre la conducen ahora a solicitar un préstamo para iniciar la refacción D. su humilD. domicilio.

loans.use: Start repairs on her home.

loans.name: Mukaddamhon

texts.ru:
Mukaddamhon is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her husband works in Russia and sends money back to support the family. In addition, Mukaddamhon works at the bazar, where she buys and sells dried fruit; apricots, apples, and prunes in particular. She has six years of experience in this business. She has been involved with Microinvest for three years, and her loans have allowed her to significantly expand her business. She has always paid back loans on time and without trouble. Now is a time of low dried fruit prices so Mukaddamhon is actively buying them from the area's markets. In order to increase her operating capital, she decided to ask Kiva for a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Мукаддамхон 34 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж в России на заработках, присылает деньги для содержания семьи. Кроме этого Мукаддамхон выходит на базар, где занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Опыт в этой деятельности у нее 6 лет. Ассортимент сухофруктов составляет абрикосы, яблоки и слива. С Микроинвест сотрудничает уже 3 года и с помощью займов Мукаддамхон значительно раширила свой бизнес. Все погашения займа производила вовремя и без проблем. Сейчас сезон низких цен на сухофрукты и поэтому Мукаддамхон активно скупает их на рынках по району. Для пополнения своего оборотного капитала она решила обратиться в КИВУ за новым займом.

loans.use: To increase operating capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Carlos C. lives in his parents’ home (in the zone of Pasanqueri, a suburban area of La Paz). Juan Carlos works as an employee of a government department. His parents’ home is rapidly deteriorating and the front wall collapsed because it was old and made of adobe. For this reason the loan will be used to demolish what is left of the wall and to construct a new one.
