This is the second time that Juan Carlos has requested a loan. The results of our socioeconomic analysis are very favorable for him and so make him eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Juan Carlos C. vive en casa de sus padres (zona de Pasanqueri, área suburbana de La Paz). Juan Carlos trabaja como empleado de una repartición pública. El hogar de sus padres esta deteriorándose rápidamente, el muro frontal se derrumbó por ser de adobe y por la antigüedad de la construcción. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para demoler lo que queda del muro y construir uno nuevo.

Esta sería la segunda ocasión en la que Juan Carlos solicita un crédito, los resultados de nuestro análisis socioeconómico son bastante favorables para él, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a Front Wall

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia A. is a 54 year old woman and married with six children who are currently in school. She is an agro chemical seller and sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize her products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands. With the loan, Anthonia wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of her customers. She hopes to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She would be very appreciative for that assistance.

loans.use: Anthonia would like to increase her supply of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to sell to local farmers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 25 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaria, es conviviente y progenitora de una niña de 05 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Trujillo s/n frente  al colegio, en el distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.

Participó en una reunión de amigas en el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz, al informarse sobre el crédito se animó a integrar el Banco Comunal. Con un crédito inicial de S/.500 Nuevos Soles incrementó su capital y compró 02 cilindros de combustible. A los 16 años de edad formó su hogar y empezó con la venta de productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes), compraba en desaguadero y vendía al por mayor y menor en las ferias de Huaitiri, Candarave, Mazocruz.

Con este crédito de S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar productos para instalar su tienda de abarrotes, y contará con el apoyo de su esposo, que es el actual Alcalde del Distrito de Mazocruz.

Tiene como meta equipar una tienda de abarrotes y a su vez instalar cabinas de Internet en Mazocruz, también le gustaría comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna para que su hija pueda estudiar y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Irma is 25 years old and she went to school up to grade 9. She lives with her common law husband and she is the mother of a little girl aged 5 years. They live in Jr. Trujillo in front of a school, in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, Puno.

She went to a meeting held by the community bank "Generacion 2000" in Mazocruz to get information on the loan process and then she was convinced to join as a member. With her first loan amouting to S/.500, she supplemented her capital funds and she managed to purchase 2 cylinders of fuel.

When she was 16 years old she moved in with her future husband and she started selling products (such as groceries). She purchased her items on sale and she resold them wholesale and privately in the local fairs at Huaitiri, Candarave, and Mazocruz.

With this loan, amounting to S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she plans to purchase products to set up her grocery store. She will count on her husband's support. He is the Mayor of the district of Mazocruz.

Her goal is to set up her grocery store and also install a small internet cafe in Mazocruz. She would also like to purchase a little house in the city of Tacna so that her daughter will be able to go to school and one day become a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Biryema's Group

texts.en:
Biryema has been selling charcoal and firewood in Zanzibar for 5 years. Both are common household items among Tanzanians as they are the fuel with which food is prepared. Few Tanzanians own an oven or stove. Biryema will be using her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her inventory so that she can increase her profit.

Biryema is 28 years old, married, and has two children, aged 3 and 5. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately US$ 100 each month. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kinunu.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang Y. is a villager in Chek village in Kandal Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sek, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile, and he does not have rice seeds to cultivate. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Yang Y. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to hire the laborers to work on the field. She is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and rice seeds and hire the laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Assimawa

texts.fr:
Born in Accra in 1964, Mrs. Assimawa A. is married and has six (06) people. Dependents at Kpémé, all the family's charges come back to her because her husband doesn't have a steady job. Dealer for five (05) years, Mrs. Assimawa A. is a courageous and devoted woman who fights for the working order of her activity and also for the success of her children. Today, to increase her business and to have a remarkable display to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she solicits this financing.  
She hopes to improve her family's living conditions, by the growth of her income and especially the schooling of her children.
texts.en:
Born in Accra in 1964, Mrs. Assimawa A. is married and has six (06) people. Dependents at Kpémé, all the family's charges come back to her because her husband doesn't have a steady job. Dealer for five (05) years, Mrs. Assimawa A. is a courageous and devoted woman who fights for the working order of her activity and also for the success of her children. Today, to increase her business and to have a remarkable display to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she solicits this financing. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions, by the growth of her income and especially the schooling of her children.

Translated from French by SaveThese Loans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Approvisionnement de sa boutique en marchandises

loans.name: Dembe Group1

texts.en: Robinah N. is the leader of the Dembe women’s group that has been in existence for 5 years.  She is a married woman with two kids and manages two businesses.  She is a farmer growing mostly bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes, as well as making local alcohol to sell to bars around her home and in town centers.  With the local brew, she makes waragi and tonto.  In a week, Robinah can make and sell eight jerry cans of tonto and seven of waragi for wholesale, as well as selling to her customers that drink from her homestead.  Robinah needs a loan to buy more bananas and pay employees for working in her farming business.

loans.use: Buying more bananas and paying employees

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: Minerva B. is a businesswoman who roams the village with her styrofoam box filled with fish, pork, and chicken meat to sell to her co-villagers in Ilagan, Isabela. Her husband who currently works abroad gave her the initial capital. But since Minerva does not want to depend on her husband’s remittances she decided to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to have additional business capital. At the moment, Minerva and her son, Berrick Kyle, who is already 9 years old and currently in grade three, are still living in Minerva's parent’s house since they don’t have their own yet. Minerva hopes that they will have their own house someday, beside her parent’s home.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Mrs. Savoeung Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan, which consists of twenty people, is located in Preaek Pang village in Kandal Province. The members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Savoeung S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Keit Chamroeun, are grocers in the local village. Aside from this business, Mr. Keit Chamroeun is a farmer who cultivates rice on a piece of land to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate, so Mrs. Savoeung S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support a pump to make her crop more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory; the remaining three are attending the local school. Mrs. Savoeung S. did not come to take the loan, but her husband did so he is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds and for fuel for a pump to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: DemB. B. est un jeune chauffeur marié qui fait aussi du commerce de l’embauche (achat de moutons et de poulets à revendre). Parallèlement à ses activités de  transport il fait de l’embauche depuis plusieurs années. Père de quatre enfants il achète des moutons dans les marches hebdomadaires et les élève pour les revendre pendants les fêtes de tabaski. Ses revenues lui permettent d’entretenir sa grande famille.
texts.en:
DemB. B. is a young married man who works as a driver as well as raising livestock: buying lambs and chickens to resell. He has been doing this as well as his transportation job for several years. He has four children. He buys lambs at the weekly market and raises them to sell during the festival of Eid-al-Adha. His revenues allow him to support his large family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lambs and chickens

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. started selling fish nine years ago at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Hawa prepares and serves her customers with very tasty, good quality fish from her stand. She has a great spirit to convince her suppliers to get more fish when there is a high demand and supply is low. She used to sell fishe with her mother when she was a little girl.

Through she has gotten to know most of the fishermen at the seashore, she sometimes buys fish on a credit basis. Hawa buys stocks of fish and smoked them at a nearby stand. She has a large customer base that travels from other parts of the region to buy her fish. Hawa also trades in food stuffs like maize, peanuts etc. She takes stock of goods from northern Ghana.

Hawa is now 50 years old married and mother with six children. Currently four are in school and the other two are working. Hawa requests the loan to upgrade her stock of goods. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Otease’ which means ‘He Lives.’

loans.use: Buy more fish.

loans.name: Shukrona

texts.ru: Шарипова Шукрона проживает в горде Куляб.Возраст 20 лет, не замужем . Живет в родительском доме. Работает портнихой на дому.Занимается этим видом услуг один год. В данный момент хочет купить современную швейную машинку , для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых услуг-таких как вышивка. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом, который сможет дать ей эту возможность.
texts.en:
S. Shukrona lives in Kulob. She is 20 years old and is not married. She lives in her parents’ home. Shukrona works as a seamstress at home. She has been providing this service for a year. At this moment she would like to purchase a modern sewing machine in order to increase the types of services that she offers – such as embroidery. This is why she has turned to us for a loan which will be able to give her this ability.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Luci

texts.es:
La señora Luci pertenece al Banco Comunal “Huicungo”, vive en el Jr. Libertad Nº 551, Distrito Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 3 hijas mujeres y 02 varones, es profesora en un centro educativo de educación primaria. 

Con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos al sueldo de profesora que recibe, motivada por una amiga decidió iniciar, en sus ratos libres, la venta de productos de belleza pedidos por catalogo de la línea EsiKa, CyZone y Avon, poco a poco fue haciéndose de su propio stock.

Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicado en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, comprará para incrementar su stock de productos: perfumes, colonias, lociones y desodorantes para damas y caballeros; polvos, cremas, maquillajes de rostro, lápiz labiales y esmaltes.

Luci tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Luci belongs to the “Huicungo” communal bank. She lives on Libertad Street, Huicungo District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the San Martín Department. She lives with her common-law husband, she is 44 years old, and has 3 daughters and 2 sons. She is a primary teacher at a school. With the goal of increasing her income in addition to the teacher’s salary she receives, and motivated by a friend, she decided to start selling beauty products in her free time. She sells products from the EsiKa, CyZone, and Avon lines, which are ordered from catalogs. Over time she has been building her own stock. She continues her business from her home, where her main customers are her neighbors and friends. She tells us that things are going well for her because she has permanent clients who make monthly orders. With the loan of 1,100.00 PEN, she will increase her stock by buying: perfumes, colognes, lotions and deodorants for men and women; also powders, creams, foundation, lip sticks, and nail polishes. Luci has a happy personality and charisma for selling to her customers. She comments that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization provides women with the same opportunities to develop and make progress as men.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cosmetics for her stock

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna M. makes a living selling soda and is seeking a loan to buy more crates of soda to sell. She is 41 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. With the extra income generated by this loan, she hopes to build her own shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Vali

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мирзоев  Вали – мужчина  1961  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  3  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  куплей-продажей  скота.  Недавно  его  жена  Шокирова  Мумина  посоветовала  ему  обратиться  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  полученный  кредит  они  решили  купить  дойную  корову  с  телёнком.  Вали  очень  любит  свою  работу,  так  как  занимается  этим  с  юных  лет.  В  будущем  он  хочет  продолжить  сотрудничество  с  «Микроинвест»  и  на  полученный  займ  он  планирует  расширить  коровник.
texts.en:
Vali M. was born in 1961, is married and has three children. He is engaged in the care and trade of cattle. Recently, his wife Mumina Shokirova advised him to apply for a loan from MLF MicroInvest. Upon receiving the loan, they decided to purchase a dairy cow with a calf. Vali very much likes his work, in that he has been involved in this work since his youth. In the future, he wants to continue collaboration with MicroInvest and upon receiving a loan he plans to expand the cowshed. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cattle

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y es madre de 02.  Tiene estudios superiores (profesoras de educación primaria). Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lana acrílica.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de lana acrílica para elaboración de artesanías, como títeres de dedo, guantes, chalinas, etc.

Su mayor  deseo es ejercer su carrera, pero por mientras seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia.

A ella le gusta la solidaridad que existe en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Community Bank "Cajas Reales" located in the Chucuito district in Puno. She is 37 years old and she is married common law. She is mother of 2. She completed post-secondary education (primary school teacher). She lives in the community of Chinchero in the San Bartolome sector.

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 2 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles which was invested in the purchase of acrylic yarn.

She now requests a loan in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles to purchase more acrylic yarn used in the creation of her craft, such as finger puppets, gloves, scarves, etc.

Her greatest wish is to have a career in her field of studies, but for now she has to keep at her work to be able to provide for her family.

She appreciates the spirit of collegiality found in the Community Bank.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica a go-getter and an ambitious lady who left employment as a civil servant in 2003. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. Besides this, she is taking care of an orphan who is studying nursing in a private college. With the rising cost of education and with a burning desire to see that her children get the best, she ventured into business. 

Having been a civil servant, she had already identified her target clients. She immediately started importing textile materials and selling them to her clients. With a need and demand for other accessories, she is now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of clothes, bed sheets and shoes.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes (purchase bed sheets and shoes)

loans.name: Qart-E-One Group

texts.en: This is the Qart-e-one group. It is made up of three female members. Kubra is the group leader. Each of them would like to take a loan to expand her business and bring some new changes into her life. Kubra would like to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit cart. With the money he would like to buy more and different kinds of fruits. Freba wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She has been a tailor for more than 6 years. She wants to buy a new sewing machine. Lida wants to take a loan for bead working. She can sew nice things using beads and now she wants to buy the materials required for her business. They have requested a total group loan of 30000 Afghani. They would like to mention that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: Buying materials to expand their businesses

loans.name: Resma

texts.en:
Resma B. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Resma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Resma operates a business running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Resma has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2005, Resma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Resma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Resma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 46 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks to make a living. She is happy with her business because she has lots of customers that patronize her business and she hopes to expand this business.

Peace is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es: María Celina D. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una sala D. bellaza la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. María Celina posee varios años D. trabajar en la cosmetología y es una señora con muy buenas referencia por su excelente trabajo. Gracias a esto ella logra obtener muy buenas ganancias las cuales le permiten ayudarle a su esposo a mejorara la estabilidad económica D. su hogar. María solícita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda comprar más productos D. primera calidad para su negocio y D. esta manera mejorar sus márgenes D. ganancias.

loans.use: Comprar productos de bellesa.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 38 years old and married with five children.  She sells provisions and drinks to make a living and has been in this business for seven years.

Magdalene hopes to obtain the loan of N60,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Teresa Soledad

texts.es: La joven Teresa P. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera de oficios comerciante,  “Venta de Dulces y algodones”, habita junto  con su familia, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con una  máquina para hacer dulces, llevan  tiempo ya  de vender su residencia que se encuentra en el  Paraje Xeatzam, Cantón Nimapa, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa Pretzntzin is 23 and single. She sells sweets and cotton candy. She lives with her family. She and her family do the same work. They have a machine to make sweets, and they have been selling for some time. Her home is located in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn E. is from the village of Zone 2, San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a rice farmer and also has a hog raising business. She is 49 years old and has three children. The income she receives is not enough to provide their needs. She would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to buy supplies for her business. She started her business in 2000. She is a widow but still determined to continue managing her businesses.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 58 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She lives with her family in Malanga Nambale. Regina has been in the cereal business since 1989. She buys cereals in bulk from farmers during harvesting seasons and then sells the cereals when prices improve. This enables her to make good returns. This harvesting season, she plans to buy several bags of maize with a loan of Ksh 25,000 that she has requested.

loans.use: Buy stock of cereals in bulk

loans.name: Sulaba

texts.en:
Sulaba, 60 years old, is a widow with five children. She sells soft drinks and has been in her business for the past five years. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000, which she will use to invest in buying beverages in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable, particularly to ensure a strong future for her children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell

loans.name: Felix Cantalicia

texts.es:
la sra. Felix Cantalicia G. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la colonia la Sosa de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Cantalicia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad. todos los dias tiene una produccion grande de tortillas, se levanta temprano para empezar su produccion.
las tortillas es un alimento que se consume en los tres tiempos de comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). es una costumbre en Honduras.
la sra. Cantalicia en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales al por mayor, asi tiene mas ganancias. ademas que ahora los pedidos son mas grandes y no logra cumplirle a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felix Cantalicia G. is 49 years old and lives in the Sosa neighborhood in Tegucigalpa. Cantalicia’s job is to make and sell tortillas, which she has been doing for several years. Every day she gets up early to start work and makes a large batch of tortillas. A custom in Honduras is that tortillas are a food that are eaten three times a day (breakfast, lunch and dinner). Mrs. Cantalicia needs a loan at this time to purchase wholesale materials, so she can increase her earnings. She also is receiving more orders and is having a hard time keeping up.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy firewood, water and corn flour to make tortillas

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola has a shop where she sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Bola is 47 years old, married and has four children. Her youngest child is 6 years old. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the family. She hopes to change her children’s school to a better one. She hopes to give her children quality education.

Bola is requesting a loan 100,000 nairas to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. She says thank you and promises to repay her loan promptly.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Fayzinisso

texts.ru: Мусоева Файзиниссо проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 33 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Файзиниссо более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает оващи. В этой деятельности ей помогает муж. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Файзиниссо хочет получить хороший урожай для продажи. У нее клиенты которые покупают оптом.
texts.en:
Fayzinisso M. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Fayzinisso has been a plant grower for more than six years. She grows vegetables. Her husband helps her with this business. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Fayzinisso wants to gather a good harvest for resale. Her customers buy in wholesale from her.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco S. U.  se dedica a brindar servicio de Contabilidad a empresas y personas Naturales, el  horario de trabajo de este cliente es de 8am a 5pm, tiene su pequeña oficina en su casa de habitación, tiene 4 año de laborar en esta actividad.  

Este crédito que solicito es para el mejoramiento de su vivienda realizar repello de la casa , y el plan de inversión es Compra de cemento, arena , pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Francisco S. U. is a public accountant; he provides services to individuals and to businesses. He works from 8 am until 5 pm. He has a small office in his home and has been in this line of work for 4 years. The loan will be used to make improvements to his house; particularly sealing the walls. He plans to buy cement and sand and to pay for labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia owns a one-hectare field in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur where she farms rice. She needs additional capital to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and asks for a loan of 14,000 Php which will help her a lot in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan G. has been a member of ASHI since 2009. The loan she received then was used to support the growth of her hog breeding and fattening business. Once fattened pigs are sold after four months, or piglets from breeding are sold for fattening, the profits are used to support the maintenance of her tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for her transportation business. 

Aside from her husband’s small income as an employee of a cooperative office in their municipality, the proceeds of Susan’s business supply a large amount of her family's needs, especially the educational expenses of her three children. 

Soon, Susan’s eldest child will go to college and also her second child will follow in the next couple of years. Because of this, Susan really wants to grow her business to gain more profits and fulfill her dream of seeing her children graduate from college. To achieve this, Susan is requesting a much larger loan through ASHI. Along with that financial assistance, she is certain that through her determination and courage to undertake whatever challenges growing a business will bring, someday she will be able to make it stable and profitable. She is also looking forward to having a sound revenue for the family.

loans.use: To buy medicine and vitamins for a piggery

loans.name: Retchie

texts.en:
Retchie P. is from the village of Promiseland, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Retchie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Retchie owns & operates a business selling dried fish in the local community by peddling. Retchie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Retchie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Retchie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Retchie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Joffre Andrubal

texts.es:
Joffre Andrubal A. P.  tiene 23 años, es soltero,  tiene 3  hijos, Kimberly de 5 años, Juan  de 3 y  Sebastián de año 7 meses,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Joffre trabaja en la agricultura  y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, cebada, arbeja, trigo, maíz.   Vende los productos en los mercados de Guaranda. 
Joffre solicita el crédito para comprar abonos químicos para sus cultivos.  Su meta es de obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar su forma de vida de sus hijos.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son demanda de productos y baja de precios en el mercado. Joffre en sus tiempos libres les ayuda a realizar los deberes a su hijo Sebastián.
texts.en:
Joffre Andrubal A. P. is 23 years old, single, and has three children: 5-year old Kimberly, 3-year old Juan, and 7-month old Sebastian. They all live in the San Francisco de Rumì precinct, about an hour and a half from the San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar County. Joffre is a member of the rural bank, San Francisco de Rumí pamba, which is composed of 25 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. Joffre works in agriculture and is the main breadwinner in his family. The most popular crops in the area are potatoes, barley, peas, wheat, and corn. He sells his products at the Guaranda market. Joffre is seeking out a loan in order to be able to purchase chemical fertilizers for his cultivations. His objective is to obtain a better harvest so that he can improve his children's quality of living. The challenges that he faces are the increase in product demand and the lowering of market prices. During his free time, he helps care for his baby son, Sebastián.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more zinc, door locks, and nails

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mr. Neang T. became a local farmer when he was single, but now he is married with four children, one of whom is now married and the other three are single. His wife is a pig breeder who has been experienced in this sector for many years. Mr. Neang was busy when the photo was taken so his wife is pictured instead.

To earn extra income, Neang T. always goes to buy firewood from the forest and delivers it to his house for sale. He says that he also hires a villager’s cart at a high price to help pick up his chop-wood from the forest, but now he wants to cut down on the hiring fee.

So, Neang T. is requesting a loan to buy a cart to provide delivery for his business.

loans.use: To buy a cart to provide delivery for his business

loans.name: God’S Knowledge Group

texts.en:
L. V., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Knowledge. He is 36 years old, single, and has seven children, who are between the ages of 2 and 14 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial reasons.

For 7 years, he has been selling drinks (alcoholic beverages) in Thinkers village Community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his portion of this group loan (6,000 Liberian Dollars of the 30,000 Liberian Dollars total) to buy more drinks. He describes himself as a very determined person. His dream is to expand his business and to get involved in the wholesale retail business.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional drinks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man and father of one child who is attending high school. He has owned a blacksmith shop in Lebanon since 1984. He has a large experience in this profession and over the years he has gained a strong reputation and a good number of clients. He is the main provider of his family with his business. With his loan request for US $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. , he wants to replace and repair the equipment he uses for his work in addition of purchasing a special tool to cut iron. He hopes that it will help develope his business and earn more profit to be able to continue satisfying his family needs and paying to finish his child's high school and continue on to  university. His main objective is to see his only child graduating from university that why he works hard.                                                                       

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: replace and repair the equipment he uses for his work and to purchase a special tool to cut iiron

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai N. was born in 1951 and she is living in Angk Sangkae village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and she also sells mosquito nets and blankets. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Prum, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Now her pig breeding is going so well that she wants to expand her business. So to improve this goal, Mrs. Hai N. is seeking for a loan to buy pig food, a pump machine, and the rest of the loan she will buy a new motorbike for transportation. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a clerk while the other is studying in the local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy pig food and a pump machine.

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Mar se encuentra conformado por Dina Guadalupe Pavón O., Margelia del Socorro B., Martha Lisbeth A. Solís y Calidonia F., cuatro mujeres que se desempeñan en distintas actividades económicas y sin embargo comparten la solidaridad en la lucha por salir adelante.

Dina de 38 años es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene una pulpería desde hace 7 años, sin embargo ahora tiene más productos y más artículos que le ayudan a la operación de su negocio como son un frízer, un estante, entre otros; Margelia es comerciante de productos AVON y realiza trabajos de costura por encargos; Martha vende carnes y verduras en su casa de habitación y así mismo los oferta de manera ambulante; por último, Carolina vende ropa tanto nueva como usada.

El sueño de ellas es que sus hijos, cuya mayoría se encuentra en la adolescencia, lleguen a ser grandes profesionales y que ellas puedan brindarles todo lo que necesiten para lograrlo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Mar” (The Sea) consists of Dina Guadalupe Pavón O., Margelia del Socorro B., Martha Lisbeth A. Solís, and Calidonia F.. These four women work in different business activities, but what they have in common is their struggle to get ahead.

Dina is 38 years old and serves as the group coordinator. She started a grocery store seven years ago. Even though she is now stocked with more products and merchandise, what would help her business stay in operation is a freezer, shelving, and other supplies. Margelia is a saleswoman who offers Avon products and also takes on sewing jobs by accepting orders. Martha sells meats and vegetables from her home and as a street vendor. Finally, Carolina sells both new and used clothing.

Most of these women have children who are teenagers, so their dream is to provide them everything they need to become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer, shelving, and other supplies

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira M. lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 56 years old, married and has two grown-up children.  She worked for 16 years in a kindergarten as a nurse and was one of the dearest friends to the children.  Zamira’s husband is a metal turner.  

The breaking up of the Soviet Union with its collective farm structure knocked many people out of their habitual way of life, but Zamira considered it a chance to renew her life.  19 years ago, in order to support her family, Zamira began her business of cattle breeding and farming.  She purchased a desolate sheepyard, where her family started to breed livestock. Thanks to persistent work, their livestock expanded and today it amounts to two milch cows, one horse, and 20 sheep. 
  
Zamira plans to use the loan of 55,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing 22 sheep. With the revenue from this investment, Zamira plans to renovate her sheepyard and buy  a cart. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis L. es un señor trabajador quien tiene un centro recreativo llamado La Casa del Obrero, donde se realizan bailes al ritmo del chacha, rumba, tango y hasta cumbia.

Es uno de los centros más reconocidos donde las generaciones se reúnen para disfrutar de una hermosa tarde desde los señores mayores hasta los más jóvenes de las familias.

El invertirá el crédito en productos como bebidas, comida etc. para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose Luis L. is an industrious gentleman who has a recreational center called La Casa del Obrero (The House of the Laborer), where he holds dances to the rhythm of the chacha, rumba, tango and even cumbia. It is one of the most well known centers where the generations gather to enjoy a beautiful afternoon from older gentlemen to the youngest in the families. He will invest the loan in products such as beverages, food etc. for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for products such as beverages, food and music for his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she operates tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units office covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes J. is 19 years old and single. She is currently in the business of distilling and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Leila Del Socorro

texts.es: Leila Del Socorro tiene 59 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, con la ayuda de su esposo por lo que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ha tenido ciertas dificultades, por las constantes lluvias que se habían presentado esto no le permitía salir a vender a las calles la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, los productos que ofrece son cremas, calzado, toallas, sabanas, ropa en general, ropa interior entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios pues siempre se ha caracterizado por brindar un buen servicio. El crédito es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, calzado, cosméticos y otros productos varios.
texts.en: Leila Del Socorro is 59 years old. She works selling general merchandise. It has been more than 10 years since she started this business. With the help of her husband, she supports 2 dependent children. She has had some difficulties such as the constant rain that prevents her from going out to sell in the streets the variety of products that she offers her customers. She sells creams, shoes, towels, sheets, basic clothing and underwear, among other things. She dreams of providing her family the necessary income because she has always been known to provide good products and services. The loan she is requesting is to buy inventory such as clothes, towels, cosmetics and other various products.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: John Njung'e

texts.en:
John is married to Pauline and a father of two children aged 24 and 26 years. He has been doing dairy farming for over 20 years and that has been his primary business. They live in Rironi center near Limuru town, and the area is known to be relatively busy in terms of business and agricultural activities.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member and this will be his second loan with KADET. He has not borrowed from other financial institution before. With this loan he plans to buy another dairy cow for more milk production. 

He hopes and desires to give his family a good life and better education.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Francisca Bremilda

texts.es:
Francisca Bremilda T. R. tiene 60 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los nietos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 7 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Francisca  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta realizar sus tareas dentro de su hogar y ayudar al esposo en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Francisca Bremilda T. R. is 60 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and their grandchildren in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 7 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in  Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Francisca has been growing corn, rice and beans for 8 years. Francisca is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Francisca likes doing her household chores and helping her husband with their harvests.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Nkuranyabahizi

texts.fr: J. C. NKURANYABAHIZI  est marié, et il a 3 enfants entre 4 ans et 10 ans.  Il a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter du ciment, sable, et planches pour la construction.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour augmenter l’activité.  Il voudrait avoir une maison, et la réhabiliter et retourner a l’école pour continuer et  terminer ses études.
texts.en: J. C. NKURANYABAHIZI  is married. He has three children between the ages of four and ten. He went to primary school and all is children are going to school. He will use his loan to purchase cement, sand, and boards for construction. His strategy to grow the business is to set aside money to increase his activity. He would like to have a house, to restore it and to go back to school to continue and finish his studies.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sheet metal, trees, screws, three-layer boards and wood planks

loans.name: Bosion Group

texts.en: Khadija M., on the left in front, is in her early twenties and married with one child of seven. She has had a beauty salon for five years and works from 7.00 am to 8.00 pm daily, making a fair monthly profit. This will be Khadija's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy salon equipment. She will share this loan with her loan group, Bosion, which has 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other acountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Din N. is divorced and lives with her three children. One of her children is married and two are single and earn an average income of $1.70 a day. Din N. earns her income by farming. Din N. would like to try growing a dry-season rice field, but she does not have capital to do so yet. To solve this problem, Din N. would like a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es: Maria Milagros se dedica a la elaboración de productos químicos, inicio a este negocio hace 11 años, siempre le ha gustado esta actividad ya que lo aprendió por cuenta propia, ya que con el tiempo es que fue logrando obtener mucha más experiencia. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar sus productos ya que son muy deliciosos por la combinación de aroma que realizan. Ella decide realizar este crédito para la compra de químicos, colores, botellas, bolsas, estantes entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo cada día más.
texts.en: Maria Milagros makes perfumes. She started this business 11 years ago and she has always enjoys this business. She has always liked it because she learned on her own. With time she has accumulated a great deal of experience. The majority of her clients look for products with beautiful scents produced by a combination of aromas. With this loan she expects to purchase perfumes, coloring agents, bottles, bags, stands, and other merchandise. Her dream is to improve her business and to make it grow more every day.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes and other home products. Her husband Armando, who is 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 15 to 31 years old. Two of her children have their own families, three are working to help support the family and the two youngest children are currently going to school. Rita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell to save up for future business expansion and her children's education. Rita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

Rita is shown in the accompanying photo with some of the personal and home products that she sells.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing oil, rice and powdered milk for her shop

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Noemí; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras para luego llevarlo a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a distribuirlo a todos sus clientes ella viaja cada semana y se queda unos días por alla, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería de verduras y así poder abastecer a sus clientes y nuevo clientes que le están solicitando.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Noemi is a member of the community bank SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA [Lord of the Miracles of Chipahuaylla], located in the San Jerónimo district in the province and department of Cusco.

Noemi is 35 years old, separated, and has two children.  She balances her daily activities with her business, which buys and sells vegetables.  She later brings them to the city of Puerto Maldonado to distribute them to all of her customers.  She travels every week and stays a few days there.  Noemi has done well with this business, which makes her feel happy, because it is helping her improve her family's life.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase more vegetables so that she can supply all of her customers and the new customers that are ordering.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables so that she can supply her customers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is a widow and has three children, all of whom are in school. Regina has a business of selling fruits. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works five days out of every week. She also rents out homes as an additional source of income. 

Regina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more melons, passion fruit, and pineapple. The main business challenge for Regina is seasonality. Her goal is to build more houses. 

Regina lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of passion fruit, watermelon and pineapple

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase equipment and expand his barber shop

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, en esta parroquia hay hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura, son muy amables y gentiles.

La Señora. María tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 18, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo trabajan y estudian en el colegio, su segundo y cuarto hijo trabaja y le ayudan  economícamente, su quinta hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora en su taller de carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María trabaja como empleada domestica, esta labor la realiza hace 3 años, su horario es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. En  su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es tener un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Ms. María C. is a member of the Corazón de Jesús [Heart of Jesus] communal bank. She lives in the community of Corazón de Jesús, which belongs to the El Valle parish. This parish has many beautiful places to visit. Its people work in commerce, animal husbandry, and agriculture, and are very friendly and kind.

María is 42 years old, married, and has six children who are 25, 23, 20, 18, 14 and 12 years old. Her first and third-oldest sons work and study in high school. Her second and fourth-oldest sons work and help out economically, her fifth-oldest daughter is studying in a high school in the city, and her youngest son is in a school in the community. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop and together they have been able to build their own house.
 
María works as a domestic worker, which she has been doing for three years. Her work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon from Monday to Friday. At home, she raises guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens.

Her goal is to own a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Gladys Livia

texts.es:
Gladys de 46 años de edad es soltera, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de San José.  En la cual los pobladores desarrollan como actividad principal la pesca, comercialización de pescado y crianza de aves de corral.

Gladys se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco en forma ambulatoria en los diferentes  mercados de la zona,  desde hace 3 años, su producto lo oferta por las calles de la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque, ya que cuenta con clientela que le hace pedidos fijos.  La venta de sus productos la ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades  diarias.

A solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más pescado fresco y a la  vez  pescado  salado, lo que le permitirá incrmentar sus ingresos para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  La meta que se a propuesto Gladys es tener en un futuro un negocio que sede dedique a la venta al por mayor de pescado a  empresas grandes (como mercados y supermercados) con esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Gladys is 46 years old, single, and lives in a home of her own that includes basic services; running water and electricity.  The home is located in the San Jose district, where its inhabitants are engaged in fishing, fish selling, and raising poultry.

Gladys has been buying and selling fresh fish in the zone’s different markets for three years.  She offers her product on the streets of Chiclayo and Lambayaque because she has customers who place orders with her.  Her sales help her cover her daily needs.

She has requested a loan of 800 PEN thought Edpyme Alternativa to buy more fresh and salted fish.  This will allow her to increase her income, repay the loan, and improve her quality of life.  The goal that Gladys has committed to is that through hard work and effort, have a business in the future, where she will sell fish in quantity to large companies (such as markets and supermarkets).

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Adjeniya 1 Group

texts.fr: ADJENIYA 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Bénédicte. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier et pratiquent la même religion. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Bénédicte est née en 1975 au Bénin. Bénédicte est mariée à sourou un couturier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à charge dont trois sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Bénédicte vend divers produits à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Bénédicte vend des boissons non alcoolisés. Bénédicte exerce ce métier depuis près de cinq ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari , d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Bénédicte s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Bénédicte et aux autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA 1 de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Adjeniya 1 is a group of three people, with a president named Bénédicte (whose hand is raised in the photo).  The group’s members live the same neighborhood and adhere to the same religion.  To increase its working capital, the group is asking for its second loan from Alidé.  Bénédicte was born in Benin in 1975.  She is married to a tailor named Sourou.  The couple is responsible for four children, three of which are their own.  All the children attend school.  Since dropping out of elementary school, Bénédicte has been selling various items out of her home.  Alongside this business, she also sells non-alcoholic beverages.  Bénédicte has been working in this business for five years, enabling her and her husband to cover their family’s expenses.  She buys her supplies in a city in Benin.  This second loan will likely enable Bénédicte and her group to improve their businesses, expand their customer base and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and various other products

loans.name: Ret

texts.en: Ret, aged 29, is a humble villager living in the province of Siem Reap. She is married and blessed with four school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. She is a homemaker and does many routine duties such as cooking delicious meals, caring for her children, cleaning the house, and managing the property in and around her house. Ret wishes to purchase a few fish to sell in the busy market to earn additional income and also to help support her husband with daily expenses. That is the reason why Ret is seeking a Kiva loan through HKL.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Provincioa de Maputo, sul de Moçambique é casado e pai de 2 filhos de 03 e 06 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Frequenta 12ª classe e nunca parou de estudar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Magude para Maputo ao encontro dos seus pais que ja residiam nesta ciadade. Trabalha no Ministerio da Educação como docente ha mais de 7 anos e tem um salario de 3.903.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e sempre tem conseguido poupar algum  na sua conta bancaria porque a sua esposa tem ajudado nas despesas de casa.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 15.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para aplicar na conclusaõ da sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel was born in Magude District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has two children, 3 and 6 years old. The eldest goes to school. Gabriel attends 12th grade and has never stopped studying. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

He left Magude to come to Maputo in search of his parents, who were already living in the city. He has worked for the Ministry of Education as a teacher for more than seven years and has a salary of 3,903 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and has always been able to save some money in his bank account because his wife helps with household expenses.

Gabriel has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan, and he is asking for 15,500 meticais which he will use to buy construction material (stone, cement, iron, sand and other items) to continue construction on his house.

He is confident that he will pay off this loan with no problems, and he will ask for more loans to finish his house and make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, cement, iron, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Jackline Amanclu

texts.en:
She Want more income for her business expansion,and paying children to school.
she have 6 children 4 are schooling she is a widow

loans.use: Fish purshes & Sale.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 43 years old, is selling food. Her husband is a soldier and their income is 13 USD per day. She has 3 children, 21, 18, and 13 years old. All are studying. Every month, she has to spend 50 USD on food, 12 USD on electricity, 60 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 500 USD for buying supplies to make food and stuff related to her business in order to sell more. She plans to extend her career by selling more food as she gets more customers. For her children, she wants to send them to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy goods for making food to sell

loans.name: Lucy Yadira

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Lucy, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  10, 9 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agente vendedor. Ella aprendió corte y confección hace varios años en una academia en Rocafuerte.

Nuestra amiga tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, confecciona ropa de damas y de niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 luego que sus hijos se van a su escuela y  hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene que entregar algún pedido, ella dice que nuca recibe más de lo que puede hacer ya que tiene que dejar tiempo para sus hijos y tampoco le gusta quedar mal con sus clientes.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que estos le ayudan mucho. 

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande con mas maquinas y operarias.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "La Union Hace La Fuerza" of the canton of Rocafuerte meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals and they are renowned throughout the entire country.

This is where Lucy lives. She is 33 years old, married, and from her relationship she has three children, aged 10, 9, and 2. The two eldest are in primary school. Her husband is a sales agent. She learned tailoring many years ago at an academy in Rocafuerte. 

Our friend has had a small tailoring shop in her house for several years and she has crafted clothing for ladies and children. She works by taking orders from individual clients who visit her house. She works every day from 8am, once her children have gone off to school. She finishes at 10pm and sometimes even later when she needs to fill an order. She says that she never takes on more than she can complete because she wants to keep some time for her children. She also doesn't like to disappoint her clients.

This new loan will be used to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she appreciates it for the loans, which have been a great help.

Her dream is to have a larger shop equipped with more sewing machines and with hired workers.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: The picture above show Aba displaying some smoked fish for sale. She is a fishmonger at Abura. She is married to a cleaner and has been in the business for five years. She responsibly assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke to re-sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke and then sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, administra una tienda, vive con su esposa y una hija de 15 años de edad, él posee la tienda desde hace 17 años, esta surgió por la necesidad, pero actualmente se encuentran otras tiendas cercanas que le hacen la competencia.
Actualmente quiere fortalecerla con la compra de mercadería como huevos, frijoles, gaseosas, jugos, pan, aceite, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar la atención a los clientes y las ventas, logrando ganar más afluencia de estos.
Su objetivo es que a través de préstamos pueda aumentar la mercadería en la tienda, atrayendo a nuevos clientes para que sus ganancias sean mejores para la familia.
texts.en:
Juan manages a store.  He lives with his wife and 15-year-old daughter.  He has had the store for the last 17 years.  It arose out of need, but currently there are other stores nearby which are posing competition.

Currently he wants to strengthen his business by purchasing merchandise such as eggs, beans, soda, juice, bread, and oil.  This investment will help him improve his customer service and his sales, bringing him more affluence.

His goal is that through these loans, he can increase his store's merchandise and attract new customers so that his earnings will be better for his family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, beans, soda, juice, bread and oil for his store.

loans.name: Kheyran

texts.en: Kheyran is a gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and raising livestock for the past four years. He is married and has two children. His wife actively helps him, and his monthly income is $200 USD. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason, he is seeking a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Yesica Higinia

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Yesica Higinia, tiene a su cargo dos persona es luchadora, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para consolidar deuda  con una institución bancaria de CITIBANK en la unificación de  deuda de una tarjeta de crédito.
texts.en:
In the city of Nicaragua, Yesica Higinia is supporting 2 people.  She is a tenacious and responsible person with good values and moral principles.

She came to this office of CEPRODEL to request a loan to use to consolidate credit card debt that she has with the Citibank financial institution.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is from the village of Martkopi in East Georgia. He lives in the village with his parents. He is a worker. Along with his main job, he helps his parents with the family dairy farm. They have four milk cows and sell milk and yogurt in Tbilisi (the capital of the country). The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris (approximately $240). 

Akaki requested a loan to purchase calves. The family has enough space in the cattle-shed. They will grow the calves during winter and sell them for a profit in the spring. The family will get additional income. Akaki plans to save it for purchasing a milk cow, in order to expand the dairy farm and increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 to 26 years. She describes herself as being ambitious and loving. She operates a charcoal sales business where she sells charcoal and sawdust to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to the stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to grow her business into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify to a timber sales business.

loans.use: To add to the stock of charcoal

loans.name: Norma Alicia
