texts.es: La Sra. Norma Alicia realiza la produccion y comercializacion D. pan casero, esta actividad la realiza hace cuatro años junto con su esposo el Sr. Rolando, la mencionada actividad les ha permitido sustentar a la familia y poder comprarse un lote en el cual solo pudieron construir una vivienda precaria sin poder poner sus documentos D. propiedad en regla, actualmente su actividad tiene una creciente demanda por tal motivo se encuentran con la necesidad D. ampliar su negocio viendose imposibilitados D. hacerlo debido a la compra D. su lote donD. invirtieron su dinero, es por esa razon que solicitan el prestamo ya que con el mismo compraran otro horno industrial y mayor cantidad D. materia prima e insumos.
texts.en:
Norma Alicia makes and sells home-maD. bread.  She’s been in this line of work for four years with her husband, Rolando.  This activity has allowed them to support the family and to buy a lot where they were only able to build a precarious dwelling and were unable to put their ownership documents in order.

At present, her activity has high demand so they need to expand the business but are unable to do so because they invested all their money into the lot they bought.  Because of this they are asking for the loan that will be used to buy an industrial oven and larger amounts of raw materials and supplies.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and raw materials for baking.

loans.name: 3.8.67 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Muôn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Muôn is 51 years-old and she is married with two children.  She is the leader of a seven member group, the 3.8.67 Quảng Hưng solidarity group.  Muôn lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Muôn joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her  business. Muôn has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Muôn has been involved in this business for two years.

The main harship that Muôn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Muôn hopes to remodel her house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang is 61 years old and married with four children. Now only one child is dependent. She earns a living as a farmer and her husband works as a district councillor in a village located in the Prey Chhor district. She has been farming on her rice field for 10 years. 

Seang has been with VisionFund since 2009. Since the previous loans with VisionFund, her family has better living conditions and increased crop yield. She successfully paid back the last loan with VisionFund. Now requesting another loan, she will use this one to buy fertilizer for her rice field and also use some of the loan to buy an old motorbike for her husband to use. 

She hopes this loan will help her to make more income, build on some savings for the future, and also keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Fel

texts.en:
Fel is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur:Philippines. Fel operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. He has been doing this for seven years and earns 11,150 PHP a month. 

Fel is requesting a loan for 45,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional products to sell. Fel has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, he hopes to see his children complete their education and to earn an increased income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en: Panha, 25, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Panha is an electrician for a hotel. Panha is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, his family is able to generate more income and decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to rent a stand at the market for his wife to sell groceries. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 26 year old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She runs a food stall in Dokuru bor, South Sudan, which she has been doing for one year.

Mary is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase onions and wheat flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase onions and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kpedetin 3 Group

texts.fr: KPEDETIN 3 est un groupement composé de treize personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèkannoudé Rosaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèkannoudé  Rosaline est âgée de 39 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Sèkannoudé Rosaline est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Raphaël. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés et cinq à leur charge.  Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Sèkannoudé Rosaline  et son mari. Pour cette raison, Sèkannoudé Rosaline vend des ustensiles de cuisine à son domicile depuis sept ans. Parallèlement à son activité, Sèkannoudé Rosaline  vend aussi des bijoux. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Sèkannoudé Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sèkannoudé Rosaline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement KPEDETIN 3, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 39 years old. She is a divorced and young lady entrepreneur who started her tailoring business at the age of 28 when she got separated from her husband. She is now into her eleventh year of business. She has two children. Her enterprise caters to part of the 800 population at a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. 

The present loan request of 35,000 INR is to enable her to stock material since the main market is not very accessible. She will use this loan to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses. This enables her to sustain her family of two children in their own 1,000 sq. ft. home. An expansion in the business will enable her to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose wants to buy 50 trays of eggs

loans.name: Oketch

texts.en:
S. Oketch is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and six school-aged children in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya. She received her training from KMET for home-based HIV/AIDS care and TB ambassadorship in 2004.

She runs a community pharmacy as her main business and source of income while improving access to basic drugs in the community. She supplements this by rearing pigs, which she sells to nearby butcheries. She currently has a total 30 piglets.

Given her reputation and the location of her pharmacy within her community, her business has flourished. The most commonly purchased drugs in her pharmacy are those to treat malaria, diarrhea, and syrups for children. S. credits her success to hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through two previous microfinance loans. She plans to use the $625 loan to expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo has a home on a piece of land that was given to him by his father. On his land he only has a few chickens and also some pigs. With the loan he hopes to invest in rice for the upcoming season. He will buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. He has two children, both of whom are still at home going to school. He hopes that, with the additional income, he can continue to feed his family and educate his two sons.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

He is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. They will use the microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that it is imperative for the communities it works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water from the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Farm rice

loans.name: Romana

texts.es:
Romana is a responsible, hard-working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has a son and a daughter who are 28 and 18 respectively. She and her husband began their own business 24 years ago to support their family. They opened their own hardware store taking advantage of her husband’s knowledge in the field. Little by little their business improved and sales grew. Thanks to the good service they provided, they have now realized the dream of opening two other small stores.

Romana and her husband want to continue growing as small business owners. Therefore they are requesting a loan for US$1,100 to purchase additional merchandise to offer a better variety of products that will best meet the needs of their customers. She commits to repay the loan within 5 months. Become an important part of the growth of this business. Romana thanks you for the opportunity you provide with your contribution which will improve and help grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Romana es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene un hijo y una hija, de 28 y 18 años respectivamente. Ante la necesidad de superarse como familia, hace 24 años ella y su esposo iniciaron su propio negocio, aprovechando los conocimientos y experiencia que su esposo tenía en este ramo iniciaron su ferretería, poco a poco fueron surtiendo mejor e incrementando sus ventas, gracias al buen servicio que ofrecen hoy pueden ver cumplido su sueño al abrir otros dos pequeños locales.

Romana y su esposo desean continuar creciendo como microempresarios, para esto están solicitando un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera tener un buen surtido en su ferretería y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Romana agradece la oportunidad que le brindas con tu contribución de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Docas

texts.en: Mrs. I. Docas rears pigs on her farm and sells them to people living in her community. She is 43 years of age, married, and the mother of 3 children. She is a leader of her union (LAPO). She needs a loan of $925 to buy more piglets for sale. She started this business in 1997.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Idahosa

texts.en: Mr. Idahosa O. is 48 years old, is married, and has six children.  He lives in Benin City in Edo State, where he has a pig farm. He spent three months learning pig rearing, and then he established his farm in 2004. He is requesting a loan of $800 to enable him to buy more pigs and feed for his farm. This will help him serve his customers better. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Gulnafisa

texts.en: Gulnafisa, 21, is not married. Her assortment of goods includes foodstuffs. Sales profits contribute to her family’s budget, as Gulnafisa lives with her parents. Gulnafisa joined MicroInvest in September and has already earned a reputation as an exemplary borrower. Gulnafisa plans to use her new loan for further expansion of her business.

loans.use: For further expansion of her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 24-year-old unemployed woman. She is married and has two children who are 7 and 3 years old. Her husband does seasonal work which is related to forestry. In that period, their monthly income is 500 KM (about US$375), but in the period when he does not work, the goats are their only source of income. Aida is not a new client; this is her second loan from Women For Women International in the amount of US$775. She used the first loan to buy goats. Thanks to the milk products of her goats, Aida can provide money and food for her family. Aida thinks that with a larger number of goats, she would be able to improve her life and the lives of her children.

loans.use: Buying goats and food supplies

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim S., 31, is married with two children and lives with her husband in Batambong province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of snacks at a busy market and typically earns around $5 a day. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and a farmer who grows rice. He makes around $7 a day. Mrs. S. hopes to use this loan to buy a small hand-tractor for her husband to use when plowing the soil on their farm.

loans.use: To purchase a small hand-tractor for her husband to use when plowing the soil on their farm.

loans.name: Kireka C1D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sophie K.. She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to purchase more quarrying equipment. Sophie is 35 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Sophie makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education. Sophie has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sophie is joined in her small group by Slimah D., Esther N., Sarah N., and Florence N.. Slimah D. has a business running a retail shop and wants to expand to wholesale. Esther N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to stock more commodities. Sarah N. operates a tailoring business and wants to purchase more fabric. Florence N. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy more hair dryers.

loans.use: To add capital to quarrying business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is the mother of two children.  She operates a general store in the Akomprom area of Obuasi.    She is a long-term (10-year) client with Sinapi and has been fortunate enough to build her own store, pictured here.  Akua is now requesting an additional loan to expand her inventory of canned products and maintain her profits.   She plans to use the profits from her business as a form of insurance in case she has trouble with repayments.  

Akua is a member of the trust group David.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more canned products

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Rehema M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 6. She has 2 dependents who live with her because they are street children. In 2007, Rehema established her soft drink business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of bar selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing--a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To buy more stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Lucino

texts.es:
Luciano, 39, has been happily married to Evangelista Gonzalez, 34, for 16 years. The couple has 2 children who are both in elementary school.

Luciano worked abroad for a private company but he returned to his native Paraguay in 2000. He decided then to use his small savings to start a carpentry shop. He now makes furniture which he later sells in the interior of the country. Luciano would like to expand his shop so that he can build more pieces of furniture and, in turn, increase his income.

He's applying for a loan to buy a truck. He has some money saved for it and, with the loan, he'll be able to more easily buy one on favorable terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Luciano Núñez de 39 años de edad está felizmente casado hace 16 años con la Señora Evangelista González de 34 años. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la primaria.

Don Luciano fue empleado de una empresa privada en el exterior, en el 2000, regreso a su país natal y fue cuando decidió emprender su propia carpintería con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba. Actualmente esta fabricando mubles para su posterior venta en el interior del país. Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su carpintería para llegar a fabricar mas muebles, y lograr así un mejor ingreso.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de un camión, ya que tiene un dinero ahorrado y junto con el crédito le va ser más fácil adquirir el vehículo al contado.

loans.use: Buy a truck.

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en:
Elmaddin (his sister is pictured) is 29 years old and single. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now living and working in the Mardakan settlement and has been selling phone accessories for 4 years.

Elmaddin needs a loan of $1200 to buy more telephone accessories to increase his inventory and supply his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Celinda Sonia

texts.es:
Celinda is an entrepreneurial woman who is counting on her development in her homeland, Colpar. She is 24 years old and is dedicated to raising pigs, which after some time, she will sell alive or sell parts according to the occasion that presents itself. She has been involved in this work since she was young and now surrounds herself with all sorts of agricultural work, which she learned from her mother. Her daily life involves caring for her pigs and feeding them three times a day. She keeps them in a separate place that was adapted as her farm. Celinda is mother to a small, three year old girl who is her whole driving force and reason for living. In order to support her daughter, she works day after day. Her goal is to have a cattle stable and she is working hard for this. At this time, she is requesting a loan which will be invested in the purchase of more animals and, in this manner, increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Celinda es una mujer emprendedora y apuesta su desarrollo en su propia tierra, Colpar, tiene 24 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que después de un tiempo venderá vivos o los beneficiados (partes) de acuerdo a la ocasión que se les presente. Se dedica a esta actividad desde niña, agradece a su madre que la enseñó todas las tareas agrícolas con las que ahora puede desenvolverse, su diario vivir consiste en cuidar a sus cerdos, alimentándolos 3 veces al día, los tiene en un lugar apartado, que adecuó como su granja.Celinda es madre de una pequeña de 3 años la cual es toda su fuerza y razón de vivir, por darle el sustento que necesita ella trabaja día a día, su meta es tener un establo de vacas, para lo cual esta trabajando duro. En esta ocasión solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más animales y de esa manera acrecentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase animals for her pig farm.

loans.name: Heun

texts.en: Mrs. Heun S., 30, is a seller who lives in Kchas Commune, Siem Reap Province. She has been selling groceries since 2006, earning around US$2.00 per day, while her husband, Mr. Yem Va, 31, sells chickens in the market. Heun would now like to expand her business and has requested a loan of US $800 to allow her to purchase more vegetables for resale. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income and support their family adequately.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for resale

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua la señora María Auxiliadora P. se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 1 año. Gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

A pesar de las dificultades económicas que ha atravesado, ha logrado mantener el negocio y se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de su mercadería. Una vez más solicita un préstamo y es de importancia destacar que se encuentra muy confiada que su petición será otorgada y de esta forma invertirá en su negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
In the town of Cuidad Sandino en Managua, Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora Perez has made a living over the past year from her small market. Thanks to her many efforts, she has been able to progress and bring food to her home. Aside from the economic difficulties that have transpired, she has been able to maintain her business and has been helped by the loans granted to her by Ceprodel. She has used these loans to purchase merchandise. Again, she is asking for a loan and emphasizes that she is hopeful her request will be approved, which she will invest in her small market.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Zawadi's Group

texts.en:
Zawadi has been selling sheets and fabrics in a shop in Zanzibar since 2007. She works daily from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and is able to earn a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may purchase more materials in bulk to sell for a greater profit.

Zawadi is 21 years old, single, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Andia and Farida.

loans.use: To buy more sheets and fabrics for her shop.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Исоева Шарифа жительница района Хуросон. 10 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков района в поселке Уяли. Торгует детской одеждой. Шарифа замужем и имеет четверых детей. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Она хочет завезти сезонный товар. Ее дело позволяет  покупать одежду прямо у себя в кишлаке , не выезжая в центр . Это позволяет экономить деньги на дорогу. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa I. lives in the Huroson District. She has been working in sales for 10 years. She sells children's clothing from her stall at one of the district markets, in the village of Uyali. Sharifa is married and has four children. She decided to request a loan in order to increase her sales volume. She wants to bring in seasonal goods. Her work allows her to buy clothing right in town, without leaving the center, which saves her traveling expenses. The loan will be repaid over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Luz Crisalda

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Ayni Village Bank; “Ayni” means “help one another” in Quechua. She is 54 years old and is a widow. She has three children, who have all graduated from college with professional degrees. Luz knits sweaters and decorative cloths in her free time, which she sells from her home. She works as an elementary school teacher during the week.

Luz is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to buy about 16 bags of high-quality wool for knitting.

Luz has been working with the Ayni Village Bank for five years now. Her goal for the future is to retire from teaching and start working with other women who knit and take orders for items.

loans.use: Buy 16 bags of high-quality wool for knitting

loans.name: Osioda A -1 Group

texts.en:
T. Angella (front row, center) is the representative of the Osioda A-1 group. She is 29 years old and sells secondhand clothes in the Kumi market. She sources her stock from the neighboring Mbale market. Her profit margin is 30-50%. Because 80% of her clients are ladies, T. is requesting a loan to replenish her stock of skirts, blouses, and dresses.

T. is hardworking and cooperative. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 5 years. Her dream is to open a trendy unisex boutique so that she can increase her income and enable her children to attend institutions of higher learning.

The other members of T.’s group are actively involved in various business activities such as selling fish, snacks, vegetables and milk, as well as local brewing.

loans.use: Purchase skirts, blouses, and dresses.

loans.name: Josefa Noemy

texts.es: Josefa Noemy R. D. M., es una mujer casada D. 32 años D. edad y con un pequeño hijo, resiD. en Cojutepeque departamento D. Cuscatlan, en El Salvador;  tiene más D. ocho años D. poseer su propio salón D. belleza, a través del cuál logra contribuir con los gastos del hogar, debido a que su esposo venD. CD´S y juguetes en una tienda y dichas ganancias no logran a cubrir los gastos del hogar, Josefa trabaja arduamente con el deseo D. sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo. Josefa solícita un préstamo, para poder incrementar nuevos productos D. belleza, y poder incluir al negocio juguetes, perfumería y ropa, con el fin D. poder percibir mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa Noemy R. D. M. is a married woman of 32 years of age. She has a small son, and lives in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlan, in El Salvador. She has worked for more than eight years in her own beauty salon, and because of this she is able to contribute to the expenses of the household, since her husband sells CDs and toys in a store and those profits aren’t enough to cover the expenses of the household. Josefa works arduously with the desire of improving the life of her small son. Josefa is asking for a loan in order to get new beauty products, and to be able to incluD. in the business toys, perfume, and clothing, with the goal of being able to get a better income for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and increase inventory in Josefa's shop

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana G. is fifty-four years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children; three boys and three girls. She says the last two of her children still in school (junior high). The rest are out of school and are working. Christiana’s husband is a trader. He trades in cement, lorry tires and other hardware. She lives with the family in a family house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Christiana trades in provisions and many other products such as soap, etc. to make some income to support her husband financially. She procures the goods from distributors in Techiman where prices are quite economical. Christiana does not sell in a store house but treks to sell her products. She has been in business for eight years. Christiana wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give their last two children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
HilA. is a 32-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. HilA. has owned a clothing shop for nine years. He requested a loan of $1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him yo open a new, bigger shop and to diversify his merchandise. HilA. is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started, he had difficulty building networks. HilA. decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open his own shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hilal will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer Group

texts.en:
“Unidos para Vencer”, or United to Overcome, is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their third microfinance loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid and they hope to use this third loan to further increase the prosperity of their existing businesses in the city of Santiago.

Marisol, mother of three (ages 9, 7, and 6), sells clothing from her home and on the streets of Santiago.  Marisol’s past two loans have been used to increase the volume of her business through additional purchases of men’s, women’s and children’s clothing, which has allowed for additional earnings.  Marisol plans to utilize her third loan in a similar manner, to purchase needed and popular clothing items.  Marisol is committed to the completion of her third loan.  She speaks with passion as she describes the clothing store she dreams of owning someday.

Other members of Marisol’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities.  All but one member sell clothing or undergarments, and the other member, the only male of the group, owns a small café.  

On behalf of Esperanza International and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Пирматов Бахтиер проживает в городе Яван. возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет троихъ детей. Всю жизнь занимается разведением и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает их и перепродает их на рынке. Процесс откормки занимает около 50 дней. сейчас планирует получить кредит и купить еще двоих бычков. Покупка принесет ему хороший доход, так как в данный момент нет проблем с кормом.
texts.en:
Permatov Bahtiyor lives in the city of Yavan. He is 37 years old, is married and has three children. He has been raising and selling livestock for his entire life. He purchases young bulls, fattens them and resells them at the market. The fattening process takes around 50 days. Right now he plans to take out a loan and to purchase two more bulls. The purchase will bring him a good income, because right now there are no problems with feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two bulls

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
La señora Lesly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Nº 472 Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, y no tiene hijos.

Lesly, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,700.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Lesly, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Lesly, member of the community bank "Las Margaritas II (The Daisies II)," lives at Jr. Cesar Vallejo Nº 472, Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her common-law husband and has no children.

Lesly is an efficient woman, who seeing the need to generate her own income, decided to implement her own business of grocery sales, which is located in her home. She began little by little and now she has already improved her business with a stock of products. Most of her clients are stay-at-home mothers who find everything they need. Presently she continues with the same business and tells us that it is going very well for her.

With the loan for 1,700 Soles, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, packs of noodles, boxes of milk and canned fish of various brands, cleaning products for the home, personal hygiene products, packages of cookies of different flavors and brands, and in this way satisfy her clients and offer them better service.

Lesly feels very satisfied with what she has achieved. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her to begin her business, helping her fulfill her dreams and goals, and for helping other women who want to grow economically.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to stock her store (rice, sugar, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion - Group 1

texts.en:
Francia Castelli and the rest of this group of five live in Batey 18 in La Romana. It is a small, isolated batey (a company town where sugar cane plantation workers live); barely two streets long. Almost all of its population are Haitian inmigrants. They go to La Romana (the main town in their province) to sell their goods, because a lot of the people from the batey sell the same products.

Francia and her husband, Andres Pie Charles, have two small children, ages 3 and 2. The house in which they live is owned by the sugar cane company that runs the plantation that surrounds the batey. The type of businesses that people in the batey can operate are very limited, so with this new loan, Francia will buy home products, like towels and sheets, to sell in La Romana on market days.

Francia would like to live in a place where she can set up a store and own her house. She believes that even though she is an immigrant, she can work to make her dreams come true in the Dominican Republic.

Please help us support Francia and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase home products to resell

loans.name: Poziljon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 
Валламинов  Позилжон – мужчина  1954  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  5-х  детей.  Более  10  лет  он  занимается  он  откормом  и  куплей-продажей  скота.  Ему  помогают  его  старшие  сыновья.  На  полученный  займ  он  решил  купить  дойную  корову  и  тем  самым  обеспечить  свою  семью  молоком.  Его  жена  Ахмеджонова  Зухра  продаёт  соседям  излишки  молока  и  пополняет  семейный  бюджет.  Они  рады,  что  обратились  в  нашу  организацию  и  благодарят  наших  партнёров.
texts.en:
Poziljon V. was born in 1954, married and has five children. For more than ten years, he has been involved in the care and trade of cattle. His older sons help him. On receiving the loan, he decided to buy a dairy cow and the same cow provides his family with milk. His wife Zuhra Ahmedjonova sells surplus milk to the neighbors and пополняет the family budget. They are glad that they applied to MLF MicroInvest and are grateful for the partnership. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing milk cows

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena V. M. tiene la edad de53 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, debido a la difícil situación económica del país decide, recorrer las diferentes calles en busca de clientes, ya que no solamente recorría estos lugares sino que también las comarcas aledañas, y fue así que su inventario fue creciendo debido a la buena administración que ella le proporciona a su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, faldas y camisolas. El sueño de Magdalena es comprar un lugar en donde pueda establecerse con sus productos.
texts.en:
Magdalena V. M. is a 53 year old single mother. She is raising one son. She sells clothes. She has been in this business for over five years. Due to the country’s difficult economic situation, she travels the different streets looking for customers. She not only goes to those places, but she also travels to neighboring regions. That is how her inventory has been growing; it is due to her good administration of the business. The loan she is asking for is to buy pants, shirts, underwear, skirts, and undershirts. Magdalena’s dream is to buy a place where she can establish herself with her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mboye

texts.fr: Mboye T., 32 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de porcs et le commerce de boissons. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer ses activités. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mboye T., age 32, is married and has six children to support. She is active in raising pigs and in the beverages business. She is requesting a loan to bolster her businesses. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs and for commerce in drinks

loans.name: Essowè Anti

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce une activité particulière : elle tisse elle-même des pagnes traditionnels, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 1988. Son stock est presque épuisé, c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l’achat de matériels de travail, en particulier 10 rouleaux de fils à tisser, en vue de moderniser son activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has a business that is special: she herself weaves traditional pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  This is work she has been doing since 1988.  With her inventory nearly exhausted, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy work supplies, especially 10 rolls of thread for weaving, with the aim of modernizing her business.  She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving supplies for her work

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn U., 44 years old. She lives in Parang, Marikina City, in the eastern side of Metro Manila. She is a single parent to her three children.

Jocelyn has a stall in the Concepcion Public Market. She has been selling fresh dressed chickens since 1983 and earns a monthly net income of P28,000.

Jocelyn needs a loan of P12,000 so she can buy more fresh chicken meat from the poultry farms. She has learned the value of saving money since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She saves a lot for the education of her children.


About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more fresh chicken meat from the poultry farms

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica sells provisions. She is 36 years old and married with three children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en: Consolacion R., 57 years old, and her husband, Rodoldo, 52, have been farming for thirty years now. They were lucky to have acquired a farm lot in Silang, Cavite, where the soil is very suitable for farming. Their children are already making their own families. The couple grows pineapples on their farm lot and, from their profits, they were able to secure funds for the renovation of their house. Consolacion says they earn at least P10,000 a month. Consolacion joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She loves the camaraderie of the women entrepreneurs. She is applying for a new loan in the amount of P10,000 which she will use to fund the next pineapple crop. She will purchase fertilizer, pesticides and other farming needs. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and other farming needs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 43-year-old married mother of four and a client of Asociación Arariwa.  Three of her children attend high school, while the other is in kindergarten.  Juana is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco.  The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish.  Juana is from Cusco and lives there.

Juana has sold sticks, firewood, and logs from her house for the past 3 years.  She earns about 1,500 Peruvian soles (or about $526 US) each month.  She will use this loan to pay for her children's monthly school fees, as well as their food and school uniforms costs.

Juana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To pay the monthly school fees for her children

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maricel R. N., 26 years old, is married and is a resident of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is married to an overseas seaman who is now currently working abroad. She is blessed with one child who is still a minor.

With a passion for business, Maricel decided to engage in business in order not to depend solely on the allotment from her husband. She started her rice retailing business two years ago with capitalization from her savings. Her first customers were her relatives and close friends and she has been able to sustain this business until this time. Presently, she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000 a month.

With a good credit record from her 1st loan of P15,000 she is now given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P30,000 to add to her capital. Now she is very happy in joining the Coop because she has learned many things, especially in our savings education program, which are very helpful not only for her but also for her child.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Ruth Claribel

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Claribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Unión y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella y están etapa escolar.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia, con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su negocio de venta, donde ella los atiende con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ruth Claribel, se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth Claribel is a member of the Union and Labor Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Departament of San Martín. She is 36 years old, single, and the mother of three dependent children who attend school.

Confident in her knowledge of preparing different types of food, Ruth Claribel decided to start her own business. She used her first loan of 300 soles to begin selling prepared foods out of her house, which is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. As time passed, she was able to build up a loyal customer base and continues to manage her business to this day. She welcomes each customer with her warm and charismatic personality.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as sacks of rice, sugar, packets of oil, cases of chicken, as well as utensils to help her continue her business and provide better service to her customers. Claribel Ruth feels strong enough to continue working in a successful manner so that she can secure a peaceful retirement for herself. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is thirty – four years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people in her region. Faustina is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. Faustina sells in a stall by the road side. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Trinidad tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La socia Trinidad es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia desde muy temprano del día hace sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a atender su negocio de venta de carne. Nuestra socia nos cuenta que ella compra ganado como res, cordero, chancho y alpaca y después lo vende como carne. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más chancho pues en esta época del año es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 46, married, and has four children. Trinidad is from the city of Urcos in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. The city of Urcos is 45 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is a trip of approximately 45 minutes. She starts her household chores very early in the day. For example, she prepares breakfast for her husband and children. After she does her household chores, she has to go to tend her business of selling meat. She tells us that she buys livestock like cows, sheep, pigs, and alpaca. She later sells it as meat. She has been in this business for 15 years. It has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business. She wants to buy more pigs. This time of year they sell more. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Eddy Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Eddy Manuel G., labora como vigilante de seguridad en el centro de capacitación Nicaragüense Alemán (CECNA), ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante un año y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el préstamo de Ceprodel.
Esta casado con cuatro hijos y dos de estos se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de perlines para su vivienda lo que anteriormente esta tenia cuartones de madera para su vivienda con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
texts.en:
Eddy Manuel G. works as a security guard in the Nicaraguan-German Training Center (CECNA). He has worked with Ceprodel for a year, and in this time he has improved his home with Ceprodel loans. He is married with four children, two of whom are school-aged. This credit is for the purchase of beams for his home, which were previously built with wood, so that he may provide a better lifestyle for his children, who depend on the support of their father.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en:
Fumilayo is 29 years old, married and has a child aged 9 years. Her husband is a mechanic and he also sells motor spare parts to support the home.

Fumilayo sells groceries and drinks to make a living. She hopes to own a big supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly and she says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Fumilayo is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena C. moves from place to place, customer to customer, selling clothes and materials at Elmina.  Philomena has a junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Philomena has been selling clothes and materials for some time now. She helps her husband pay the utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more materials and clothes for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children and also to buy land for her family.

loans.use: To buy more materials and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manuela Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Yolanda R. se dedica a la venta de refresco, gaseosas en el mercado la terminal. Trabaja cada día desde 6 de la mañana a las 5 de la tarde.

 Este crédito que solicito es  para  comprar mayor los  productos que vende  tales como: gaseosas, jugos, agua botella, y cacao, payana, azúcar, canela, frutas para elaboración de refrescos. Y  así tener mayor ganancia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora R. esta agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuela Yolanda sells soft drinks in the terminal market. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily. She is asking for this loan in order to buy goods in quantity, such as soft drinks, juices, bottle water, coco, payana, sugar, cinnamon, and fruit for refreshments. She wants to improve her income. She is grateful because her loans through CEPRODEL have helped her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and ingredients

loans.name: Goodluck

texts.en:
Goodluck is happy that his trade is doing well. He makes and sells cooking oil to sell at retail prices. He loves this business because of the profits he makes. The demands for his cooking oil are high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He is a hard working man and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more palm fruits to make more cooking oil to sell.

Goodluck lives in Benin City, Edo State. He is 41 years old and married without children. His wife is a teacher and he also supports the home. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits to make more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Jesusita

texts.en:
Jesusita M. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 51 years old and married with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jesusita owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Jesusita has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for her activities.

In 2010, Jesusita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her first loan taken out with HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a single 33-year-old woman. She has three other family members in her house, two of whom are also working. She has owned a beauty salon since 2000. She also sells lingerie from this location. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. This will be her third loan from Ameen. Because she had to rely on her sister for a ride, she faced some challenges to complete her previous loan payments on time. She is planning to use this loan to increase her inventory.

Women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, but they are gaining a greater presence in the country’s labor market. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering micro-loans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn C., 58, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Doroteo C., a jeepney driver, she is blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been overseeing operations of their jeepney (public transport vehicle) while managing a direct sales business for quite some time now.

Marlyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying advance orders of cosmetics, clothing and personal products from her direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying advance orders of cosmetics, etc. from her direct sales line

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been operating a food stall and selling coconuts for four years, neighbors and passersby being her potential customers. She also sells from home. She faces the challenge of theft as she incurs a lot of losses.

Irene is married with five children who all attend school. She rents a house with no electricity but with piped water. She pointed out school fees as her greatest monthly expenses. Her husband is a shoe-shiner and he supports the family’s basic needs out of his earnings.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, Irene wants to buy more coconuts, freshwater fish and two sacks of 50 kgs of beans for her stall. She hopes to build a hotel (restaurant) in the future.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts ,freshwater fish and two sack of beans

loans.name: Capilla Conchita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama CapilL. Conchita, porque se encuentra frente a L. capilL. D. L. inmaculada Concepción. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es L.  cuarta vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

L. señora Leydy D. L. C. M. tiene 22años, es casada, estudió hasta el 6º año D. primaria, es ama D. casa y no tiene hijos.  ElL. se dedica a L. producción y venta D. pan que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar y material para su puesto. Sus clientes son D. los alrededores ya que los comercializa los días D. feria, también les venD. a personas D. L. misma localidad cuando hay algún evento. A demás del pan también elabora pizza L. cual venD. por pieza o por rebanada.

Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta porque terminan un ciclo mas cumpliendo con pagos y con L. idea D. seguir invirtiendo  su crédito ya que le ha costado mucho trabajo mantener en pie su negocio, a pesar D. las situación económica ha logrado crecer poco a poco  gracias al crédito y al apoyo que tiene D. su esposo , comenta L. señora que sufrieron mucho para lograr iniciar L. producción ya que anteriormente elL. apoyaba a sus papas y ellos le permitían hacer uso del horno pero después D. que decidió independizarse fue en donD. le costó trabajo hacerse D. sus cosas. ElL. espera que con el tiempo y con el gran apoyo que manifiesta tener con el crédito lograr incrementar su producción ya que este negocio lo quiere ampliar y que le permita con su trabajo arduo mantener a sus hijos que planea tener ya que por el momento solo tiene L. idea D. trabajar y hacer más granD. sus negocio.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son: 
Crisanta M. V. (adornos D. temporada), 
Laura S. M. (cría D. animales),
María Guadalupe F. M. (cría y venta D. pollos), 
Carolina M. M. (Cría D. ganado), 
Susana C. S. (Cría y venta D. pollos), 
Carmen S. C. (Venta D. verdura), 
Leydy D. L. C. M. (Producción y venta D. pan), 
Amalia D. M. (Venta D. ropa), 
Araceli C. M. (Venta D. verdura) y 
Lourdes M. V.

Todas las señoras aparecen en L. foto sin embargo por timidez L. señora Guadalupe y Carolina quedaron un poco ocultas entre sus compañeras.
texts.en:
This group is called CapilL. Conchita because their businesses are located in front of the Chapel of the Immaculate Conception in the State of Mexico. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the 4th time they have solicited a loan through CrediComún. Leydy is 22 years old, married, and has completed the 6th year of primary school. She is married and has no children. Leydy is dedicated to the production and sale of bread, a business she started 3 years ago. She is soliciting a loan to buy flour, sugar, and supplies for her stall. Her clients are from the surrounding area and she sells on market days. Leydy also sells to people from the same locality when there is a special event. Besides bread, she also makes pizza, which she sells whole or by the slice. As she solicits this loan, Leydy feels very satisfied because she has just finished repaying a loan and is contemplating investing the new loan. It has cost her much work to keep the businesses going. Despite the current economic situation, she has managed to grow, little by little, thanks to the loan, and to her husband's help. Leydy suffered very much upon starting production, because she was helping her parents who permitted her to use their oven. Then after she decided to become independent, it cost her much effort to take charge of her own affairs. She hopes that in time, and with the h Help she will receive with this loan, she will be able to increase production, because she wants to expand her business, and that this will permit her to work hard to maintain the children that she plans to have. For the moment, she only focuses on the idea of working to make her business larger. The other members of the group are: Crisanta (seasonal decorations) Laura (raising animals) Maria Guadalupo (raising and selling chickens) Carolina (raising cattle) Susana (raising and selling chickens) Carmen (selling vegetables) Amalia (selling clothes) Araceli (selling vegetables), and Lourdes All of these women appear in the photo except, from shyness, Guadalupe and Carolina remain a bit hidden among their companions.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FLOUR, SUGAR, AND SUPPLIES FOR MAKING AND SELLING BREAD AND PIZZA AT HER STAND

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean A. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business selling specialty food products like homemade sausage or longganisa in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jean is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Peach

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 20-year-old married woman and a villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She is blessed with a lovely daughter who is already enrolled in school. To earn a living, she owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandmother. She and her husband use this land to grow different kinds of crops including potatoes and rice. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. S. doesn’t have enough capital for her farm during this coming rainy season. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump and seeds

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una madre de familia de  55 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector cruce S. y García del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varias zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes todo tipo de productos de consumo diario que usualmente no tienen al alcance de la mano. Adicionalmente también cría animales menores y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Estas actividades son sus fuentes de ingreso y con ellas ayuda a su familia a solventar los gastos familiares y salir adelante.

Nicolasa desea ampliar su negocio de venta de abarrotes con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes, asimismo planea aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Nicolasa planea utilizar las ganancias que perciba de la ampliación de su negocio en el mantenimiento del mismo y en la colaboración con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella es una mujer bastante honrada y trabajadora. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 55-year-old mother who is single and lives with her family in the sector near the intersection of S. and García, in the Mórrope district. This district is made up of various rural zones which are quite distant from each other. It belongs to Lambayeque province and lies more than forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her business is selling basic staple goods and groceries in a general store located in her home. To her neighbors and other customers. she offers all types of everyday products that they otherwise would not have at hand. Additionally, she raises small animals and sells them to buyers who visit the zone where she lives. These activities are her sources of income, and with them, she helps her family cover the household expenses and get ahead. Nicolasa wants to expand her grocery business by purchasing more products, so that she can meet her customers' demands more effectively. In this way, she plans to increase her sales. To achieve her objective, she has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Nicolasa plans to use the profits she receives from expanding her store to maintain her business and to help sustain the economy of her family. She is a very honorable and hard-working woman. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and others who know her consider her a steady and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying staple products and groceries to expand the general store in her home

loans.name: Sabanoh Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabanoh II” group. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Pa Hassan K. who is pictured in the left. Pa Hassan was born in a village called Konta, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 50 years old and married with five children. Three of the children attend primary school and two secondary school. 

In his small village of Konta, Pa Hassan makes a living by selling pepper and rice. With his many years of experience as a businessman, Pa Hassan will use his share of the loan to buy pepper and rice at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy pepper and rice at wholesale

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena es una joven trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, ya que estudia y trabaja, entra a trabajar muy temprano y por las tardes va a la escuela, ella quiere un futuro mejor y con mas oportunidades, desde hace tiempo reside aquí en esta cuidad, pero su familia vive fuera, ella aquí vive sola.  Renta una casa y ella se paga sus estudios y sus gastos, necesita una computadora para hacer sus trabajos de la escuela, es por eso que solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Lorena is young and hardworking, she works and goes to school and really wishes to get ahead. She goes in to work very early and goes to school in the evenings. She wants a better future with more opportunities. She has been living alone in the city for some time now but her family lives away. She rents a house and pays her own expenses as well as her own schooling and needs a computer to do her schoolwork which is why she is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Lucila Balido Group

texts.en:
Lucila B. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Lucila is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Lucila has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Lucila joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle in order to offer better service

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida J. is from the village of Simmimbaan. She is 48 years old. Zenaida is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Zenaida raises livestock, primarily pigs for breeding. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Zenaida is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: La Sra. Araceli G. R. es trabajadora Activa del Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Responsable de Finanzas  tiene veinte y dos años de trabajar para esta institución tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
LAraceli G. R. is an employee at the Ministry of Health, in the position of Financial Director.  She has been working at this institution for twenty-two years and has two school-aged children.

She has had four loans through CEPRODEL, and each one has been used to buy construction materials to expand and improve her home.

The loans have greatly benefited her by improving her and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Sand, cement, stone, cinderblocks.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa D. est une femme mariée de 36 ans. Elle vit dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de poussins et la vente d’œufs frais.
