Elle a une expérience  de 3 ans dans son activité. Elle a adhéré  au guichet de Bambilor  depuis novembre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle emprunte 300000fr pour acheter 150 poussins. En développant son activité madame D.  souhaite accroitre ses revenus pour pouvoir soutenir son mari surtout pendant les moments difficiles dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la prise en charge entière des besoins vitaux de  leurs enfants.
texts.en: Madame Awa D. is a married 36 year-old who lives in the Bambilor quarter. She is involved in raising poussins and selling fresh eggs; she has worked in this field for the past 3 years.  She had been a member of the Bambilor microloan association since November 2009 and has already repaid two loans to the association.  She has borrowed 300,000 FR in order to purchase 150 poussins. She wishes to boost her business in order to generate higher revenues so that she can support her husband, particularly in meeting everyday costs and looking after her children's needs.

loans.use: purchasing poussins (small chickens)

loans.name: Juana Rossana

texts.es:
Juana Rossana M. T. tiene 24 años. Es separada, vive con los padres y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Juana se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juana Rossana M. T. is 24 years old.  She is separated, and she lives with her parents and her two children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Más” (United We are More) Communal Bank are located in the Marañon precinct of the Puerto Pechiche parish belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to the short cycle of growing corn, rice, and beans.

Juana has been growing crops, especially corn, rice, and beans, for two years.  She buys the products at the López business in Ventanas, and she sells her products at the Ventanas market in the same precinct.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her get the necessary supplies.  She faces challenges like pest infestations, illnesses, and climate changes. 

Her dream is to have her own house.  She likes to go play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara A. was born in 1961 in Ijevan. She is married and has a 29-year-old son.

Tamara works at the Armenian post office as a mail carrier. She also has her own business, trading fruits and vegetables in the Ijevan market since 2003. Tamara’s son helps her in this business. He runs the business in the morning, while Tamara delivers mail. Thanks to this business, they can provide their family’s needs.
 
Tamara needs a 500000 AMD loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.
 
This is Tamara’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Fátima del Socorro Pérez  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora propietaria de una pequeña pulpería y cosecha tamarindo desde hace 10 años. Ella es una mujer joven, soltera que su mayor anhelo es aumentar su negocio. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en productos para la pulpería como granos básicos, gaseosa, jabón, detergente…etc.
texts.en:
Fátima del Socorro Pérez is a hard-working woman.  She is the dedicated and enterprising owner of a small store.  Also, she has been growing tamarinds for ten years.  She is a young, single woman whose greatest desire is to increase her business.

She will use the loan to buy products like basic grains, soft drinks, soap, and detergent, etc.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soft drinks, and soap, etc.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng T. is a 60-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Eng T. earns a daily income about $1 per day.  She is an older woman and a widow. She has no life partner because her husband died of senility years ago. 

Eng T. has three children, one is single and two are married. One of her children is currently a recycling seller.  He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells them in bulk in other provinces. The used goods which he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Eng T. is requesting a loan to support her son in buying a secondhand motorcycle to transport used goods for his business.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle to transport goods for business

loans.name: Rufino De Jesus

texts.es:
El Senor Rufino V., es habitante de la Comarca El Coyolito, del Departamento de Esteli; es casado, de 68 anos de edad, tiene 3 hijos; Alcanzar un nivel de educacion no fue posible, debido a las condiciones economicas que su familia tenia en esos momentos.
Desde muy corta edad se dedico a las actividades de agricultura ayudando a sus padres, en la siembra de granos basicos.
Cuando murieron sus padres a el y a sus hermanos le quedo de herencia el terreno en donde sembraba con ellos; ahora el esta a cargo de eso.
Realizo este credito para cultivar 3/4 de Tomate, sobre todo para la compra de insumos; pues el dice que todo esta listo, e incluso ya tiene preparada la tierra y la semilla.
Su meta es poder tambien expandir sus negocios en la compra de ganado.
texts.en: Mr. Rufino V. lives in the El Coyolito region, in the Department of Esteli.  He is married, 68 years old, and has three children.  Getting an education was not possible due to his family's economic status at that time.  He has been working in farming since he was a little boy, helping his parents plant basic grains.  He and his siblings inherited the land they planted when his parents died and now he is in charge of it.  He is taking out this loan to cultivate 3/4 tomatos -- mostly to buy supplies.  He also says that everything is already; he has even prepared the earth and the seeds.  His goal is to be able to expand his business and buy cattle.

loans.use: To plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Linah operates a charcoal selling business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells dry fish to contribute to her income.  Linah faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demand in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, Linah wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food stuffs, beverages, detergents etc.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Elsa M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Progreso, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos los mismos que adornan la ciudad, su centro histórico fue nombrado en 1999 como patrimonio de la humanidad.

La Señora. Elsa tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 16, 9 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su segunda hija  estudia en el colegio y su tercer hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante y también labora como empleado privado, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Elsa labora hace 2 años en un bazar que es de su propiedad,  trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir en mercadería para su bazar. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa M. is a member of the "Mujeres en Progreso" communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which has a cold climate.  There are four rivers running through the city and its historical center was designated as a World Heritage site in 1999.

Elsa is 45 years old, married and has four children ages 22, 16, 9 and 2.  Her eldest son is married and lives independently.  Her second daughter is in high school and her third son is in gradeschool in the city.  Her husband works as a salesman and an employee in a private company.  Through their work the couple has been able to build their own home.

For two years now Doña Elsa has been running her own bazaar.  She works Monday through Saturday from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

This is the third loan she has received through the communal bank.  She plans to us it to purchase merchandise for her bazaar.  Her goal is to grow her business significantly.

loans.use: To purchase bazaar merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in a business of selling sugar. She is 22 years old and married to a businessman. Her two children do not go to school yet. Mary took out a loan to stock more sugar to sell.  She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sando

texts.en:
Sando is 36 years old and lives in the Jacob's Town area. She has three children between the ages of five and 19, all of whom live with her and her husband. They can only afford to send one of them to school on their current income.

Sando has been operating a small shop for the past eight years selling rice, oil, milk and other items. Sando is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and other items for her shop. In the future, she hopes to operate a mini mart and purchase some land for her family.

loans.use: To purchase oil and other items to increase stock for her shop

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad L. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental.  She is 59 years old.  Natividad is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a fish sales business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the market.  Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Karen Juliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Divino Niño se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 18 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de dos años y de 4 meses que requieren de muchos cuidados. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella estudia Ciencias De la Educación en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí, esto lo hace por las noches ya que en las mañanas  trabaja de profesora en una escuela de la localidad, además de esto es una muy buena mujer que para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio realiza el crédito, el cual se dedica al comercio minorista, vende ropa de todo tipo y cortinas, esto lo hace en forma ambulante  recorriendo la ciudad de Portoviejo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y lleva más de cinco años dedicado a esta actividad.

Este crédito ella lo va a emplear en comprar ropa,  cortinas y también una parte para utilizarlo en gastos de sus estudios. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta por la unión del grupo.

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y obtener un nombramiento en una escuela.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Divino Niño' (Divine Child) community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is noted as being a very commercial area.  It is also noted for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and for the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet 18 year-old Karen who lives with her common-law husband and her two daughters aged 2 years and 4 months who need a lot of care.  Her husband is a salesman.

Karen is studying Education Sciences at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.  She studies in the evenings since she works as a teacher in a local elementary school in the mornings.  In addition, she is a very good wife who is taking out this loan to help her husband in his business.  Her husband sells clothes and drapes retail.  He does this as an itinerant street vendor around the city of Portoviejo.  He works every day, from 8.00am to 6.00pm, and he has been in the business for more than five years.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and drapes.  Part of the money will also be used to cover Karen's education expenses.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and is the bank's secretary.  She enjoys it because of the unity of the group.

Karen's dreams are to finish her studies and to obtain an appointment in a school.

loans.use: to buy clothes and curtains, and to cover education expenses

loans.name: Saf Mana Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Saf mana déme a été créé le 05 mai 2010.Il est composé de 20 femmes issues du même village.Leur activité principale est la transformation de l'arachide en huile.

Madame Diatou en position debout à l'extrême droite de la photo,est responsable du groupement ,elle est née le 15 02 74 ,elle est marié et mére de 05 enfants.

Comme activité,elle fait la même  chose que les membres de son groupement.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des graines d'arachides pour les transformer en huile. 

Son objectif est de réfectionner sa maison,aider son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants et augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Saf mana deme was created are May 5, 2010. It is made up of 20 women from the same village. Their main business is producing peanut oil from peanuts.

Mrs. Diatou, standing on the far right of the photo, is in charge of the group. She was born on February 15, 1974. She is married and has five children.

She is involved in the same business as the other members of her group.


The loan will allow her to purchase peanuts in order to produce peanut oil.

Her goal is to make repairs on their home, help her husband pay the children's school expenses and increase how much she saves.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts in order to produce peanut oil

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en:
Lodgenia P. is 53 years old and widowed with four adult children. She is from the village of Malibangcao Clarin Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Lodgenia owns and operates a tailoring business. Her main source of income comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Lodgenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Lodgenia joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lodgenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional fabric and materials. This will be the third loan taken out by Lodgenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Anuba

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Provincia de Tete, Norte de Moçambique casada e maê de 5 fillhos de idades entre 04 a  17 anos de idade e todos vaõ a Escola excepto o mais novo. Fez somente 4ª classe naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras e mais tarde foi incorporada ao serviço militar obrigatorio. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia as vezes tem ajudado a seus parentes que estaõ em Tete.
Saiu de Tete para Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatorio, actualmente é pensionista do Ministerio da Defesa e recebe 5.323.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu marido consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de outros clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu setimo emprestimo no valor de 16.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, chapas de zinco, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.400.00, 8.000.00, 10.000.00, 10.000.00, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00mt todos para habitação.
Espera pagar sem problemas e pretende solicitar mais emprestimos para comprar o mobiliario da sua casa.
texts.en:
Anuba was born in Tete Province in northern Mozambique. She is married and has 5 children between 4 and 17 years old, and all but the youngest child go to school. Anuba only finished fourth grade. She did not continue with school because of financial difficulties and later began compulsory military service. She lives in her own house with her family and sometimes helps her parents, who are in Tete.

Anuba left Tete to move to Maputo while completing her compulsory military service. She has a pension from the Ministry of Defense and receives 5,323 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. With her husband's help she is also able to save some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through some of this institution's other customers. This is Anuba's seventh loan. She is asking for 16,500 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (doors, cement, zinc sheets, sand and other items) to continue with improvements on her house. The previous loans were for 6,400 meticais, 8,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais; all were for housing.

She expects to make her payments with no problems and intends to ask for more loans to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, cement, zinc sheets, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao (pictured here) runs a grocery store at home. Her husband, Chan, is a construction worker. She is applying for a loan of $600 to purchase additional grocery items for her inventory.

The couple lives on an island located 15 kilometers Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and three daughters.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her inventory.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 44 years old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband repairs motorbikes. Together their income is $6 per day. Sothea has four children; three are working in the factory and earning $6 each a day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Sothea would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy construction materials to repair her house and build a bathroom. She would like to construct a shop for her husband to do motorbike repair at home, because now he is working in a shop under its owner.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos de 12, 8 y 5 años de edad, ellos dependen directamente de él, José es carpintero y elabora específicamente ataúdes, aprendió desde joven, su padre le enseño el oficio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera, pintura y barniz, este préstamo le ayudara para tener en la carpintería los materiales que son más usados para fabricar los ataúdes, dando así un mejor servicio a los clientes y saliendo con todos los pedidos.
Su aspiración es incrementar el trabajo en el taller, con mayor número de materiales y con más afluencia de clientes.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, his wife and three children ages 5, 8, and 12, who depend entirely on him. José is a carpenter making coffins. He learned the work from his father when he was young. 

Right now he is requesting a loan to purchase wood, paint, and varnish. This loan will help him to have the materials most often used for making coffins in his carpentry shop, so he can offer his customers better service and get more orders.  

His hope is to increase the work in his shop, with a greater amount of materials and an abundance of customers.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Juan vive en la zona del gallito del plan 3000 el es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres su punto de internet esta funcionando desde hace dos años y medio, este es su segundo crédito en el primer crédito demostró un buen comportamiento de pago. Por la gran demanda de clientes en su barrio esta solicitando este segundo crédito para comprar otro equipo de computación con el cual podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. El sr. Juan  es un joven trabajador con ganas de superación ya que también estudia en la universidad y uno de sus deseos es el de terminar sus estudios y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de el y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives in an area called Gallito del Plan 3000. He is single and lives with his parents. He owns an internet cafe, which he started two and a half years ago. This will be his second business loan. Juan established good credit history from the prompt repayment of his first loan. His business is growing due to high demand in his neighborhood, and this loan will allow him to buy additional computer equipment to meet customer demand. 

Juan is a hardworking young man with ambitious goals. He is also studying at the university. His goals are to graduate with a degree and to improve quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Mirzomuddin

texts.ru:
Мирзомуддин родился в 1976 году в Таджикистане. Он честный умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Мирзомуддин занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур около 3 года. Он выращивает арбуз и дыню, а потом продает их на местном рынке. Мирзомуддин хочет, устроит своих детей в лучших школах и университетах. С этой целью он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить прибыли. Мирзомуддин хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений, семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mirzomuddin was born in 1976 in Tajikistan.  He is an honest, smart and conscientious person.  He is married and a loving father of four children.  Mirzomuddin has been involved in growing agricultural crops for about three years.  He grows watermelon and honeydew and then sells them at the local market.  Mirzomuddin wants to place his children into the best schools and universities.  To achieve this goal, he wants to expand his business and make profits.  Mirzomuddin wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, seeds, lubricants and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, lubricants and livestock

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de comida, ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para mantener a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  granos básicos, verduras, bolsas, paltos desechables entre otros. El deseo de Ana es que su hijo logre mantener este negocio.
texts.en: Ana Rosa is 36 years old.  Her business is selling food.  She is a very active and dynamic young woman who really enjoys her work.  This is not the first time she has taken out a loan.  Loans have helped her to keep her customers.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, bags, disposable plates and other items.  Ana's wish is for her son to keep this business going.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, bags, disposable plates, etc.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marisa has a shop that sells clothing like T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

loans.name: Dania María

texts.es:
La señora Dania María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, No tiene hijos  y habita en su propia vivienda. Se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en una escuela de la localidad con muchos años de experiencia y con gran profesionalidad en su trabajo.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de zinc, arena y cemento  para mejorar su vivienda porque ha sido afectada por muchas razones principalmente por las lluvias. Es por esta razón que decidió optar por este crédito sabiendo que le será de muchísima utilidad para el desarrollo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dania María is from the town of El Sauce.  She has no children and lives in her own house.  She works as an elementary school teacher in a local school and has many years’ experience; she is very professional at work.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy metal sheeting, sand and cement to do some improvements in her house which has been affected due to many causes, principally the rains.  Because of this she opted for this loan knowing that it will be of much use to her to develop her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Santos Celis

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos.

Él vive en una zona rural y su única diversión es el trabajo, es una persona luchadora y humilde que desde niño se dedico al trabajo de campo, por eso tiene una amplia experiencia y le satisface lo que hace, trabaja 8 horas diarias con el único fin de tener lo necesario.

Don Santos compra  los fertilizantes en una tienda situada a un kilómetro de su casa, el los compra y paga por que se los lleven a su casa, una vez los fertilizantes estén en su casa él los carga en la espalda durante 1.5 kilómetros hasta llegar al terreno donde tiene sus cultivos, ya que para llegar ahí no hay acceso de vehículos.

Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes,  para terminar de cosechar la milpa que tiene sembrada desde mayo, que por el motivo de las lluvias abundantes se esta perdiendo. Con esto él podrá comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez y podrá recuperar la cosecha que se le esta perdiendo.

De esta manera podrá tener el alimento para su familia, ya que él ha pasado momentos difíciles y no quiere que sus hijos pasen por lo mismo. Santos desea que sus hijos estén sanos y que por medio de su trabajo logre educarlos y que se puedan ganar la vida de otra forma, ya con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Santos is 59 years old and he lives with is life partner and their three children. 

He lives in a rural region and his only diversion is his work. He is a fighter and he is humble. Since he was a boy he has dedicated himself to working the land, which is when he has ample experience and he enjoys what he does. He works 8 hours per day and his only goal is to acquire what they need.

Santos buys the fertilizers from a store located one kilometer from his house. He buys and pays for the delivery all the way to his house. Once the fertilizers are at home with him he carries them on his back for 1.5 kilometers to his farmland. To get to his land there is no vehicle access.

He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to conclude his corn plantation that he started out in the month of May. Given the abundant rains the harvest is failing. with this he will be able to purchase all of the materials at once and he will be able to recover the harvest which is currently failing.

This way he will be able to secure nutrition for his family. He is experiencing difficult times and he doesn't want for his children to go through the same. Santos wants for his children to be healthy, and through his work, to send them to school in order to earn a living in a different way, by using their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his cultivation.

loans.name: Arlen José

texts.es:
El señor Arlen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 28 años quien tiene una pequeña agencia de distribución de gas butano y agua purificada. Este negocio lo inicio hace dos años con unos ahorros con el fin de salir adelante, el negocio en este tiempo ha crecido y cuenta con un trabajador.
Su meta es salir adelante y seguir creciendo es por ello invertirá el crédito en el negocio.
texts.en: Arlen, 28 years old, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has a small butane gas and purified water distribution agency. She started this business two years ago with some savings and with the goal of moving ahead. The business has grown in this time and employs a worker. Her goal is to move ahead and continue growing, and for this reason she will invest the loan in the business.

loans.use: to purchase butane gas and potable water

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa y tapar las cuarteaduras de las paredes; por que en temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo y las paredes se están deteriorando. Jesús quiere prevenirse antes  que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto al igual que sus hijos puedan contagiarse de alguna enfermedad por la humedad que se genera. Para poder cubrir los gastos él y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora y para el gobierno 10 horas de Lunes a Viernes y algunas ocasiones se queda tiempo extra para recibir más dinero. Jesús  es padre  de dos niños, de los que quiere brindar mejor patrimonio en que puedan vivir cómodamente. Para que el pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el impermeabilizante y material de construcción para tapar las cuarteaduras.
texts.en:
Jesús is asking for a loan to weatherproof the roof on his house and to seal cracks in the walls because during the rainy season water seeps in because the roof and walls have deteriorated.  

Jesus wants to take steps before the problem worsens and he has to spend even more than anticipated; he also wants to keep his children from acquiring some illness due to the dampness that’s generated.

To cover costs, he and his wife work in an assembly plant and for the government 10 hours Monday through Friday and sometimes stays on extra hours to earn more money.

Jesús is the father of two children that he wants to provide a better asset for so that they can live comfortably.  To carry out this project, he needs to buy weatherproofing and building materials to seal the cracks.

loans.use: to weatherproof and to seal some cracks in the walls.

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en:
Mercilyn is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. She's from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Mercilyn operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to her local community members to earn a living. Mercilyn has been in this business for six years. She earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Mercilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Mercilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Mercilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanajuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She is now applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

In the future, Mwanajuma hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders. She aspires to continue improving her business and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family by selling charcoal. She has been in the business for the past fifteen years. Additionally, she buys and sells dry goods and wholesale rice.

Previously, Editha has borrowed and paid off 28 loans through NWTF. She is now requesting a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, the woman in the photo, is age 42 and sells lotuses. She buys them from fellow villagers and transports them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Savath, is age 43 and is a motor-taxi driver. They have been married since 1987 and have one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one works for a restaurant in Phnom Penh, and the other is in school. They are living in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chenda is asking for a loan in the amount of $200 to replace the wooden stilts of her house. The wooden stilts have been damaged by termites. Chenda's house is risking collapse.

loans.use: to replace the wooden stilts of her house

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Dulce Esperanza  se formó con la unión de 16 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes ,  pero también actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Demetria es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la costura y decoración de eventos, es una señora muy trabajadora, creativa, activa  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Ella tiene  5 hijos y su marido es electricista. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con sus actividades y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.  Ella comenta que junto a su marido están tratando de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
La señora Demetria solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, cierres, botones y demás insumos para abastecer su taller.
texts.en:
The committee "Dulce Esperanza" [Sweet Hope] was formed with the uniting of 16 neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the committee's members carry out independent business activities, but they also have activities that strengthen their camaraderie. 

Ms. Demetria is one of the committee's members. She devotes herself to sewing and decorating for events. She is a very hardworking woman, creative, active and with a great desire to get ahead. She has five children and her husband is an electrician. She is quite happy with her businesses and with the trainings the group receives. She comments that, along with her husband, she is trying to get ahead and help their family. 

Ms. Demetria requests the loan for the purchase of cloth, zippers, buttons, and other supplies for stocking her workshop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, zippers, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Jenny Rosario

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus pequeños; gracias a su esfuerzo Jenny se encontraba estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, no pudo culminar sus estudios, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para engreír a sus hijos, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jenny trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, especialmente de frituras, tales como pollo broaster, hamburguesas, salchipapas, entre otros, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por su buena sazón.
Jenny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cortadora de papas, una licuadora, sillas y mesas; de esta manera Jenny tendrá mejor acondicionado su negocio, brindando un mejor servicio y comodidad para sus clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jenny is 28 years old and lives in Ica along with her two small children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who puts all her effort into getting her family ahead; she is both mother and father to her children.  Jenny was studying management, unfortunately she had to go to work due to lack of resources and was not able to continue her studies. She likes to cook a delicious Carapulcra with dried noodles in her spare time, to energize her children.  This is her favorite dish.


Jenny works her small business, food sales, with great effort and dedication.  She sells broasted chicken, hamburgers, and salchipapas among other things.  She begins working daily from early morning and works for about six hours.  She feels comfortable doing her work and believes that things are going well for her because of her responsible behaviors and because of the delicious seasoning in her food.


Jenny is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she is able to buy potatoes, a blender, chairs, tables, and in this way better equip her business and provide better service and comfort to her customers.  She will continue to make an effort, work to get ahead, and achieve her dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy a blender, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Marie Mahugnon

texts.fr: Marie Mahugnon âgée de 55 ans n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie Mahugnon est une veuve, mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Marie Mahugnon vit seule, elle assure toute seule ses différents besoins. Pour y arriver, Marie Mahugnon vend des ustensiles de cuisine à son domicile depuis dix huit ans. Marie Mahugnon s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Marie Mahugnon sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Manarama

texts.en:
Manarama is a 46-year-old lady. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and three children in a small village in Koraput district in Odisha, India. Her husband is a farmer engaged in vegetable cultivation. 

Manarama runs her terracotta business with the help of her husband and her son. She learned this work in her childhood, as it is their family occupation. She makes earthen pots and statues of gods and paints them. Her son helps her to supply those finished products to the dealers in the market. 

She plans to expand her business, appoint new work staff to help her, and to own a shop in the marketplace for direct sale of the product to end customers. She needs a loan of 35,000 INR to buy more resources like paints, brushes, and ornaments for statues (statues of Indian Gods and Goddesses) and to set up her own shop in the market. 

She wants to give her children a better education and let her family live a happy life.

loans.use: to pay for more clay and paints for her terracotta work and to set up her own shop in the market.

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
Maulid lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children of which two are in primary school other two are in secondary school.
Maulid sells fresh fish in retail. He has to wake up very early in the morning everyday, go to the shores of Indian Ocean and buy fish from fishermen. He  resell these fish in Tandika  market .Maulid want to improve his business by having enough working capital to purchase a large amount of fish.Since the profit  margin for fish selling is thin. He can improve, it by having enough stock of fish . Since fish business is perishable. Maulid is planning to buy some equipments which together with Ice blocks can help keep the fish  fresh until evening.  Ice blocks are bought from Ice suppliers.Maulid is in need of USD 550 to make his plan work.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Ayao

texts.en:
Mr. Ayao G. was born August 15, 1963 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. He is a married father of three children. After he left primary school, he soon began to train as a mechanic. He is now a master mechanic, and his wife stays at home. His job does not earn him much money, so he would like to open a small business selling car parts, which would allow him to at least bring home something to his family every day. As he does not have the means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $900, which will allow him to open a car parts shop in his automotive garage. The financing of this project will allow him to better assume his responsibility as head of his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 15 août 1963 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Monsieur G. Ayao est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Abandonnant les études au cours primaire, il s’est lancé très tôt dans l’apprentissage de la mécanique. Aujourd’hui maître mécanicien, il a une femme ménagère. Ce métier n’étant pas assez rentable pour lui, il veut entreprendre un petit commerce de pièces détachées qui lui permettra au moins de réaliser un bénéfice journalier pour les besoins de la famille. Faute de moyens, il sollicite un crédit de $900 qui servira à ouvrir sa boutique de vente de pièces détachées dans son atelier. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra de mieux assimer sa responsabilité de père de famille.

loans.use: To open a car parts shop in his automotive garage

loans.name: Nagiba

texts.en: Nagiba lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman. She is single. She wants to help her family because her father is dead and her brothers are in school and she is the one to help her family. She has a farm and she wants to take a group loan to buy some animals like a cow and sheep to raise them and sell the milk to people so that she can make a good life for her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sheep

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is a very hard working man and comes from Guadalupe in Nuevo León. He is disabled and this means he cannot find work in a company. After having been rejected for various jobs he decided to start his own business doing electrical repairs two years ago and he started it from his home. The good service that he offers has brought him a lot of clients and now he employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs.

Armando’s desire is to keep growing as a micro businessman, and in order to do this he is asking for a loan of $750 to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment so that he can improve the quality of service that he offers and so that his business can continue to grow. He will repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Your help will be very useful for Armando and he sincerely thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Armando es un hombre muy trabajador, es originario de la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León, él tiene una discapacidad y esto le impedía conseguir un empleo en una empresa, después de haber sido rechazado en varios trabajos decidió iniciar su propio negocio haciendo reparaciones eléctricas desde hace dos años, inició en su propio domicilio acondicionando un pequeño lugar. El buen servicio que ofrece pronto le llevó a tener muchos clientes y ahora cuenta con la colaboración de una persona para poder cubrir la demanda por sus servicios.

El deseo de Armando es continuar creciendo como microempresario, para esto solicita de un crédito por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su local y compra de equipo de trabajo, para mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para Armando, él agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Refurbishment and to buy equipment/Remodelación y compra de equipo

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.es:
Pacifico lives in his own home at #992 Vicente Ochoa in the Gran Poder neighborhood of La Paz. He is married and has two grown children. He will use this loan to maintain a minibus he drives as a member of the Eduardo Avaroa transport workers union in La Paz. This is Pacifico's first loan from IMPRO. Our review of his finances shows he will be able to repay the loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Pacifico vive en casa propia en la Calle Vicente Ochoa Nº 992 de la zona de Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. El crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, un microbús, con el cual trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz, afiliado en el sindicato de transportistas Eduardo Avaroa. Es cliente nuevo y el análisis financiero indica que cuenta con los recursos necesarios para pagar su deuda; en consecuencia, puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To buy new tires for a bus.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi T. was born in 1973 in Ahokpè. She currently lives in Lomé in the Tokoin Lycée area. She is married and has one (01) child, and also has two (02) of her sister's children in her care. Mrs. Ablavi T. is a dressmaker by profession and has 3 apprentices. In addition to her dressmaking, she sells beans. With the approaching festivals at the end of the year and her customers' demands, she wants to add the sale of loincloths to her business but she does not have the necessary funds. In order to realize this dream, which she holds very dear, she is asking for $1000 in financial help. This will also allow her to create a reliable stock of beans in order to better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Ablavi est née en 1973 à Ahokpè. Elle vit présentement à Lomé dans le quartier Tokoin Lycée. Mariée et mère de un (01) enfant et deux (02) autres enfants de sa sœur sont à sa charge. Madame T. Ablavi est couturière de profession et a 3 apprenties. En plus de sa couture elle fait le commerce du haricot. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année et sur demande de sa clientèle et elle veut ajouter la vente des pagnes à son métier mais les fonds nécessaires lui manque. En vue de réaliser ce rêve qui lui tient trop à cœur, elle sollicite un apport financier de $1000. Ceci lui permettra aussi de faire un stockage consistant du haricot afin de mieux servir sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy and sell loincloths and beans

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Gulmira sells tableware sets on the market in Spitamen. Her husband works, while Gulmira’s mother-in-law takes care of Gulmira’s child. Gulmira’s uncle delivers the goods from a wholesaler. Gulmira plans to use this loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулмира занимается продажей наборов посуды на рынке Спитамена. Ее муж работает, а за ее ребенком ухаживает свекровь дома. Поставками посуды занимается дядя Гульмиры, который привозит их с оптового рынка на собственной машине. Гулмира собирается расширить ассортимент посуды и для этого хочет получить займ.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena has been selling dry goods for a few years. She is s 34 year old mother and has five children, all of which she has instilled with desires of progress and betterment. Since Elena has access to an oven, Elena also exports home-maD. bread to different zones in her region. Elena, along with her husband, expend their energy each day to proviD. from the well-being of each member of their family. Elena plans to convert her small grocery store into a Minimarket and in order to foment this plan in as short a time as possible she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Elena, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes desD. hace un par D. años, a sus 34 años es madre D. cinco hijos, los mismos que le han otorgado deseos D. progreso y superación.También se dedica la exportación D. pan casero por las diferentes zonas D. esta región puesto que cuenta con un horno a su disposición. Elena en compañía D. su esposo se esfuerza a diario para otorgarles bienestar a cada uno D. D. los miembros D. su familia. La señora Elena tiene el propósito D. convertir su pequeña bodega en un Minimarket, y por esta razón solicita un préstamo a fin D. cristalizar su deseo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expansion of her business into a Minimarket.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
‘Two is better than one’ has been a stepping stone for Godfrey Mabike, Rose N., Ruth W. and Margret N.. The group started rearing egg-laying chickens 5 years ago and they have kept the spirit. These chicken are kept at one of the members’ residence and their dream is to see that they rear as many as possible. Currently they have more than 300 layers and they plan to rear broiler chicken as well to prepare mostly for Easter holidays, since broilers take only 2 months to mature.

Each member has a side business from which they draw the funds to cater for the chicken feeds, water and vaccinations. Their customers are mostly restaurants, hotels, shops for the eggs and vendors who roast the chicken.

This loan may seem small but they believe it will help them a lot.

loans.use: Expand their business to include broiler chickens.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuy Som O., 53, is a rice farmer in the Or Som Buo Village in Kompong Tom Province. She earns about $2 a day and has six children, three of whom are married. One son, Mr. Sem Sokchea, is a garment worker who earns about $2 a day, while another son, Mr. Sem Kem San, is a student; the rest are farmers. Mrs S. O.'s husband, Mr. Sem S., is a farmer and boatman. He earns about $4 a day.

She now requests a loan of $1000 to increase her working capital in rice farming and buy a fishing boat to create a fishing career for her husband. Because of her business, she now can further her child’s study and support her family’s living expenses.

loans.use: To increase her working capital in rice farming and buy a fishing boat to create a fishing career for her husband

loans.name: Felícitas

texts.es:
More than 3 years ago, Felicitas decided to try her luck with her restaurant, since she constantly received praises for the excellent flavor of her stews. She started her work making few dishes and in a location not very suitable. As the days passed, she began to have regular customers and saw the necessity of expanding her place. Currently this restaurant has become one of the busiest in her city. Despite the fact that there are diverse restaurants around hers, the flavor that Felicitas has is incomparable and irresistible. Thinking about the comfort and peacefulness of her clients she had decided to buy furniture (chairs and tables) in order to offer a better stay to her diners with the earnings that she will obtain going to finishing paying for the university studies of her dear daughter Roxana. Your good heart will allow the plans of this generous mother to be realized.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más D. 3 años Felicitas, decidió probar suerte con su restaurante, ya que constantemente recibía halagos por la excelente sazón D. sus potajes. Inició su labor preparando pocos platillos y en un local poco adecuado, conforme transcurrían los días fue teniendo asiduos comensales y se vio en la necesidad D. ampliar su local.Actualmente este restaurante se convirtió en una D. los más concurridos D. su localidad, pese a que existen diversos restaurantes a su alrededor, la sazón que Felicitas posee en las manos es incomparable e irresistible.En esta oportunidad pensando en la comodidad y la tranquilidad D. sus clientes ha decidido comprar muebles (sillas y mesas) para ofrecerle una mejor estadía a sus comensales, D. esa manera con las ganancias que obtenga terminar D. brindarle estudios superiores a su querida hija, Roxana.Vuestro buen corazón permitirá concretar los planes D. esta generosa madre.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables to improve the environment of her restaurant

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida Bibi, wife of Mr. J., has been married for the last 27 years. She used to live in a village but shifted to the big city of Lahore almost one year ago. Mr. Jaffner is a day laborer and earns only a meager income.  Nonetheless, in Lahore Rashida's family has constructed a house of their own.  She has four daughters and three sons. The eldest son, after completing  grade eleven, works as a cook. The  next son to him completed grade ten and now manufactures and sells bottle caps to various medical stores. The youngest son is in the fifth standard. At present, they need a loan for their bottle-caps manufacturing business.

loans.use: For the manufacture of bottle caps

loans.name: Flor Pileña Group

texts.es:
"Flor Pileña" is an association made up of 10 members. The group is located in the city of El Alto at the focal center of Villa Adela. This group pools its loans and has worked with Pro-Mujer for to complete 12 loans.

Most of them have an average of 5 children that do not even have basic medical care; that is, they haven't had vaccines nor medical and dental checkups due to lack of financial resources. Any resources their parents had were used for food and rent.

Previously, the principal activity of Flor Pileña involved selling light clothing like blouses, shirts, dresses, etc. However, now that the season has changed, these items are no longer profitable. They want to change the product to winter clothing, which will bring in more sales. But buying this merchandise requires borrowing a new large loan so they can purchase their inventory at wholesale prices. Everything is for their families' welfare - increased sales will secure good health and well-being for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Villa Adela, a este pertenece la asociación “Flor Pileña ” integrado por 10 socias. Un grupo muy simpático que junto a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace dos ciclos.

La mayoría de ellas tienen un promedio de 5 hijos, y estos no cuentan con atenciones medicas básicas, vale decir que no cuentan con vacunas, valoraciones indispensables y principalmente consultas odontológicas, por falta de recursos económicos, ya que los recursos que generan sus padres solo les alcanza para gastos de alimentación y alquileres de sus casas.

Anteriormente, la actividad principal de la asociación “Flor Pileña” era la venta de ropa ligera, es decir blusas, camisas, vestidos etc., pero ahora de momento ya no es rentable por las condiciones del tiempo, lo que les lleva a cambiar de producto, ahora quieren adquirir ropa adecuada para el invierno, son la seguridad de obtener mas ventas, pero esta adquisición requiere solicitar un mayor crédito para la compra al por mayor de dicha ropa. Todo esto para el bien de sus familias ya que aumentando sus ingresos podrían asegurar la salud y bienestar de sus hijos.

loans.use: They need capital to buy a new inventory of winter clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lan Thi N., 29 years old, runs a recycling business. Her husband works as a security guard for various companies. Besides her main business, she also runs a general store out of her home. The couple also works the fields where they grow various plants and wheat. The family's income is about 300,000 VND per week. She is requesting 2,006,000 VND to buy more stock for her business and the general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lan (MS: 020024), năm nay 29 tuổi. Chị làm nghề buôn bán phế liệu. Chồng chị làm bảo vệ cho các cơ quan. Ngoài việc đi chợ, chị còn mở một của hàng tạp hóa tại nhà. Anh chị cũng nhận ruộng để làm màu và chồng lúa. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 VND/ tuần. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ và mua hàng tạp hóa.

loans.use: capital for business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa is married and her husband works as as a superintendent in a primary school. They have three children: Elisa Yesenia who is 18 years old and a student, Elizabeth, 14 years old and in secondary school, and Yahir who is 5 years old. She started her business because they needed additional income to meet the family’s living expenses, given that at times her husband’s salary was not enough and the children were in school. She started in 1992 with a small store, but because she had to start working as an employee at another enterprise she had to close it. Afterwards, in March of 2002, she started a business selling tacos and cakes from a small cart that her husband bought for her. She runs the business only at night, but it is going well because she has located it in the area where she lives which is well-traveled by many people.

She needs a loan of $725 USD, to be repaid over six months, to buy more ingredients with which to make her tacos and cakes so she can continue to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa es casada su esposo trabaja como intendente en una escuela primaria y tienen 3 hijos: Elisa Yesenia de 18 años, estudiante de preparatoria; Elizabeth de 14 años, estudiante de secundaria y Yahir de 5 años Inició el negocio porqué necesitaban un ingreso extra para cubrir nuestras necesidades como familia, ya que a veces no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de su esposo y sus hijos ya estaban estudiando. Comenzó en el año de 1992 con una tiendita, pero como tuvo que entrar a trabajar como empleada en una empresa, la cerró. Después, en Marzo de 2002 inició el negocio de tacos y tortas con un carrito para tacos que le compró su esposo, este negocio es solo por las noches, pero les va bien porqué lo puso en un lugar de la colonia donde vive y por donde pasan muchas personas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando sus tacos y tortas y poder seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory E. is 42 years old and married with five children. Glory is a LAPO client. Glory sells foodstuffs and provisions, such as butter, milk, sugar, and detergent. Glory lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria y vive en  el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo por falta de capital y con este crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, aumentará su capital y comprará 01 torete con S/.900 para engorde y posterior venta. 

Trabajó apoyando a su prima durante cuatro meses, ahorrando un capital decidió dedicarse a un negocio por su propia cuenta.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Yunguyo y que su hermana menor siga estudiando, ya que son cuatro hermanos, ella es la tercera y los demás no pudieron seguir estudios superiores por falta de medios económicos.
texts.en:
Sonia is single, she is 19 years old and she attended school until grade 11. She lives in Centro Poblado de Acari within the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno.

She decided to become a member of the "Fe y Alegria" community bank in Yunguyo because she was lacking capital funds. This loan amounting to S/.500, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, will complement her capital and she will purchase a calf (totalling S/.900) to raise and resell later.

She worked to support her cousin during a 4 month period and she managed to make some savings. With these saving she decided to set up a business by her own account.

Her dream is to set up a grocery store in the city of Yunguyo and for her younger sister to keep going to school. Since they are four children in her family, she is the third eldest, and the other two could not continue going to school for lack of financial means.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a calf to raise and fatten and for later resale.

loans.name: Mwasiti Hamza's Kipunguni A Group

texts.en:
Mwasiti H., aged 30, is married with two children aged 12 and 9. She owns a shop in Kipunguni, where she sells kangas (Swahili sarongs) and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics). She started this business in 2007 and works daily from 8am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $64.

This will be Mwasiti’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to increase the stock of her shop and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand her shop by purchasing ladies clothes and shoes to sell.

Mwasiti will share this loan with subgroup A of the Kipunguni group. The subgroup has 8 members, who run cafes and shops, and sell clothes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mwasiti is in the front row on the right.

loans.use: To increase her shop's selection to include ladies clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila A. A. is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. For a living, she trades in charcoal. Notably, charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Due to the success of her business, she was able to support her first child through senior high school. Sheila obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Tema, and she then resells such charcoal to her customers for a profit.

Unfortunately, her working capital (which was provided by her husband) is inadequate to enable her to purchase the large quantities of charcoal needed to meet her customers’ demands. As a result, her sales and profit margins have been rather limited in recent months. Now, she is seeking a loan to purchase a bulk supply of charcoal in order to increase her charcoal inventory, and because she plans to start selling gari and maize to supplement her income (and thus needs capital to kickstart that line of business). She believes that the loan proceeds will enable her to increase her savings so that she can pay for her children's educational needs.

Sheila is a member of the community group known as The Voice Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell anything on days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands by expanding her charcoal inventory

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Fermeldy is one of the 46 barangays of the Tumauni municipality. Jesusa said that their village has a community project known as Clean and Green wherein everybody is obliged to plant a variety of edible vegetables in their own backyard. In their village, aside from planting vegetables, villagers mostly plant corn and rice.

Jesusa is married to Estalito, a farmer. They have eight children: Rovick- 6 years old, in kindergarten, Jayrick- 9 years old, in grade three, Romnick- 12 years old, in grade five, Laila- 15 years old, in second year high school, Michelle- 17 years old, in fourth year high school, and the other three are Nickson- 18 years old, Helena- 23 years old and Cristina 28 years old, all graduated from high school.

Jesusa is engaged in selling rice in their community. She buys one sack of rice from their public market and then retails it to their village. With her limited capital, she decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 which will be used to purchase an additional two sacks of rice and eventually she will resell it to her regular customers. If her business would grow, she would be able get a license and register it in their barangay so that she could avail and sell large volume of rice the next time.

As long as her children still want to continue their studies up to college, she is willing to support and motivate them so that they will have chances of getting a good job after their graduation. To attain her dreams, she will work hard.

loans.use: Jesusa would like to buy more rice to resell to support the education of her eight children.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en: K. Rehema is the leader of Tusitukire wamu group in Lugazi. She is 40 years old with a business of selling new clothes including ladies wear, children's skirts, dresses, knickers and T-shirts for 11 years. She is married with 6 children between the age of 22 and 8 years and she cares for one orphan aged 15 years. Ever since Rehema joined her lending group, now in her 35th cycle, she has managed to buy herself a plot of land. She has maintained the growth of her business as well as continuing to pay school fees for her children; the eldest being in Senior year of high school, and if all goes well, she will be able to attend the University. Rehema now needs another loan to help with buying more new clothes for her business to sell.

loans.use: More new clothes to be bought from Kampala shops for sell in her stock.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en: Mwanahamis M. runs a shop at Kigamboni Ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzanian. She sells a variety of items in her shop. Some items she purchases from Kariakoo city market, and others she purchases directly from the producers. She has been running the business for 4 years. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop, but she lacks the funds to do this. She is requesting a loan of $475 (600,000 TZS) to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Ишанкулова Мукаррам проживает врайоне Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 57 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Имеет лепешечную, где выпекает лепешки на заказ. Кроме того , выпекает для реализации на рынке "Баракат". Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить муку и масло , для того, чтобы иметь в запасе продукты необходимые для выпечки. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mukarram I. lives in the Jalalludin Rumi district. She is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She has a flat bread bakery where she makes flat breads on order. Her bread is also sold at the Barakat market. She decided to request a loan in order to buy extra flour and oil as a reserve stock of the essential ingredients for baking. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and oil

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: An entrepreneur, Cecilia K., 57, takes care of her four kids, two boys and two girls. They are pursuing an education at the junior and senior high school levels.  She wants to be financially able to support her children to the highest degree of education possible.  Cecilia runs a grocery shop.  She sells products like evaporated milk, candy, toiletries, bottled water etc.  She has been in business for four years.  She also sells cosmetics to support her family with additional income.  Cecilia expects higher profits if she receives her loan.  Her grocery products sell very quickly.  She will be adding vegetable and spices to diversify her trading.  Cecilia lives with her children in a family house at Kwahwu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.  She is a member of ‘Anigyee’ (meaning: Happiness).  Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Victoria Maria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Victoria es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Victoria vende ropa variada de acuerdo a pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, además Victoria hace tejidos como chompas y otros también a pedido.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Victoria es cambiar de negocio y tener un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 50 years old and married with 2 children. She sells custom-made clothing and knits sweaters and other items also made to order. Victoria needs a loan of 750 sols to purchase pants and children’s clothing. She dreams of switching trades and opening a home restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants and children's clothing

loans.name: Rorunk Group

texts.en:
This is Ya Mamusu S. and Mamudu T.. They named their group "Rorunk", after the group leader’s home village. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have requested from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created a tremendous impact on the businesses and the personal lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of $600. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses, and consequently make better profits and improvements on their standards of living. 

Ya Mamusu S. (right) is the leader of this group. Mamusu is fifty-five years old. She was born in Rorunk, one of the villages surrounding Magburaka town. She is married with eight children. Five are already grown and three are still in school. Mamusu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She will use this loan to buy as many gallons of palm oil as she can.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: la Sra. Maria Angela L. tiene 37 años de edad, ella tiene una pequeña pulperia en la colonia sosa de la ciudad capital, ella logro poner este negocio con las prestaciones que le dieron cuando la despidieron del trabajo que tenia anteriormente, con este negocio ella apoya a su esposo economicamente para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos los cuales estudian en colegios publicos, con el credito ella piensa surtir mas el negocio y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que ella tiene pensado comprar mas productos diferentes para ofrecer a sus clientes. ella nos comento que este negocio es todo para ella y que lo cuida mucho ya que este sera su fuente de ingresos por el resto de su vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Angela L. is a 37-year-old woman who owns a general store in the Sosa housing development of the capital city. She managed to set up this business with the loans that she was granted after she was let go from her previous job. With this business, she helps out her husband financially in order to cover the household expenses. They have 3 children who attend public school. With this loan, she is planning on restocking her shop with a wider selection of products for her customers. She states that this business belongs solely to her and that she cares meticulously for it because this will be her source of income for the rest of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase churros (fried dough-pastry), soft drinks, sugar, lard, beans, tortillas, cooking oil, coffee, bread, rice, meat, chicken, canned goods, and instant soup

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede - Group 1

texts.en:
Ana T. is 63 years old. However, her age has not stopped her from being a multi-tasking entrepreneur. She and her friends in the Dios Todo lo PueD. Group are in their 6th loan cycle with Esperanza and continue going strong. Ana has used the small education she got from elementary school to start several businesses: a cafeteria, a fruit/vegetable stand, and a clothing sales business.

Ana will invest the proceeds from the current loan in her fruit and vegetable stand. She will buy more fruits and vegetables in season (like mangoes) to sell in her small shop. She will invest this loan in her fruit and vegetable stand because food sales generate daily income. Clothing sales are more sporadic, and since clothing is often sold on credit, it can take months for her to collect all the payments.

Ana intends to remodel her house to add space for her three businesses so she won't have to move around so much. She thinks she has a responsibility as group coordinator to be a positive inspirational example, and she certainly is. Thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

(The photo shows her loan group in session with their loan officer, Elizabeth Soto.)

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Emile

texts.en: Emile is a 65-year-old married man living with his four children, two of whom still attend high school. Thirty years ago, he opened his own grains and cereals shop, where he serviced the neighboring villages. Today, Emile is requesting to borrow $800 to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Fátima del Socorro tiene la edad de 29 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, soltera y con una hija que estudia la primaria. Trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca el cual lleva nueve años laborando,  a pesar que no es un buen salario ha podido subsistir. Su anhelo es poder terminar de hacer su casa ya que es insegura y esta dispuesta a robo ya que su casa la mitad es de concreto y la otra de láminas de zinc pero que están en mal estado. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de concreto y poder tener una casa digna para su hija. Da las gracias  Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos a plazo ya que es la única manera para sobresalir adelante.
texts.en:
Fatima del Socorro is 29 years old, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is single, and has a daughter in elementary school. She has been working for 9 years in a free trade zone business, and even though she does not make a good salary, she has been able to survive.

Her wish is to be able to finish building her house, since it is unsafe and ready to be robbed. Half of her house is made of wood, and the other half of zinc sheets, but they are in bad condition. With this loan, she is going to buy construction materials in order to build concrete walls and to be able to have a decent home for her daughter. She thanks AFODENIC for the support with the term loans, since it is the only way to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer
