loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Thérèse Rose M

texts.fr: Thérèse Rose M F., 39 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans le commerce de bananes et  veut renforcer son activité qui marche bien dans cette zone de production de banane. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse Rose M F., age 39, is married and has 9 children to support. Her business consists in selling bananas and it works well in this area where bananas are produced. She wants to bolster her business. Her income enables her to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (selling bananas)

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie B. is from the village of Boundary, Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ.. She is 24 years old. Emie is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Emie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Emie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Emie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Emie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
Aleja F. of Sitio Gaboc, Barangay Odiong, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental is 49 years old and married with 9 children ranging in age from 9 to 25.  She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in August of 1998, after a friend invited her, and with the first PHP 3,000 loan she borrowed she was able to revive her barely surviving "sari-sari" or general store. Profits from her loans allowed her to buy appliances and furniture, and to make house repairs.

Subsequent loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon allowed her to invest in ducks and she saved the profits until she was able to buy a carabao which she rented out. Today she has several bulls, one cow, and several heads of pigs, and the "sari-sari" or general store is also performing well.  Now Aleja wants to borrow PHP 19,500 to buy more cattle to expand her herd.  Aleja is doing all this so she can provide her children with a good education and secure their future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan trabaja como transportista publico interprovincial, la esposa es productora de leche de vaca, misma que  comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz, constituyendose esta actividad en su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la comunidad Villandrani a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder producir mayor cantidad de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Juan.
texts.en:
Juan works as a provider of interprovincial public transportation. His wife is a producer of cow’s milk, which is commercialized in the city of La Paz. Both of these activities make up their principal source of income used to support their one-year-old and three-year-old. The family lives in Juan’s parent’s house located in the Villandrani community two hours away from the city of El Alto.

The loan he requests will go towards the purchase of a dairy cow of moderate quality so that they can produce a greater amount of milk.

An evaluation by IMPRO approved Juan for this solicitation of his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de congélateur

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and is a widow with four children. She sells sarongs, foodstuffs and provisions to earn a living.

Victoria hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wholesale and sample sale clothing in bulk

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: A. Awa est née en 1980 et vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une célibataire ayant à sa charge trois enfants, dont deux sont ses propres enfants et qui sont tous scolarisés. Awa n'a pas évolué dans les études et n'a fait que le cours primaire. Awa vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Il y a trois ans déjà que Awa mène comme activité, la vente d'igname et également d'igname pilé (nourriture locale communément appelée "Agoun") dans sa boutique à Aïbatin, un quartier de Cotonou. Awa fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir plus sa clientèle, Awa sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Awa was born in 1980 and has been living for 12 years in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is unmarried and has three children to support. Two of them are hers, and they are all in school. Awa didn’t advance in school and only completed her primarly education. She lives alone with her children and is the sole support for the family. For three years already, Awa has been running a business selling yams and also pounded yams (a local food commonly called agoun) in her shop in Aïbatin, a district of Cotonou. She supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. To increase her working capital and to expand her customer base more, she’s requesting a third ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of yams

loans.name: Nikita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nikita M., age 27, lives in Tarankhel, Thecho (Nepal). Thecho is a village in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people here are farmers. Mrs. M. has four members in her family including herself. Mrs. M. has two sons. Her elder son is 14 and is studying in class 7 and her younger son is 10 and is studying in class 4. 

Goat farming is the only profession that Mr. and Mrs. M. have, so they rely on it to support their family. They need a loan of Rs10000.00 to buy corn flour and other feed for their goats.

loans.use: To buy goats for their goat-raising business

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is forty two years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood.  Matilda is a very professional and stylish hair dresser. She creates all types of hair styles; like plaiting, perming and applying weave-ons etc. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness in her service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weave-ons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. in order to improve her service delivery.

loans.use: To purchase assorted hair salon products.

loans.name: Drusila

texts.es: Drusila de 23 años es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su esposo Yony de 28 años y su hija Amira de un año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.La juventud que tiene Drusila, no fue un impedimento para que logre aperturar su llantería, que es su negocio propio, donde también trabaja su esposo. Su negocio es muy concurrido por los vehículos  interprovinciales, ya que la llantería se encuentra muy cerca del terminal de buses. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite distribuir su tiempo entre su labor y las tareas del hogar, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar las pesadas llantas que arregla. Para el futuro, espera mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, para poder atender a mayor cantidad de  clientes.Es el primer préstamo de Drucila con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una máquina que le ayude a parchar las llantas que han sufrido alguna perforación y así podrá  generarse más ganancias.
texts.en:
Drusila, 23, is a hard-working young woman. She lives in a rented room with her 28 year old husband, Yony, and her one year old daughter, Amira. She wishes to give them a better quality of life. Her youth has not been an impediment for Drusila because she was able to open her tire store. It is her own business, and her husband also works there. Her business is very busy with the interprovincial vehicles because the tire shop is located very close to the bus terminal. What she likes best about her work is that it allows her to manage her time between work and the household chores. She has been in the business for four years. The most difficult part is loading the heavy tires to repair them. In the future she hopes to improve the business’ facilities to be able to take care of a greater number of customers. This is Drucila’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is very happy in her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy a machine to help her patch the tires that have been perforated. That way she will be able to generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine to help her patch tires

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Nurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn N. is 43 years old. She is the village bank president of a group that consists of sixteen people located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. All the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked by others.

Mrs. Lorn N. is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other one is a student in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Mom Makk, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to support the family living. In this farming, they now face a problem because the field does not have enough water to grow rice.

Thus, Mrs. Lorn N. decided to ask a loan of 600,000 Riel from AMK to buy a water pump to support their rice field.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her rice field

loans.name: Nayfe

texts.en:
Nayfe is a 33-year-old single woman. In 1999, she opened a women’s accessories shop selling items such as rings, bracelets, bags and other items in addition of bying some clothes. She's living with her parents and she provides, along with her two sisters, income for the family.

Nayfe always presents beautiful products to attract clients and augment her revenue. Today, she is requesting $1,000 to buy more merchandise as inventory and some gadgets to fill her shop with new items.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and some gadgets

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is a businesswoman. She does not own a beauty salon but she sells hair extensions at retail prices. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit. Her customers pay in cash when they come to purchase hair extensions. She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She is 42 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest child is eight years old. Her children are making progress in school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he supports the home. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
La señora Santos M. se levanta de horas tempranas a las 5:00am  para la elaboración de tortillas para luego trasladarse a su puesto de venta en el mercado la estación finalizando a las 11:00 pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de maíz , leña, cal  y otros.

Tiene el apoyo de su hija que se pone en otro tramo para vender más y terminar temprano ya que tienen buena clientela por el buen sabor de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos M. wakes up in the early morning hours to begin making tortillas by 5am. She later sells them at her vending post at the station market until 11pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy corn, wood, lime, and other items. She has the support of her daughter, who has another location for selling more her products. Santos finishes early because she has a good customers who enjoy the great taste of her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, wood, lime, and other items

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson K. M. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and they have no children yet. Her business is located at a busy market near the Central Business District of Nairobi city. She has been selling second hand clothes to walk in customers for the last three years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that at times there is low supply making her not maximize her sales because demand is high. However, she works very hard to ensure maximum sales to maximize profits. She is using her loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business. In future, she hopes to grow in business and even try out other business ventures like property management and real estates to add her income. She is a very hardworking, humble and caring lady.

loans.use: Clothes.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent home, in a small yard that they rent. His daughter is 18 years old and attends university and his wife works as an attendant in a local trading center. 

Batbayar currently operates a billiards center in his town. He has been operating his business since 2005, after gaining experience working at his brother-in-law's billiards center. He started his own business with 10 billiard tables and now has 14 tables. 

Batbayar has been making plans to expand his business and to improve his workplace in the near future. Batbayar is a very hardworking man and his family and his business are very important to him. He says, "I am now saving money for my oldest son's wedding in August." 

He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase necessary equipment for his billiards center and to improve his workplace in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Bet

texts.en: Bet Y., 56, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She provides make-up services for wedding parties and sells groceries at home for an income of about USD 10 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more wedding supplements to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Y. is pictured with her husband here.

loans.use: To buy wedding supplements to expand the current business

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella S. is a 68-year-old widow. She is the mother of two grown children. Angella delights in offering community service and that has been her passion. She runs a primary school in Mombasa and has been in operation for six years. 

Angella was introduced to KADET by a friend and is now accessing her first loan. She plans to purchase new chairs and desks for the school. The children served are mainly from the Buxton community and enjoy the services they receive. Angella hopes to improve the education standards of the children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs and desks for the school.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine P. is from the village of Pinamaloy, Don Carlos Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Cristine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristine owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Cristine has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair the shield of her "motorcab," a motorcycle with a cab. Cristine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service such as tires and interiors. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Cristine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: materials needed to provide service such as tires and interiors

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 25-year-old owner of Dan's Shoe Designs, selling men's and women's shoes, slippers, and bags at a busy location near a major market. He has been in this business for five years, and he has one employee.

His primary business challenges are debtors who don't pay and insufficient space to hold his inventory. In addition to his shoe shop, Daniel also sells mobile phone accessories. Before selling shoes, he was involved in a cabbage supply business.

Daniel plans to use the 20,000-KES loan to purchase more shoes for resale to his customers. He has successfully repaid previous loans as large as 100,000 KES.

In the future, Daniel hopes to own a shoe manufacturing business. In five years, he dreams of having his own business premises.

Daniel describes himself as hardworking, ambitious, and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale to his customers

loans.name: Marie  Emilie

texts.fr: Marie Emilie est une femme mariee et mere de plusieurs enfants.Elle fait le commerce de produits divers comme le miel,l'huile de palme etc...Elle achete ses produits en Guinee pour les revendre a ziguinchor.Elle a une experience de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce.Elle fait ce commerce pour gagner de l'argent et subvenir a ses charges familiales.Elle compte developper son commerce dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Marie Emilie is married with children. She sells various products such as honey, palm oil etc. She purchases her goods in Guinea in order to resell them in Ziguinchor. She has been in this line of business for over 10 years. She does it in order to earn money and help with the family expenses. She plans to expand her business in the future.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita G. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 58 years old. Anita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand ther business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
N. Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business of running a beauty salon, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Mariam is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more braids.  Mariam plans to use the loan in order to expand her business, and generate profit in order to help her family.  In the future, Mariam hopes to own a house.




Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more braids for hair.

loans.name: Fabiola Margarita

texts.es: Fabiola Margarita Mejía López es una mujer empoderada de 40 años que desde hace 5 años ya elabora tortillas en su casa de habitación, sin embargo además de vender tortillas poco a poco fue introduciendo nuevos productos y ahora vende también elotes, tamales, frijoles cocidos y hasta artesanías que trae de sus viajes a Chinandega. Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de productos y así hacer crecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola Margarita Mejía López is an empowered woman who is 40 years of age. For the past five years, she has been preparing and selling tortillas out of her home. Little by little, she has been introducing new products and now sells corn on the cob, tamales, baked beans, and handicrafts that she brings back from her trips to Chinandega.

She will use this loan to buy more products to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Grupo Solidario San Isidro Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo  San Isidro, está conformado por 4 miembros originarias de este municipio,, solicitan su segundo crédito Kiva, cuentan con  dos integrantes nuevas, 3 de ellas se dedican a la confección y venta de delantales que ellas elaboran en su casa han logrado compra su propia maquina , este negocio les parece rentable ya que los delantales son muy utilizados por las mujeres indígenas de nuestro país. Y una a la siembra y cultivo de flores, ella requiere de capital para invertir desde ya para la fiesta o tradición de adornar el primero de noviembre conocido como  el día a los difuntos, el grupo es representado por  la señora Mirian Leticia C., quien es unida y tiene  3 hijos, ella confecciona  delantales  hace varios años, por lo que la gente ya la conocen esto le ayuda mucho  porque la gente llega a su domicilio a comprar, o a realizar sus pedidos, manifiestan que son muy positivas con este nuevo crédito sea de mucho beneficio  como el anterior.
texts.en:
The group named San Isidro is made up of 4 members, all originally from the same municipality. They request a second loan from Kiva. They have two new members. Three of the members make aprons in the homes and later sell them. They have managed to purchase their own sewing machines. This business has been successful because the aprons are widely used by the indigenous women of the country. Another one of the members grows flowers. She requires working capital to prepare for the Day of the Dead celebrated on November first, when it is tradition to have everything decorated. The group is represented by Mrs. Mirian Leticia C.. She is married and she has 3 children. She has been making aprons for many years. Her clients know her well and it helps because her customers come to her house to purchase the goods, or to place orders. The members of the group indicate that they are very optimistic about this loan because it will be of great benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Camantigue, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: tailoring and ready-to-wear clothes businesses. Her husband, Edgar A., who is 52 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have seven children who are between the ages of 9 and 27 years old.

Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $70, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for tailoring so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Wilma A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for tailoring

loans.name: Adriana Azucena

texts.es: La señora C. desde hace once años se dedica al negocio de Cosméticos en donde ofrece diversas variedades de productos, ha logrado sufragar los gastos familiars de ella y su menor hija que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella nuevamente se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitor un crédito para la compara de perfumes para damas y varón, y así poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su hija.
texts.en: For eleven years, Mrs. C. has had a cosmetics business, where she offers a variety of products. She has been able to pay for her and her younger sister’s expenses. Her sister is currently in school. Mrs. C. is returning to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy perfumes for men and women, so that she can offer a better life to her daughter.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for men and women

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old married man living in Tyre with his beloved wife, owner of a manakish bakery. Manakish, also manaqish, manaeesh or manakeesh or in singular form man'ousheh (Arabic: مناقيش‎ manāqīsh; sometimes called معجنات mu‘ajjanāt 'pastry'), is a popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat. Similar to a pizza, it can be sliced or folded, and it can either be served for breakfast or lunch. 

The word manaqish is the plural of the Arabic word manqūshah (from the root verb naqasha 'to sculpt, carve out'), meaning that after the dough has been rolled flat, it is pressed by the fingertips to create little dips for the topping to lie in. Traditionally, Arab women would bake dough in a communal oven in the morning, to provide their family with their daily bread needs. They would prepare smaller portions of dough with different toppings for breakfast at this time. 

Ali has been a pastry baker since 2004. He makes delicious pastries that no one can resist. Ali is requesting a loan for the fourth time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his raw materials, and to pay what’s left of the price of his house sanitary ware and furniture. Ali is very competent and hopes to maintain stability in his work and life.

loans.use: To increase his raw materials

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel N. H. es trabajadora de un empresa de venta de tela lleva de trabajar con nosotros dos años en los cuales ha tenido financiamientos  par air mejorando su casa de habitación sus cuotas las realiza mensual  tiene dos hijas en edad escolar por las que lucha para sacarlas adelante con sus estudios. La señora N. H. se siente bien agradecida con Ceprodel ya que gracias a estos créditos ella ha mejorado su casa bastante ya tiene un techo digno para ella y sus hijas y su calidad de vida ha mejorado bastante.
texts.en: Maribel N. H. works at a fabric sales company.  She has been working with us for two years and has taken out two loans to make housing improvements.  She makes her loan payments monthly, and has two school-aged children for whom she works hard to get them ahead in their studies.  Ms. N. H. feels very grateful to CEPRODEL because thanks to these loans, she has greatly improved her house and has a decent roof for herself and her daughters, and her quality of life has improved significantly.

loans.use: To purchase blocks, cement, and sand to make housing improvements.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of four and has been farming for four years. She produces eggs and milk, which she sells to the local market.

She has applied for this loan of 40,000 KES to expand her poultry business. Her major business challenge is poultry diseases, which are quite difficult to manage. She had previously acquired a loan of 25,000 KES. She believes this loan will help her to increase her income and pay for her children's education.

To supplement her income, Christine also has a clothing business. In the future, she wants to obtain a piece of land to expand her farming operation.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children; all of them are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).    Annet has a business selling shoes.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Annet sells her products in a market, retail.   

 Annet has requested a loan of 200,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for   include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only. 

Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of shoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). 

Florence has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for two years and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Florence has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through cooked food vending.

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to build her own house. 

Florence lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 47 años vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos mayores, pues es separada; y juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años, esta emprendedora dama se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. Realiza su labor durante todos los días de la semana y siempre camina  con su catalogo en mano para ofrecer los cosméticos a sus habituales clientes y ha otras que pueda captar. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor ya que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, además nunca desatendió las labores de su hogar. Paralelamente a esta actividad también comercializa algunos adornos para el hogar; entre otros pedidos que le puedan realizar sus clientes, y ella les trae lo que piden para luego cobrarles a crédito a un poco mas del precio habitual. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa, donde ofrecerá sus productos y también diversos artículos para el hogar. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza, pues quiere mejorar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock, pues tiene varios pedidos para la campaña navideña que se encuentra próxima.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her two eldest children as she is separated.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.

For three years this enterprising lady has been selling a well-known brand of beauty products.  She works every day of the week and is always walking with her catalog in her hand to sell cosmetics to her regular customers, as well as any others that she might be able to attract.  She is very satisfied with her work since it has enabled her to get her children ahead without ever having had to neglect her household duties.

In parallel with this business, Carmen also sells some household decorations.  Her customers order their products and she brings them what they ask for.  She sells her goods on credit and collects payments that add up to a little more than the regular price.  As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to set up a small store in her home where she will sell her products and also a range of articles for the home.

This is Carmen's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She does not want to let down the people who made this support possible as it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Carmen plans to invest her loan in buying beauty products.  She would like to improve the quantity of merchandise that she has in stock because she has several orders for the Christmas period that is fast approaching.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Hendayen

texts.en:
Hendayen R. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Hendayen is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Hendayen owns & operates a specialized retail store selling wood & wood-related products like coco and wood lumbers in the local community. Hendayen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hendayen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hendayen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. Hendayen is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional lumber to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Hendayen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase lumber to sell

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Huitzililla, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el Estado de Morelos, México. Está conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinos, los integrantes son la señora Cruz P. Sánchez y va a comprar con su préstamo perfumes y cosméticos para surtir sus pedidos, la señora Margarita B. G. va a comprar aceite, refrescos, azúcar etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Maribel C. Sánchez va a comprar zapatos para surtir sus pedidos, la señorita Maricela C. P. va a comprar catálogos para surtir su primeros pedidos e iniciar su negocio de venta por catalogo, el joven Santiago V. B. va a comprar refrescos por caja para iniciar su negocio. La señora Maribel C. Sánchez tiene 33 años de edad estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el campo rento una tierra y sembró cebolla y tiene 2 hijos Ismael tiene 11 años estudia el 6º. Año de primaria y Joaquín tiene 4 años. La señora Maribel tiene su negocio de venta de zapatos, cosméticos, lencería por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar zapatos y surtir sus pedido de zapatos, ella ofrece a sus clientes zapatos, ropa, cosméticos, lencería, este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años, ella le ayudaba a vender a su cuñada ya después se compro los catálogos y comenzó a vender, ella surtió sus pedido con un guardadito primero empezó con una tanda que le dieron ya después con el préstamo lo invirtió, su negocio es ambulante va de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos, su negocio es importante y especial porque si quiere unos zapatos para ella o sus hijos se los dan más baratos le dan descuento, la parte favorita de su negocio es cuando reparte el pedido porque algunos clientes le pagan al contado y otros le dan la mitad los hombres son buenos pagadores, ella recuerda cuando se gano un paquete de lencería por tener buenas ventas cada mes y lo logro por varios meses y le dieron su premio su paquete de lencería, ella tiene muchos clientes hombres, mujeres, muchachas cuando hay clausuras o desfiles le compran mas los zapatos parque lleven el mismo modelo, su negocio es popular por la marca del zapato que es muy reconocida, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es que da los zapatos en pagos y algunas personas ya no le pagan, la competencia que enfrenta su negocio es que hay muchas muchachas y señoras que venden por catalogo también vende de otras marcas, las ganancias del negocio las invierte compra mas zapatos, la señora Maribel está planeando ampliar su negocio surtirse más de todo de cosméticos, lencería, ropa y zapatos y lo piensa lograr con los prestamos. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia cuando su esposo no tiene ingresos de ahí toma para la comida y los gastos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son los baños y construir otra recamara, sus planes y esperanzas son seguir adelante con el negocio seguir vendiendo, ella está feliz con el préstamo que le dieron porque va surtir su negocio lo que le pidan lo va a comprar, las mejoras que desea para sus hijos son darles más estudios que no le falte nada y este préstamo le va a ayudar va a invertirlo en mercancía y con las ganancias, Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan porque  sin su ayuda no podríamos salir  adelante.” Huitzililla es un pueblo cálido, hay campo, siembran cebolla, sorgo, maíz, Celebran al patrón del pueblo Santo Tomas el 21 de Diciembre, hay bautizos, primeras comuniones, procesión, corrida de toros, y brinco de chínelos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Huitzililla, and it is located in the community of Huitzililla, in the State of Morelos. It's composed of 5 members who they know well and are neighbors. The members are Margarita who will buy oil, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to supply her grocery store; Maribel who will buy shoes to fill orders; the young Santiago who will buy soft drinks by the case to begin his business; and Maricela who will buy catalogs to fill her first requests and begin her catalog sales business. 

The young Maribel, who is 33 years old, studied up to the 3rd year of secondary and has her diploma. She is married and her husband works in the countryside, renting land and sowing onions. They have 2 children; Ismael is 11 years old and in the 6th grade in primary school, and Juaquin who is 4 years old. Maribel sells shoes, cosmetics, and lingerie by catalog. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes so she can fill shoe orders. She offers her customers shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and lingerie. 

When the business began some 2 years ago, initially, she helped her sister-in-law with sales. Later, Maribel bought catalogs and began to sell. Maribel began cautiously, with a selection she was offered and an initial loan. Her business is mobile; she goes from house to house, offering her products.  Keeping her business is important and special because if she wants some shoes for herself or her children, she provides them cheaper and con provide a discount.  Her favorite part of the business is when the customers pay! Some pay all in cash, others pay half down. Men are the best at paying. She remembers being awarded a packet of lingerie for having good sales each month. She has many customers: men, women, and girls. When there are closing ceremonies and parades, they buy more shoes. Their desire to have the same model makes her business popular; her brand is well-recognized. 

The challenge that faces her business is that she offers shoes on payments and some people don't pay. The competition her business confronts is that many girls and women who sell from catalogs sell other brands. Maribel invests her earnings to buy more shoes; she plans to expand her business by providing cosmetics, lengerie, chothes, as well as shoes, and she hopes to do this with loans.

Her business has helped her family when her husband couldn't provide income. From the earnings, she provides food and expenses. She wants to make improvements to her house, mainly the baths and building another bedroom. Her plans and hopes are to continue ahead with the business and keep on selling. Maribel is happy with this loan because she can supply her business with what people order. What she wants for her children is to provide schooling so that they will lack nothing. And this loan will help.

The group members wish to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad “Thanks for helping people who have needs because without your help we would not be able to get ahead.”

Huitzililla is a warm village with its countryside sown in onions, sorghum, and corn. They celebrate the day of their patron saint, St. Thomas, on the 21st of December; there are baptisms, first communions, processions, the running of bulls, and other ceremonies.

loans.use: TO BUY SHOES TO FILL CATALOG ORDERS AND OTHER MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 23 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa con su padre en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fidelizada en la zona. Tiene un kiosco afuera del colegio Primario del caserío.

Elizabeth desea comprar insumos para satisfacer la creciente demanda de personas y clientes potenciales que llegan entre los meses de diciembre y abril para trabajar en la campaña de mangos en Tambogrande. Por ello, solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old. She is single and has one child. She lives in her father’s house, in Tambogrande district, an agricultural located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It’s located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

For 2 years she has been selling food, juices, soft drinks, and sweets. She has an established and loyal customer base in the area. She has a kiosk outside of one of the schools in the town.

Elizabeth wants to buy more ingredients and stock so she can meet the growing demand from people and potential customers who arrive between the months of December and April to work in the mango harvest in Tambogrande. She is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and stock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber and building materials for carpentry business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena V., 43, a community partner of CCT*, dreams of living simply. Lorena was unable to pursue college. At present, she runs her own small business and raises four dear children with Arnulfo, a baker. They used to live in Romblon, a part of Luzon near Visayas, and now reside in Silang, Cavite.

Like many of her fellow community partners, Lorena runs her own sari-sari (variety) store and co-manages a bakery with Arnulfo. Lorena has been operating these businesses for 21 years and is very knowledgeable of her customers’ preferences. With one employee, Lorena is able to earn roughly PHP 10,000 every month.

Lorena is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase grocery items and ingredients, such as flour and sugar, for the bakery . She also plans to buy sacks of rice for sale. Lorena acknowledges the big help this loan brings to her businesses, as it facilitates sustainability. Consequently, the loan contributes to her family’s daily living.

Customers’ debts that do not get paid often make Lorena's head ache; nevertheless, she strives on, believing that nothing can hinder her from reaching her goal of making her business prosper. Lorena dreams of seeing her children graduate, because this is the chief basis of her success—ensuring that her children will have a good future.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store and ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Kaiyrsa's Group

texts.en:
Kaiyrsa S., 58, is the leader of this group. She lives in a small village, Kochkorka, known as “sleepy little Kyrgyz village” because of its quietness and security. Kaiyrsa is the mother of three sons, the youngest of whom is physically disabled and needs special treatment and care. The others work in the capital and live on their own. 

Kaiyrsa is a farmer and has various types of cattle. She received these assets in 1992 during times of privatization and, since then, has dramatically increased the number of livestock she owns. Nineteen years ago her start up capital was 10,000 soms, and now generates 5,000 soms a month. It has a small effect because of high inflation. 

She plans to use the loan from Kiva to buy another head of cattle and, hopefully, to resell it at a good price. The long-term goals of Kaiyrsa include making major repairs to her house and arranging the wedding ceremony for her son. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya H. is 48 years old. He lives in Tsakhkunk village in the area of Sevan with his wife and his son, who is a student. 

For over 20 years, Volodya has been engaged in farming.  He raises cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Also he grows potatoes and wheat, most of which he sells in Hrazdan market. Volodya’s wife helps him in his occupation and thus they keep their family, develop their farm and pay for their son’s education. 

Volodya intends to buy a truck, which will allow him to move his farm animals to mountains, to deliver fodder for his farm animals and to distribute potatoes and wheat to market. Therefore, Volodya asks Kiva lenders for a 1,000,000 AMD loan.

loans.use: to buy a truck

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es: Virgilia tiene 47 años, es viuda y vive con el menor de sus 7 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica con más intensidad a la agricultura, comenzó ofreciendo su mano de obra como peón en las temporadas de siembra y de cosecha, en la actualidad sigue desempeñándose de esta forma pero también ha decidido dedicarse al engorde y venta de reses. En un inicio empezó con su propio capital que durante mucho tiempo ha ahorrado, con ello pudo adquirir su primera vaca, negocio que tuvo éxito y la animó para continuar adelante con este negocio. En la actualidad tiene animales entre vacas y carneros que es un capital regular de trabajo que siempre le saca de ajustes económicos y ve con mucho futuro este negocio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de ser nueva integrante de su banco comunal  ya que tiene buenas referencias de ella de la cual esta satisfecha y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una ternera hembra.
texts.en:
Virgilia is 47 years old and lives with the youngest of her seven children in a home of her own.  For the past three year she has been increasingly dedicated to agriculture.  She began offering her labor as a field hand during planting and harvest seasons, and currently continues doing this, but now also to the raises and sells cattle.

She began with her own capital which she saved up over a long time and was able to buy her first cow.  She was successful and it motivated her to continue with this business.  She now has sheep and cattle which provide a steady profit and she sees a future for this business.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very grateful to be a part of this communal bank.  She is satisfied with it and is committed to being in time with her payments.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a heifer.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo tiene una pulpería, desde más de 11 años, anteriormente su Mama se hacía cargo de esta actividad con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado salir adelante y proporcionarle a su hijo y esposa el alimento diario.  Don Adolfo cuenta con todos los servicio básicos en su vivienda pero le gustaría realizarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes, jabón, sopas, enlatados entre otros.
texts.en: Adolfo owns a grocery store which he has had for more than 11 years.  His mom was previously in charge of the business.  Over time, he has managed to get ahead and provide his son and wife with their daily food.  Adolfo has all the basic services in his home but he would like to make certain improvements to it.  He will use his loan to buy candies, soft drinks, basic grains, detergents, soap, soups, canned goods, etc.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, basic grains, detergents, soap, soups, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es: Noemy del Carmen D. 41 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su compañero D. vida y sus tres hijos. Doña Noemy vive en condiciones muy humildes y durante mucho tiempo a trabajado duro para poder ayudar a la economía D. su hogar.  Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones  por lo que desD. hace años se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza D. forma ambulante en la zona donD. resiD.. Sueña con contar con variedad D. articulos que le permitan atraer a más clientes ya que este negocio es una D. las principales fuentes D. ingresos D. Noemy. Esto la ha impulsado  a solicitar este crédito para poder comprar variedad D. artículos D. belleza como: lociones, cremas, maquillaje, desodorantes, champo, joyerías, entre otros artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes. Confiada que D. esta manera le va a poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Noemy del Carmen, age 41, lives with her common-law husband and three children.  She lives in modest conditions and has worked hard to help cover household expenses.  Her dream is to give her children better living conditions so she decided to set up a beauty products business by selling door-to-door in her neighborhood.

In the future she hopes to have a variety of articles to attract more customers since this is Noemy's main source of income.  This is the reason she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beauty products such as lotions, creams, make-up, deodorant, shampoo, costume jewelry and other items to attract customers.  She is confident this will help her proviD. her family with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy a variety of beauty products such as lotions, creams, make-up, deodorant, shampoo, costume jewelry, and other articles to attract customers.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. Her children are aged 9 and 13 and they are in school.  

Angelica has been offering laundry services for eight years. She has sustained her business because she offers good services to her customers. She also gets commission by being a marketer as a part-time job. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records, and this has helped her to run her laundry business well. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy a washing machine.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Roseh

texts.en:
Roseh is 33 years old and married to Boniface, who is a farmer and supports five people. Her children are aged  thirteen, ten, six and four years old. She operates a retail shop in Denja trading centre and has been in the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She has received a loan from KADET of KES.35,000 This is her second loan, after she successfully repaid the previous loan. She hopes to use the amount to purchase stock like cereals, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soaps etc. for her shop and the anticipated profit to invest it back to the business by restocking her shop.

Roseh hopes to open another shop and also improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase business stock  like cereals, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soaps etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 58-year-old client who lives with her husband and four children in their own house in Manaring, Ilagan, Isabela. Leonida lives in the rural part of this area with only electricity service. Leonida is eager to raise her family and give them a better quality of life.

Leonida works daily, selling different products in her store. She has many customers because she is very approachable. Leonida also raises poultry which she sells to the people of her village and in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different products such as fish, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell. This loan will allow her to continue to develop her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en: Susanita is 45 years old, married, has three children and earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this line of work for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She earns additional income by farming rice, and is working hard to achieve her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Milagros De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagros de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es madre soltera, tiene  41 años y 02 hijos, el mayor tiene 9 años, es estudiante de primaria y el menor tiene un año y seis meses.
Decidió iniciar su negocio para criar a sus hijos y obtener sus propios ingresos, empezó a confeccionar algunas prendas de vestir, restando su presupuesto diario, de esta forma compraba sus materiales a utilizar, posteriormente fue invitada al Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/.300.00 es así como pudo adquirir su máquina de cocer y continuar con la confección y venta de sus productos como: sábanas, edredones, almohadas, cojines, ropas interiores para damas, caballeros y niños siendo sus principales clientes  los trabajadores de la municipalidades, universidades y el gobierno regional, las cosas le han ido bien y desea continuar con su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con dos señoritas en la venta de sus productos, sus clientes ya la conocen y le hacen pedidos pues ella les da con facilidades de pago.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 comprará  telas, hilos, fibra de napa para rellenar sus almohadas, sesgos, blondas y otros adornos para dar un buen acabado a sus productos y mantener contenta a su clientela. 
 Milagros de Jesús es una mujer creativa y trabajadora,  su sueño es que su negocio continúe creciendo, y tener su propio capital, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y crecer junto con él.
texts.en:
Mrs. Milagros de Jesús belongs to the Emerald Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, in the province and department of San Martín. She is a single mother, 41 years old, and has two sons--the older is 9 years old is a student at primary school and the younger is one year and six months old. She decided to begin her business to raise her sons and earn a living. She began by sewing outfits and took some money from her daily budget to get started by buying the materials. She was previously invited to the Community Bank and her first loan was for 300 soles. This is how she was able to get a sewing machine and continue making and selling items such as sheets, comforters, pillows, cushions, and underwear for men, women, and children. Her main customers are employees of the city, universities, and local government. Things have been going well for her and she desires to continue with her business. She currently employs two women who sell her products, and her customers know her and make requests because she makes it easy for them to pay.

With this loan of 3,000 soles she will buy fabric, thread, fibers to stuff her pillows, ribbon, lace and other decorations for finishing touches to keep her customers happy.

Milagros de Jesús is a creative and hard-working woman. Her dream is for her business to keep growing and to have her own capital. She is very thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing her the opportunity to improve her business and to grow.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and fibers

loans.name: Vikindu Group

texts.en:
Khadija, who is in her early 40's, is married. She has five children who go to school. She has been running a business of selling fabrics and materials for men's suits, on order and from door to door. She works from 10 a.m to 1.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
  
This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more fabric and suit materials for making men's suits. Her dream is to one day be able to take her children to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Vikindu", which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more suit materials for men suits and fabrics.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, who was born in 1970, lives in Dong Dau village where she is the married mother of two children who are going to school. Her husband is a driver earning about 10,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per month. Anh sells groceries, a job she has had for many years that earns her a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND.

A participant in SEDA since 2006, Anh repaid her last loan of 7,630,000 VND promptly and is now requesting a new one for 9,810,000 VND to buy more groceries such as paper, sugar, cakes, candy, salt, etc. for her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries (paper, sugar, cakes, candy, salt, etc.) to resell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Myrna has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram and sacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jhoan

texts.en: Jhoan is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.  Jhoan has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy additional bananas to sell.  Jhoan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jhoan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La  señora Valentina tiene 53 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado con su negocio, el cual lo abre de lunes a domingo y los sabados temprano elabora y vende Donas, las que vende en las pulperías y a sus vecinos, sus hijas le ayudan con el negocio ya que va dos veces por semana al mercado para la compra de abarroteria y granos basicos, doña Valentina es muy amable y se nota que le gusta mucho lo que hace, es trabajadora y trata que su producto sea de buena calidad. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y granos basicos.
gracias a su negocio y al apoyo que le brinda su esposo ha logrado educar a sus hijas y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Valentina is 53 years old and works selling everyday products.  It wasn't too long ago that she started her business, which she opens from Monday through Sunday, and early on Saturdays.  She makes and sells doughnuts, which she sells in grocery stores and to her neighbors.  Her daughters help her with the business since twice a week she goes to the market to buy groceries and basic grains.

Valentina is very nice and you can tell that she likes what she does very much.  She is hardworking and tries to make sure she has a high-quality product.

She will use the loan to buy groceries and basic grains.

Thanks to her business and her husband's support, Valentina has been able to educate her children and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, lard, oil, margarine, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Le premier enfant a 7 ans et le benjamin 4 ans.
Yao travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il achète et revend des savons et des détergents à toutes personnes à son domicile et distribue aux clients dans leurs maisons. Il s’approvisionne régulièrement au Grand marché de Lomé. 
Yao a requis son premier  crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des savons et des détergents destinés à la vente. Il dit vouloir réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yao voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer le besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en: Yao is a 35-year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has 2 children, of which 1 is in school. The oldest is 7-years old and the youngest is 4-years old.  Yao has worked as a reseller since 2010.  He buys and resells soap and detergent to all people at his home and he sells to customers at their homes.  He sources regularly at the main market of Lome.  Yao is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy soap and detergent for sale.  He says he wants to reinvest these additional profits in his business.  In the coming years, Yao would like to open a store.  He says that with the profits, he expects to guarantee the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en: Lyndie is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Philippines. For the last four years, she has earned a living by growing rice, and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. Lyndie has been a member of PMPC for five years and hopes to save enough money to meet all of her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Levita Gina

texts.en:
Levita Gina has the drive and attitude to succeed. She is 40 years old and happily married to Elmer. The couple was blessed with four children, ages 11,10,6 and 4 respectively. The family resides in the peacful village of Jurisdiccion Amulung, Cagayan. 

According to Levita Gina, they had decided to invest their starting capital of P4,000 in buying scrap materials like used bottles, metals, plastics and old newspapers that they can resell at higher prices.

As of now she aims to diversify her business, so she is asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy more junk products like used bottles, old newspapers, empty cans and metals to resell. This loan will help improve her business.

Levita Gina's faith in God and sacrifices would allow them someday be alleviated from poverty.

loans.use: to buy more junk products like used bottles, old newspapers, empty cans and metals to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old.  She is a widow with two children and is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental:Philippines. 

Jane owns and operates a business venture, selling mobile phone products in the local community. She has been in this business for five years and earns 3,840 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jane is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional mobile phones to sell. She plans to use the revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Gloria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia has been operating her home-based variety store for 10 years. Aside from her retail business, Evelia has run a hog-raising business since 2006. She is happily married and has been blessed with four grown-up children. Her children are all settled and living separately with their families.

Evelia aims to continuously earn more income to sustain her family's needs. She is glad that her business is growing. According to her, through the income generated by her retail store and hog-raising business, she was able to put her children through school. Evelia has been borrowing additional working capital since 2004. Since, Evelia has had a good track record and has been able to reach her 14th cycle. She really wants to improve and increase her sales because she would like to save for emergency purposes. Evelia is able to earn about 15,000 pesos a month. She utilizes her income to meet their daily needs and maintain her hogs. In this situation, she would like to request a loan of 30,000 pesos to purchase volumes of merchandise for her variety store. She hopes to obtain her requested loan so that she can improve their living condition and maintain her variety store.

loans.use: to purchase volumes of merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children.

Jamal is a blacksmith; he opened his workshop in 2003. He produces all types of gates and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field, and he has a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a large electric generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large electric generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en:
Zacarias is a 52-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a farmer who primarily grows rice crops to sell. Zacarias earns about 3000 PHP per month through farming. He works hard to keep his crops healthy and increase his harvest.

Zacarias also started a sari-sari store that his wife now manages. They sell items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap.

Zacarias has requested this 15,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and more items to sell such as canned goods, cooking oil and vinegar. He hopes that through his work he will be able to improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm and more items to sell in his sari-sari.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 23 years old and lives with his wife in small house. He has workshop for making curtains. He has been involved in the retail business for many years and he still needs a lot of improvement, so he is requesting a loan of $3000 to expand and decorate his workshop. By doing this he will be able to increase his stock, which will lead to an increase in his customers and his income. 

Saleh is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand and decorate his workshop.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur is a young farmer who is hardworking and humble. As a child he learnt how to take care of all the farm duties thanks to his parents' teachings. This has allowed him to make progress and now he would like to start his own business of farming. He works as a labourer on different construction areas in the region that is dedicated to the wellbeing of his little child.

With the financial support from this loan Shukur will buy one cow with its calf with which he will be able to start his own business.

loans.use: To buy a cow with its calf.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine offers native cakes such as rice cakes, soup and pancit (noodle) within her local community. Aside from selling native cakes and vegetables, she also had hog raising business and one hectare of corn farm.  

Geraldine would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 15,000.  She will use this loan amount to buy one can of cooking oil, glutinous rice, one sack of flour and vegetables to sell. She knows that her requested loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: buy oil, rice, flour & vegetables

loans.name: Groupement Door Warr

texts.fr:
Le groupement Door Waar de l’association ALLAW  rassemble cinq personnes habitant le même quartier et s’activant dans le commerce. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit pour améliorer leurs activités respectives. La présidente s’appelle Aminata,  elle lève la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans le commerce de poisson fumé, la vente de draps de lit, encens et tissus teints, elle s’active depuis un an. Elle est disponible toute la journée pour vendre ses produits. Avec le crédit, elle décide d’acheter des draps de lits, du poisson fumé et de l’encens pour donner à sa clientèle qui a fait une commande.
Mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont l’ainée, âgée de 20 ans et la cadette, de 12 ans. Elle n’a aucune charge et ses enfants l’appui dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle rêve d’avoir sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
The Door Waar group of the ALLAW association groups together 5 people who live in the same district and have businesses. This is the first time that the group members are requesting a loan in order to improve their businesses.

The leader of the group is called Aminata and is raising her hand in the picture. She sells smoked fish, bed sheets, incense and dyed fabrics and has been in this line of work for a year. She is available all day to sell her products. She has decided to use her loan to buy bed sheets, smoked fish and incense so that she can fulfill her customers' orders. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old and the youngest, 12. She has no responsibilities and her children support her with the daily expenses. She dreams of one day having her own home.

loans.use: to buy incense, smoked fish and bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. started her business when she was a part-time student in beauty school. She started off by just selling cosmetics and when she graduated beauty school she opened a salon. She still sells cosmetics door-to-door from 9 AM – 1 PM and she then opens her salon from 2 PM – 8 PM. One of her hottest products is a weight loss supplements for women.

Rosa is seeking the loan in order to invest in complementary products for her business. She has noticed that she can make a great deal of profit from the sales of these products in the morning and also while her salon is open. With the extra money she makes she will continue to invest in her business and she will also invest in her home. She lives with her son in a house that was once made out of wood but has been slowly improving because of her savings and hard work.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in her beauty salon

loans.name: Asaroh

texts.en:
Asaroh is 25 years old. She buys and sells kerosene. She runs her business to earn additional income to support her husband Pendi. All of the $50 working capital she has requested from MBK will be used to purchase kerosene and six units of container. She wants to get a larger working capital so she can sell more kerosene.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene (for cooking fuel) and containers

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.en:
Juraboy has 5 children and 13 grandchildren. He had worked at a local farm for 33 years, and 12 years at an airport in the security department. Now, for 15 years, he has been engaged only in livestock activity. He has a big family and 3 of his sons and their children live with him in one house.

Last year he experienced a great misfortune with his daughter. After a family assault and battery from her husband, she was badly burned and stayed alive for 35 days. Juraboy spent all his savings to safe the life of his daughter. Unfortunately, she died and he now cares for her two children. The next loan Juraboy will use to purchase sheep and profit from his business for his children.

loans.use: Puchase sheep

loans.name: Manzura
