texts.ru: Manzura is  47 years old and is married with 5 children.  She lives in a 2 room apartment with her husband and two little girls. Two of her sons  work in Russia. Another one is in the army. Her husband is unemployed.  Manzura has been dealing in children's clothes and boots. It is the single source of income of her family. Last year, she received a loan from Microinvest, which really stimulated her business. Her business increased and with the profit she purchased two sheep for feeding. She is asking for another loan for the further extension of her business.

loans.use: for the further extension of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of grains to sell

loans.name: Fofo

texts.fr:
Mr. E. Fofo is the chief mechanic in Gbadabo. He was born in 1981 in Tabligbo.  He left a difficult family and has turned to individual entrepreneurship for income generation.  He became the chief mechanic four years ago and is well known around the area. He manages three other staff.  He has put in a big effort to open a workshop but he does not have the material to repair all kinds of cars.  He would like a credit of $800 to buy work materials (nails, hammers, vices...) and expand the workshop.  The financial assistance provided to this project will help support his family. Mr. Fofo is disciplined and will repay the credit in 12 months. 

Mr E. Fofo est chef mécanicien à Gbadago né en 1981 à Tabligbo. Sorti d’une famille misérable,  il est très tôt abandonné les bancs pour se lancer en apprentissage. Devenu maître mécanicien depuis quatre ans, il est célibataire et a à sa charge trois personnes. Il a fourni beaucoup d’efforts pour ouvrir un atelier mais il n’a pas assez de matériels pour réparer les motos de toutes sortes. Il voulait un crédit de $800 pour acheter de matériels de travail (clés, martaux,  tourne-vice …), élargir l’atelier. L’appui financier apporte à ce projet, augmentera se revenus afin de contribuer aux besoins de famille. Il prétend régler ce crédit en 12 mois

loans.use: Purchase of work material and tools

loans.name: Tope

texts.en: Tope Baloggun is a 44 year old single parent of 3 children. She comes from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She buys drugs and sells to neighboring villages where there are no chemist drugs. This has been her business since 1998 and requests the loan to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is a responsible mother. 14 years ago, watching the necessities that her children went through daily got her to start selling groceries. With her daily work the business became more sustainable and now she wants to improve it even more.

Thanks to this activity she maintains her two sons of 24 and 23 years old each who are studying at a center for superior studies. Her long years of experience have served her to make out of her store one of the best stores around. She has the desire to improve her sales center, to increase the quantity and diversity of services, in order to satisfy completely her community's members. Lets make her request possible so that this hardworking mother can reach every one of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Delfina, es una madre de familia responsable. Al observar las necesidades por las que atravesaban sus prójimos día a día, hace 14 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes; con su desempeño diario su negocio se vuelve más sostenible y desea mejorarlo aún más, gracias a esta actividad mantiene a sus 2 hijos de 24 y 23 años que están estudiando en un centro superior de estudios.Los largos años de experiencia le han servido para hacer de su tienda una de las mejores. Tiene el deseo de mejorar su centro de ventas para ofrecer más y diversos servicios que mantengan a los miembros d su comunidad totalmente satisfechos.Hagamos posible su petición para que esta trabajadora madre alcance cada una de sus metas.

loans.use: Inject capital into her  small sales center in order to offer more services to her community

loans.name: Jahuri P. Linda

texts.id:
With his modified motorcycle which includes two boxes at the rear to carry goods, Jahuri collects used good everyday. He drive thru hosing areas market and warehouse to collect the use goods. Most of the time he buy them from house wifes, and he price them according to good's condition and weight. Jahuri is the head of the family, even though he is just a used goods collector, he tries his best to support his family, furthermore he still needs to send to school, and as they grow their education cost increases. Financial help from Dinari will be use as a capital to buy more goods. He and his family hopes that their economic condition will improve in the future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya yang dipasang kotak di kedua sisi belakang motornya Jahuri menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Jahuri membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Jahuri adalah kepala keluarga yang sangat bertanggungjawab mekipun hanya berprofesi sebagai seorang pemulung Jahuri dengan penuh keuletan menjalankan aktifitasnya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya, apalagi untuk menyekolahkan anaknya yang semakin dewasa dan membutuhkan biaya yang tidak sedikit. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Capital to buy used goods - Modal untuk membeli barang-barang bekas

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu is 49 years old and married with 5 children.  With all the children in school, Abu needs to have a good business to generate profit.  His previous loans from SMT enabled him increase his stock.  He is now requesting another loan of $350 to expand his business.

loans.use: Abu is in need of additional capital so that he can purchase additional bales of clothing for selling in his shop.

loans.name: Mirella

texts.en:
Mirella R. D. M. has a business selling bananas in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She rents a spot in the crowded Bellavista market, where she has sold her fruits for four years.

Mirella is 50 years old with three children, and she is happily married. She loves working and being able to help her family. Mirella loves sales and building relationships. She never had the opportunity to study, so her goal is to send all of her children to school so they can become professionals.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Mirella is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to increase her daily stock of fruit to sell to the population of Pucallpa.

loans.use: To increase her daily stock of fruit to sell in the market

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla O. is forty-nine-yeas-old. She is married and the mother of four children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the other is a nurse at the Kampong Spue Health Care Center. The youngest is enrolled in school. Mrs. Phalla O. and her husband, Mr. Long Phan, are subsistence farmers and cultivate the rice field near their house. Previously, Mrs. Phalla O. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a pump to water her crop. In July last year, Mrs. Phalla O. got appendicitis and she went to Kampong Speu Hospital to cure that disease and this caused her unexpected expenses. For this reason, Mrs. Phalla O. now does not have enough money to fix her house so asked a loan to buy timbers to fix the walls.

loans.use: To buy timbers to fix the walls to improve the living condition.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en: K. Mehri is 48-years old. She is married and has an amazing daughter. Mehri is selling the undergarments and women's clothes. Her trading place is located in the one of the most famous markets, “Somon-bozor”, which is located in Kayrakkum town. Her husband is currently unemployed ,and Mehri has to work hard because she is the only source of income for her family. To increase the range of goods she can offer for the summer season, Mehri is requesting a loan for $600. There is no shortage of customers when the shelves are well-stocked. Mehri thanks everyone for support and promises to use the loan wisely.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and women's clothes.

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are Fatmata K., Rosaline K., and Memuna K.. They named their group Fight for Progress. Members of this group sell palm-oil, which is considered a very lucrative business among women in Sierra Leone. Palm-oil is used in the preparation of almost all kinds of food, making soaps, and some kinds of medicines.

These business women would like to be loaned the sum of Le 3,000,000.00 to help themselves go further afield to purchase more gallons of palm-oil.

Fatmata, who is the leader of this group, has been in the palm-oil business for two years now. She is 38, married to a farmer, and they have three children.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm-oil to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.en: Ajdar has been in this business for 20 years. He was born in 1957. He lives in Baku city, Novkhani village. He is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and seedlings to improve his greenhouse.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence T. lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She grinds pepper, tomatoes, and corn. She started this business in 2001. She has a grinding machine at the front of her house. This enables her to start grinding pepper, tomatoes, and corn for her customers by 7:00 am. She stops grinding at 8:00 pm daily.

Florence is 50 years old. She is married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client. Florence needs the loan amount of $850 to buy one grinding machine so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy one grinding machine

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen E., es soltera, la misma tiene una pareja con la cual vive desde hace 15 años, y tienen dos hijos, quienes son menores de edad y uno de ellos ya acude a una escuela privada. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, zona altamente comercial, sobre la Avda. Dr. Paiva, inició con un capital de Gs. 500.000.- U$ 120.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La señora retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería como remeras, blusas, lencería variada, algunas de ellas son semi nuevas.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. María del Carmen E. has been living with her domestic partner for 15 years. They have two underage children together, one of whom already attends private school. Her business is well-situated in a highly commercial zone on Dr. Paiva Avenue. She started out with a capital of 500,000 PYG (approximately $120.00 USD), which grew as the time passed. She currently has a large client-base.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, and assorted undergarments, some of which are semi-new.

One of her aspirations is to be able to expand her business with equipment and furniture soon in order to offer her customers a more comfortable and enjoyable setting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, blouses, undergarments, and children’s apparel

loans.name: Dane

texts.fr: DANE S. VEND DES PRODUITS COSMETIQUES AU MARCHE DE GRAND THIES DEPUIS  06 ANS. IL HABITE AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR. IL EST CELIBATAIRE ET SANS ENFANTS A CHARGE.
texts.en:
DANE S. has been selling cosmetics at the GRAND THIES marketplace for six years. He lives in the CITE SENGHOR district. He is unmarried and has no children in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetic products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret P. is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Tema-Ashaiman in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. For the past six years, she has run a clothing shop, where she sells ladies' and children's wears, such as blouses, skirts, lingerie, and underwear.

Unfortunately, she is constrained by her limited working capital in running the business. As such, she is seeking a loan to inject more working capital into the business in order to expand and improve her business. More specifically, she believes that the loan proceeds will enable her to purchase high-quality inventory in bulk.

She is a member of the group known as the Angel. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell any goods on group meeting days, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting. She is very grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand and upgrade her inventory by purchasing high-quality items (e.g., lingerie and underwear) in bulk

loans.name: Dorotea Marlyn

texts.es:
La Sra. Dorotea Marlyn Hernández García es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera  de 9 hijos menores de edad,  cinco de ellos estudian en la primaria y los otros en la secundaria, cabe señalar que los servicios básicos, alimentación, vestimenta y educación son pagados con el único ingreso de la venta de ropa y calzado. 

La Sra. Hernández vende ropa y calzado hace 2 años teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio y los transeúntes  que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades). 

La Sra. Hernández no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas ropa y por esta razón quiere comprar: 6 unidades de shorts a $ 9.00 dólares la unidad, 6 unidades de pantalones a $ 8.00 dólares la unidad, 6 unidades de sabanas a $ 9.00 dólares la unidad, 6 unidades de toallas a $ 5.00 dólares la unidad, 6 unidades de camisetas a $ 5.00  dólares la unidad y 2 docenas de falda a $ 17.00 dólares la docena, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias  y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dorotea Marlyn H. G.is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 38 years old and is a single mother of 9 young children. 5 of her children attend primary school and the others are in secondary school. She has to pay for all the basic costs to provide food, clothing and education for her children with her income from selling clothing.

She began her business 2 years ago with clients from her neighborhood and those passer by who liked the variety she offered, including childrens clothing, men's and women's clothing, and bedding. She does not have enough money to purchase the clothing in the quantities she needs. The money will be used to purchase shorts, pants, sheets, towels, blouses, skirts. With this investment she will be ablet o grow her income and better meet the requests of her customers.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her clothing business, grow her income and continue to provide for her young children

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Ester N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 20 and 31 years. Ester has been running a poultry (kuku) business since 2005. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.  She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Ester currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ester thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: El Sra.: Antonia tiene 40 años de edad, habita en Rene Cisneros en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad, es madre soltera lo cual tiene que sobresalir para apoyar a su hijo su negocio es la venta de palomitas, algodones, papas fritas y refrescos, desde hace seis años esta en las ventas, que inicio con fondos propios y con poca mercadería, ella desea invertir en materia prima para elaborar los productos que vende para esto esta solicitando solicitud en Afodenic que será para ella de gran beneficio para seguir adelante con sus ventas de ricos y baratos dulces que día día sale a vender. Sus planes es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio invirtiendo en materia prima, su anhelo es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old and lives in the Rene Cisneros neighborhood, in the capital city of Managua. She is the single mother of a 19 year old, and works hard to support her son. Antonia sells popcorn, cotton candy, french fries, and soft drinks. She's been in sales for six years, having started out with her own money and a little bit of merchandise. Antonia hopes to invest in prime materials, which she'll use to make the products that she sells. She is asking for a loan with Afodenic for this purpose. The loan will help her boost her daily sales of the delicious and cheap sweets. Antonia plans to continue strengthening her business by investing in prime materials, and she hopes to have her own home one day, as she currently lives in her parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to make cotton candy

loans.name: Doh

texts.fr: D. doh habite le quartier d’agoè cacaveli, elle fait depuis 2004 le commerce de charbons de bois en gros et en détail, son stock de marchandises a dimunié, cliente de wages, elle s’adresse à wages pour acheter 8sacs de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne au marché de tokoin gbadagbo. Elle est mariée et a trois personnes à sa charge. Son mari est un chauffeur et avec ce qu’elle gagne en surplus comme bénéfice elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
D. Doh lives in the Agoè Cacaveli district. Since 2004, she has been doing commerce in charcoal, wholesale and retail. Her inventory has shrunk. As a client of WAGES, she is enquiring with WAGES to buy 8 sacks of charcoal. She supplies herself at the Tokoin Gbadagbo marketplace. She is married and has three people to support. Her husband is a driver. With the extra profits she earns, she manages to help him to cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Villa Taruma Group

texts.es: El grupo "Villa Taruma" en su mayoría esta conformado por personas del área peri-urbana y representado por la señora Hedilberta. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de ropa americana,  zapatos, comida, carne, elaboración de pan  y al servicio de transporte público. La competencia en el mercado es alta pero las socias venden en las zonas peri-urbanas donde ya tienen clientes fijos. El destino del crédito es para el incremento de productos para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de sus productos con insumos de mejor calidad. Este grupo se encuentra iniciando su segundo ciclo en el cual demostraron puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The group “Villa Taruma” is mostly formed from people from the peri-urban area and is represented by ms. Hedilberta. The majority of the members sell American clothing, shoes, food, meat, bread and public transportation services. The competition in the market is high, but the members sell in the peri-urban zones, where they already have loyal customers. The loan will be used to increase their products to boost their earnings and to improve the quality of their products with better supplies. This group is beginning their second cycle and have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in their payments, which demonstrates experience as a united group.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more goods and better-quality supplies

loans.name: Yanapampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Yanapampa  inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias, todas las socias son D. L. comunidad del mismo nombre.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, cochinilL., animales menores, tara, tubérculos, verduras y abarrotes en general.

Como es el caso D. Bertha es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Bertha viaja a diferentes pueblos D. su zona en donD. compra animales, que luego los transporta a L. feria D. L. ciudad D. Huanta y en algunas oportunidades beneficia los animales y lo venD. en su comunidad.

Por otro lado Rayda es casada, tiene 41 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con elL., Rayda viaja a L. selva ayacuchana en donD. venD. animales como gallinas, cuy. Además Rayda se dedica a L. crianza D. gallinas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 11,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, fideo, gallina, oveja, animales menores, cochinilL..

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio y ahorrar mas.
texts.en:
The Yanapampa Communal Bank begins its third cycle with 13 members, and all of its members are from the community with the same name. The members have different businesses, such as selling cereal, cochinilL. (a red dye), small animals, tara (a powder used in tanning), tubers, vegetables and general groceries. Bertha lives with her partner, is 24 years old and has 3 children. Bertha travels to different towns in her area where she buys animals that she later transports to the fair in the city of Huanta and sometimes she prepares them for sale in her community. Rayda is married, is 41 years old and has 8 children, 4 of whom live with her. Rayda travels to the Ayachucan forest where she sells animals such as hens and guinea pigs. In addition, Rayda raises hens. The members need loans of different amounts, such as 300, 600 and 900 soles, making a total of 11,200 soles in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, hens, sheep, small animals and cochinilL.. The members' dream is to improve their businesses, to see their children become professionals, to have their own capital and to save more.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, noodles, chicken, sheep, small animals, cochinilla (to make red dye).

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás es un joven muy trabajador, vive con su pareja, sus dos pequeños hijos y su hermana en su propia casa. Desde muy pequeño le gustaron los trabajos manuales, es por eso que aprendió las nociones básicas de la carpintería, las cuales con el tiempo llegó a perfeccionar, ahora se dedica a la elaboración y venta de guitarras las cuales elabora en triplay o madera según el pedido que le hagan, pero él solo elabora el armazón ya que luego sus sobrinos proceden al pintado y barnizado de las mismas para lograr el acabado final. A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede realizarlo desde su casa y así estar al pendiente de sus hijos los cuales están en la etapa escolar y necesitan mucho de su ayuda y orientación en las tareas que les encomiendan en el colegio. Es por eso, que quiere seguir incrementando su producción y también el tamaño de su taller, para consolidarse en un futuro como el mejor fabricante de guitarras de su zona, aunque sabe que el camino será duro, ya que no todo es fácil como parece y debe ser muy detalloso al elaborar las guitarras y darles el acabado final para que suenen y luzcan como debe de ser. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, fue aconsejado por su hermana, ya que ella pertenece desde hace muchos años a un banco comunal de la misma institución y siempre le ha ido muy bien. Con el dinero solicitado comprará grandes cantidades de planchas de triplay y de madera para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a hard-working young man. He lives with his girlfriend, their two children, and his sister in his own house. Since he was very little he enjoyed working with his hands. It is because of this that he learned the basic concepts of carpentry, which over time he has been able to perfect. Today, he uses these skills to design and build guitars, which he manufactures from plywood or hardwood, according to the customer's order. He only builds the body of the guitar, then his nephews apply paint and varnish to achieve a finished product. Nicolas likes his work very much, since he is able to do it from his home, and can thus keep an eye on his sons, both of whom are in school and need lots of help and guidance from him with their schoolwork. It is because of this that he wants to continue expanding his production and also the size of his workshop, in hope of solidifying his position as the best guitar manufacturer of his area. He knows the path will be difficult, since nothing is as easy as it seems, and he realizes he must be very careful and detailed in building his guitars, paying attention to all the final touches, so that they sound and shine as well as they ought to. This is his first loan with MFP. He was encouraged to take a loan by his sister, since she has belonged for many years to a communal bank from the same institution, and always come out well from her involvement with the bank. With the money that he asks for he will buy large quantities of sheets of plywood and hardwood, so that he can increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de madera

loans.name: Kalsoom M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji operates an embroidery business. She is a 30-year-old married lady and has been living in the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past four years. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is M. I.. He is an electrician. Kalsoom baji works to lessen the financial burden of her husband because she knows that her husband’s income is insufficient. She is applying for a loan to buy another embroidery machine, because her customer list is getting long and it’s difficult for her to fulfill her orders on time.

She is the leader of this group with two other women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switchboards, etc.) to sell. Rasheeda baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: María Azucena R. Martínez tiene 40 años, es madre soltera. Y tiene a cargo dos hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente sus padres se hacían cargo del negocio pero murieron debido a la guerra, y una tía se hizo cargo de la finca y de la manutención de María, y fue así que además de dedicarse a este negocio que le enseño su tía, es profesora en un colegio. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de concentrado. Por lo que ha experimentado que los financiamientos son de gran ayuda por que han incrementado sus ingresos para que sus hijos logren estudiar. Su mayor sueño es obtener una buena cantidad de cerdos y vacas para que realmente sea una finca donde produzca leche y otros derivados.
texts.en:
María Azucena R. Martínez, 40, is a single mother raising two minor children. She is a pork butcher. She has been doing this for more than twenty years. Previously her parents were in charge of the business. However, they died as a result of the war. An aunt took over the farm and taking care of María. In addition to running this business that her aunt taught her, she is a school teacher. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy food pellets. From her experience, the loans are a great help that have increased her earnings so that her children can go to school. Her biggest dream is to have a good amount of pigs and cows so that the farm produces milk and other derivatives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
La señora Sara María A. Díaz tiene 41 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa,   tiene 4  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Sara  se dedica a la venta de comida y cervezas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 200 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de utencillos para el restaurante como ollas, platos y cerveza.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como cerveza y gaseosas para implementar su negocio.
Sara tiene como sueño  tener su librería para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Sara María A. S. is 41 years of age and lives in La Esperanza District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad. She completed her secondary education. She has four children who are economically dependent on her. Sara works selling prepared food and beer from her business which she operates out of her home. Her first loan of 200 Sols which she received from her Communal Bank, Nueva Esperanza II (the Second New Hope), was used to buy utensils for the restaurant, such as pots, dishes and beer. This loan of 1,500 Sols will be used to buy supplies such as beer and soft drinks in order to stock up her business. Sara has a dream of having her own bookstore in order to grow as the owner of a small business. To view her previous loans click here and here.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jeysi

texts.es:
La señora Jeysi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 24 años y no tiene hijos.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes al por mayor, donde por ahora se esta estableciendo, ya que se cambió de su casa a un local alquilado, ubicado en una parte céntrica de la ciudad, poco a poco esta siendo conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende todo el día. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00,  comprará abarrotes como: 40 paquetes de papel higienico, 10 cajas de bocaditos, galletas, biscuitas, chicitos, leches y aceites. Vende diferentes abarrotes surtidos; para así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. 
  
Jeysi, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jeysi belongs to the Santa Ana Community Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 24, in a common law marriage, and she does not have children. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the desire to get ahead by her own means served her well in setting up her own business. She sells wholesale groceries. She moved the business from her house to a rented location, which is located in a center part of the city. Little by little she is becoming known among her customers. She is now doing very well in her business. She is currently continuing with the same business, where she sells all day. She spends a lot of time working in her business, and she is very happy with what she does. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy groceries like 40 packages of toilet paper, 10 boxes of snacks, crackers, biscuits, cheese chips, milk, and oil. She sells different stocked groceries. This is the way to keep her customers satisfied and happy. Jeysi feels happy and peaceful with what she does, and she is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase the amount in her store

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Doña Marta tiene una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, el cual inicio con ahorro y la venta de un vehiculo que tenia. Tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casada, y con tres hijos que estudian, su esposo  trabajad como administrador de empresa, con este préstamo que esta solicitando espera invertir en  granos básicos, productos lácteos, entre otros productos que consume las familias Nicaraguenses. Sus planes a futuro  es poder incrementar su negocio a si como ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien. Da las gracias Afodenic por el los prestamos adquirido y  por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Doña Marta has a store where she sells a variety of products. She used her savings and the proceeds from the sale of a vehicle to start her business. She is 36 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. Her husband works as an office manager.

She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, dairy products, and other consumer goods that Nicaraguan families use. Her future plans are to expand her business and help her children with their education. She thanks AFODENIC for providing loans and the associated benefits she has gained.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains & dairy products

loans.name: Nicolau Salvador

texts.pt:
Nicolau Salvador C., de 26 anos de idade, natural de Marracuene, província de Maputo, vive maritalmente e é pai de 01 filha de 02 anos, tem casa própria em Boane onde vive com a sua família, frequenta o curso de licenciatura na Universidade Pedagógica, Sustenta a sua família e ainda paga as despesas dos seus estudos.

Em 1990 saiu de Marracuene para Boane na casa do Gaiato (orfanato e escola de artes e oficio) onde estudou ate concluir o nível básico. Em 2002 fez o curso de professores no Instituto de Magistério Primario de Chibututuine no distrito vizinho da Manhica.

É  docente na casa do Gaiato há 05 anos e ganha como salario mensal na MINED ( outra instituição de ensimo) o valor de 5.000,00MT e 4.775,00MT, totalizando 9.775,00MT com o qual sustenta a família, os seus estudos e ainda consegue poupar para melhorar a sua residência.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas de serviço que também nossos clientes, este e o seu primeiro empréstimo, nunca teve empréstimo em nenhuma outra instituição.

Com o empréstimo de 18.000,00MT pretende comprar diverso material de construção para concluir a sua obra. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua obra, o seu sonho e concluir o ensino superior e depois casar-se.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Nicolau Salvador C., 26, was born in the district of Marracuense, province of Maputo. He lives in Boane with his partner and two year-old daughter, in a house they own but that is still under construction. He's currently enrolled at the Pedagogical University of Maputo. Nicolau got his elementary teaching credentials from the Magistério Primário de Chibututuine. Since 2004 he has been teaching at "Casa do Gaiato", an Orphanage and Arts & Crafts School in Boane, where he himself studied and finished middle-school. Between his salary from Casa do Gaiato and the money he makes from teaching at another institution, Nicolau's monthly salary is 9.775,00 mt, which allows him to support his family, pay for college and also save some money. Nicolau heard about Hluvuku-Adsema thorugh friends. He plans to use his first loan to buy construction material to finish his house. He expects to pay it back without difficulties, and intends to apply for other loans in the future, to furnish his house. His hopes and dreams include finishing building his house, graduating from college and getting married.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material to finish his house

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Este comité  SAN RAFAEL es un comité  que está en el decimo dentro de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 20 integrantes las cuales realizan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales que les permiten aportar con los ingresos de la familia. Estás integrantes junto con sus actividades comerciales se describen a continuación.: .
Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
1	Juliana V..	Venta de frutas.
2	Fermina A. C..	Venta de mercería.
3	Petrona R. D..	Kiosco.
4	Rosalinda S. .	Peluquera.
5	Maria Z. D..	Modista.

6	Juana E. J..	Venta de Articulo de limpieza .
7	Alice R. M..	Venta de Ropas.
8	Norma B. Q..	Venta de quiniela.
9	Juana C. V..	Venta de ropas.
10	Lidia N. O..	Modista.
11	Gladys E. C..	Venta de ropas.
12	Catalina F. O..	Cocinera.
13	Estela G. deG.	Venta de artículos de limpieza.
14	Blanca B.M..	Peluquera.
15	Irma B.C..	Venta de cosméticos .
16	Jorgelina M..	Venta de productos Avon.
17	Concepcion V..	Venta de mercería.
18	Ines P. B..	Venta de comida.
19	Delia A.M..	Venta de quiniela.
20	Blanca L. D..	Venta de comestible.

Por Ej: La Sra Petrona R. D. posee un pequeño kiosko hace 7 años con la ayuda de su marido. Ella vende golosinas jugos gaseosas, comidas frías etc. Ingresó al comité con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio. .
Es un comité antiguo pero con  muchas ganas de superarse. .
texts.en:
This group SAN RAFAEL is in their tenth loan cycle through the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation). They have 20 members who have different types of businesses, which allow them to contribute to the family income. These members, along with their businesses, are described as follows:

Nº First and Last Name Activity 1 Juliana V.. Fruit sales 2 Fermina A. C.. Notions sales 3 Petrona R. D.. Kiosk 4 Rosalinda S. . Hairdresser 5 Maria Z. D.. Dressmaker 6 Juana E. J.. Cleaning products sales 7 Alice R. M.. Clothing sales 8 Norma B. Q.. Lottery tickets sales 9 Juana C. V.. Clothing Sales 10 Lidia N. O.. Dressmaker 11 Gladys E. C.. Clothing sales 12 Catalina F. O.. Cook 13 Estela G. deG. Cleaning products sales 14 Blanca B.M.. Hairdresser 15 Irma B.C.. Cosmetics sales 16 Jorgelina M.. Avon products sales 17 Concepcion V.. Notions sales 18 Ines P. B.. Food sales 19 Delia A.M.. Lottery ticket sales. 20 Blanca L. D.. Food sales

For example: Sra Petrona R. D. has owned a small kiosk for seven years, with the help of her husband. She sells candy, juices, sodas, cold foods, etc. She joined the committee with the idea of expanding her small business. It is an old committee but they have many desires to improve themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various merchandise such as: clothing, cosmetics, lottery cartons, fruits, vegetables, fabric, thread, food such as: meat, eggs, milk, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith es una persona muy activa y colaboradora, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos, ella se dedica por las mañanas a la venta de jugos y por las tardes trabaja en una tienda  de decoraciones de ambientes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jubilado de educación y también la ayuda en la venta de jugos. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Dulce Vida  II”, desde hace un año y es puntual en sus pagos. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para su negocio de venta de jugos. 
Con este crédito de S/ 1200 soles, Sadith invertirá en la compra de vasos, platitos, copas y en la compra de una vitrina para colocar sus tortas y panes. La meta de Sadiht es poner una fuente de soda en su casa ya que por donde vive no hay este tipo de servicio.
texts.en:
Sadith is a very active and collaborative person. She is 51 years old and the mother of 7 children. In the mornings, she sells juices and then manages her interior design store in the afternoons. She has the support of her husband, who is retired from the education field and also helps with selling juices.

She joined the Communal Bank “Dulce Vida II” (Sweet Life II) a year ago and has been punctual with her payments. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy supplies for her juice business.

With this loan of 1200 soles, Sadith will purchase glasses, saucers, cups, and a display case for storing cakes and breads. Her goal is to install a soda fountain in her home because no other place offers this type of service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glasses, saucers, cups, and a display case for storing cakes and breads

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos Antonio es casado, trabaja como maestro de primaria en Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando el 3er crèdito, para comprar materiales de construcciòn y hacer una habitaciòn para asi mejorar las condiciones del nùcleo familiar,  su esposa se encarga  de los quehaceres del hogar, adicionalmente se dedica a la  siembra de cultivos agricolas en la finca de su mamà en los dias libre y los fines de semana y obtiene otros ingresos, es un docente que ama su trabajo y ha luchado para que a su familia no le falta nada, su sueño es seguir estudiando para asi desempeñar su trabajo con mucha eficiencia.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en:
Esohe sells provisions, drinks, beef and foodstuffs. She is 39 years old and married with three children.

Esohe is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more beef and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La señora VICENTINA P. M., tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE UNIDAS. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Vicentina es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 1 dependen económicamente de ella porque él tiene una enfermedad crónica que requiere de cuidados y de atención. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como: patos, carneros, pavos y pollos en su casa huerta.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró alimentos para los animales y también compró pavos y patos para su crianza y posterior venta.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles volverá a comprar alimentos por sacos para los patos y pavos para poder así estar abastecida para las ventas de fin de año.
Vicentina sueña con empezar a criar vacas para así iniciar a vender leche y obtener mas dinero para los medicamentos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vicentina P. M. is 42 years old, lives in the Las Delicias district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Peru, and is a member of the community bank Siempre Unidas. She has a high school education. Vicentina is married and has 4 children, of whom only one is a dependent, as he is chronically ill and requires a lot of care and attention. For a living she raises farm animals such as ducks, sheep, turkeys and chickens on her farm. She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to purchase food for the animals and more turkeys and ducks to raise and sell. With this new loan of 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase more sacks of food for her ducks and turkeys so she can be fully stocked and prepared for the end of year sales. Vicentina dreams of raising diary cows in order to sell milk and earn more money for her son’s medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase food for ducks and turkeys

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product range.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lilia Flor

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilia Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y no tiene hijos.

Lilia Flor, es una mujer joven que le gusta trabajar, nos cuenta que anteriormente vendía cosméticos de la línea Avon y luego por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de hamburguesas, con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos, con su primer prestamo en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 y con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito sanguchero, posteriormente fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de hamburguesas, fuera de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy bien  en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos: papitas al hilo, a diario compra 25 panes especialmente para las hamburguesas, embutidos como: jodoc, jamonadas quesos, chicharrones, carnes, huevos y  pollos, en cuestión de verduras comprara tomates y lechugas en kilos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando mesas, sillas y paraguas, para dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y así atraer mas a sus clientes.

Lilia Flor, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lilia Flor, 20, is a member of the "La Marginal II" communal bank which is located in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has no children. Lilia Flor is a young woman who enjoys working. She tells us that she used to sell Avon cosmetics but then, through her own initiative, began to sell hamburgers in order to earn her own income. With her initial, 300 sol, loan from Manuel Ramos Movement and with her partner's support, they bought a sandwich cart. Later on she bought utensils and materials needed for better customer service. Currently, she continues to sell hamburgers outside her house where there is a lot of pedestrian traffic and she tells us that her sales are good. She starts selling at 6pm which is when many customers want a snack and she herself serves them with her characteristic good humor and charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy ingredients: french fries, her daily supply of 25 hamburger buns, ham, cheese, pork rinds, cured meats, eggs, chicken, tomatoes, lettuce. Part of the money will be used to buy tables, chairs and umbrellas to provide a more appealing appearance to her business and attract more customers. Lilia Flor is very sure that her business will progress more than now and is grateful to Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her reaching her goals and seeing her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Alicia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 21 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.
Alicia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar dos ovejas y gallinas.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia has been a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” Community Bank for the past year. She is from the Llave district, from the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 21 years old, lives with a partner and has two children. She has finished secondary school. She buys and sells animals. With Alicia’s first loan from the “Manuela Ramos” Movement, which was for 500.00 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 500.00 new soles that she will use to buy sheep and chickens. Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Llave. What she likes the most about the Community Bank is their savings.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sheep and chickens.

loans.name: Nogoye Soukèye

texts.fr: Nogoye soukèye B. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KA FALL depuis 03 ans et demi et y a eu 07 expériences avec le crédit. Son crédit lui permettra de développer une activité d’embouche bovine et ovine et ses bénéfices à assurer l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nogoye Soukèye B. is a 46 year old woman, married and mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KA FALL for 3.5 years and has already gone through 7 loans. This loan will allow her to start a cattle and sheep fattening business and, with the profits, to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle and sheep fattening business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen S. is from the town of Butuay. She is 46 years old. Ellen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ellen owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2005, Ellen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Ellen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet Maria

texts.es:
Janet es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Janet es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Janet en asociación con su hermano tienen local de lavado y engrase de carros, el cual esta en un local alquilado, Janet se encarga de la administración.
Janet necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una maquina.
Los sueños de Janet son ampliar su negocio, independizar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. Janet is 28, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Janet, in association with her brother, has a car wash and oil change business in a rented space. Janet runs the business. Janet needs a loan for 2,000 PEN as part of a payment for a machine. Janet’s dreams are to expand her business, make the business independent, and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for a machine

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inició  la señora Deolinda A., quien vive en el barrio San Miguel de Pdte. Franco de Ciudad del Este, ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres En Progreso”, está constituido  por 17  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.                        Cada una de ellas tiene una actividad independiente y la realizan con muy esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Y cada crédito que ello retiran lo destinan  a la actividad que ellas se dedican así como la señora Olga quien se dedica a la venta minorista de muchos productos preferentemente de uso doméstico, ella atiende su negocio en su domicilio y nos cuenta que esta muy contenta ya que cuenta con mucha clientela y sus ganancias son muy interesantes por que ayudan mucho en la economía de la casa especialmente para la alimentación de la familia.
Así todas de dedican a elaborar y vender sus trabajos de la mejor manera; 

1
Olga C.
Despensa

Dolly Z.

texts.en:
Deolinda got in touch with her friends and neighbors to form the group. She lives in the San Miguel de Pdte. Franco neighborhood in the City of Este. The group is called “Mujeres En Progreso” (Women in Progress) and is made up of 17 active women from the same zone. Each lady has her own business which they run with great effort. Each loan is intended for their individual businesses, like Olga who sells many items, particularly household products. She runs her business from her home and tells us that she is very happy; she has many customers; and her income is important because it helps very much with expenses, especially feeding the family. The other members work to build their businesses and work hard in the best way they can; 1. Olga – Pantry sales 2. Deolinda – Cosmetic sales 3. Dolly – Clothing sales 4. Elva – Tailoring 5. Petrona – Clothing sales 6. Graciela – Hair styling 7. Andrea – Clothing sales 8. Dionisia – Empanada sales 9. Mirna – Nic nac sales 10. Angélica – Sports lottery tickets 11. Aurora – Clothing sales 12. Cipriana – Egg and cheese sales 13. Rosa – Cosmetic sales 14. Celsa – Food sales 15. Valentina – Fruit sales 16. Alice – Footwear sales (flip-flops) 17. Flora – Fruit and vegetable sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, cooking oils, flour, fruits and vegetables, clothing, jewelry, cleaning products) for resale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan A. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin in Misamis Occidental. He is a 37-year-old married father of 2 school-aged children. Jonathan earns a living by providing tricycle transport services. He has been doing so for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Jonathan joined GDMPC IN 2009 to gain access to financial services that would help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC, and he is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicles for better service.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair transport vehicles for his business.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a very hard working woman. She is 30 years old, married with a child and lives in Lagos where she does the business of selling of foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in the business for 3 years now. She hopes for expansion and improvement in her business in future, that will impact her business and family life positively. 

Agness is requesting for the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more food stuff and drinks to sell as this will attract discount and increase sales. She hopes to repay back her loan at due date. She appreciates all lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuff and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yumjir

texts.en: Yumjir is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Two of her children, Uuganjargal and Tuvshinsaihan, ages 17 and 9, attend a local secondary school. Her youngest daughter, a four year-old, attends kindergarten. During the day, Yumjir operates a clothing and consumer goods trading business in her town. She purchases products in Ereen, a Chinese border town. Yumjir started her business in 1995, and has expanded her business over the past years. She has been planning to grow her business and product line even further. She is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind.  She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2195 USD) loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda T. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 62 years old. Nilda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling snack foods, bananas, coffee and other dairy products in the local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over three years.

In 2009, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nyame Asem Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Akosua describes herself as hard-working, a woman for whom no challenge is too great. She is 36 years old and is the leader of the “Nyame Asem” (translated as 'God’s word') borrower group. Akosua is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice with different sauces. She has been selling cooked rice for the past two years. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase three bags of rice, vegetables, cooking oil and spices. She is married to a mason and together they have three children. 

The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, smoked fish, palm oil production, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. They hope to make more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children, hopefully through university level.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Faith Women Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Faith Women” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mary S. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a building contractor and they have two children who are one and four. Mary has been a businesswoman for four years now; she sells cooked rice, meat, fish, and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will buy rice, frying oil, and other cooking ingredients wholesale.

loans.use: Buy rice, frying oil, and other cooking ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, es un hombre emprendedor que está cumpliendo sus metas, tiene 51 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su esposa Dina, de 45 años y sus dos hijos, siendo el mayor de su primer compromiso y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Huancayo por motivos académicos. Es entonces que con la ayuda de su esposa y el menor de sus hijos, desde muy temprano en la mañana abren las puertas de su fuente de soda, para ofrecer a sus clientes deliciosas hamburguesas de pollo, papas fritas y ensalada de lechuga, acompañadas bebidas gasificas y bebidas calientes. Lleva 10 años dedicada a este negocio a lado de su familia y a diario obtiene entre S/. 250.00 a S/. 300.00 soles de venta. Parte de su éxito en el negocio, es la buena sazón con que preparan sus platillos además de la amabilidad con atiende a sus clientes. Su negocio le es muy rentable, es por ello que quiere incrementar su negocio, con productos de primera necesidad, además de ampliar su establecimiento. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está motivado de continuar en su grupo comunal ya que conoce la metodología de trabajo de sus compañeros. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará insumos para preparar sus hamburguesas, además desea comprarse una licuadora.
texts.en:
Jesus is an enterprising man who is meeting his goals. He is 51 years of age and lives in his parents’ home along with his wife Dina, 45, and his two sons, the eldest of whom is from his first marriage and currently lives in the city of Huancayo for academic reasons. Thus with the help of his wife and the younger of his sons, at a very early hour of the morning they open the doors of their soda fountain to offer their customers delicious chicken burgers, french fries and lettuce salads, along with sodas and hot drinks. He has been running this business along with his family for ten years, and takes in between 250 and 300 soles in daily sales. Part of his success in the business is the good seasoning with which they prepare their dishes, in addition to the friendliness with which he serves his customers. His business is very profitable and therefore he would like to grow his business to include grocery items and by expanding his premises. This is the fourth time he has obtained a loan with MFP and he is motivated to continue on with his communal bank since he is familiar with the work methodology of his co-members. With the 500 soles he is requesting he will buy supplies for preparing his burgers and also wishes to purchase a blender.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for preparing burgers

loans.name: Genesis 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yaina is the coordinator of her group Genesis. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the slums north of S. Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Yaina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling used clothing by purchasing a large package of assorted used clothing that comes from places like the Salvation Army in the U.S. She will use the profits to invest in saving toward the future of her children.

loans.use: A large package of used clothing

loans.name: Tou's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of seventeen members located in Preaek Ta Mem village, Kandal province.  
Mrs. Tou H. is 43 years old and she is the village bank president having been selected by its member. With the loans, the members of this village will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose. 
Mrs. Tou H. is a laborer who works very hard to support her children. In order to increase income to improve the family living, she will use the loan who asked from AMK to buy a fishing boat and a boat machine for fishing. Mrs. Tou H. is widow with six children, four are laborer and two are attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat and a boat machine for fishing.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra B. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mattuga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child who is in school.  Barbra has operated a business selling cosmetics for 5 years.  

To help expand her business, Barbra is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock to sell. Barbra hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to make her business bigger. In the future, Barbra hopes to sell more products and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic stock to sell

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Amalia del Carmen P. V. es una mujer joven de apenas 26 años, pero el hecho de ser joven no significa falta de experiencia pues ella desde hace 8 años ya que vende productos de panadería y repostería de manera ambulante, una gran parte de sus clientes son personas a las que les brinda crédito y le cancelan los mismos de manera semanal o quincenal. En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su conyugue quien trabaja también en la elaboración del pan que ella vende.
texts.en:
Amalia del Carmen P. V. is a young woman of just 26, but her years of experience belie her age. For the last eight years she has been working as a street vendor selling sweet and savoury bakery products. Many of her customers make their purchases from her on credit and then repay her on a weekly or fortnightly basis. Her husband supports her business by baking the bread that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Na We Cam” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ramatu K. who is pictured on the left. Ramatu was born in a place called Sanda near Makeni. The 45-year-old is married and has eight children, one of whom is attending secondary school.  

Ramatu sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) and has been doing this business for a very long time. Ramatu is seeking this loan in order to expand her business. She will buy gara lapper making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder and white cotton cloths. In this way, she will be able to produce a large number of cloths to sell.

loans.use: To buy gara lapper making materials

loans.name: Celia Politilde

texts.en:
Celia Politilde C. is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the town of Siayan within the region of Zamboanga del Norte on the island of Mindanao. Celia Politilde runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Celia Politilde joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to buy additional products to sell. Celia Politilde is requesting a new loan, her third from PMPC, of 35000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product line

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells specialty dishes in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 23-year-old single man living in Tyre, where he has been working as a car mechanic since 2007, with 13 years of experience. Hassan is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a scanner machine specialized for his business. His clients are his fellow villagers, and those from the nearby villages, in addition to friends and relatives. He hopes to improve his skills in this domain and to stay up to date with the new technical advances.

loans.use: To buy a scanner machine specialized for his business

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana Mercedes L. A., se dedica a la Edificacion de Ropa de Mujeres y varones, habita en el Viejo,  es casada con 02 hijos en edades escolares y es primera vez que solicita credito en CEPRODEL para compra de una Maquina de Coser para poder brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes en sus vestuarios.
texts.en: Ana Mercedes L. A. dedicates herself to making women and men’s clothing.  She lives in El Viejo, is married, and has two school-aged children.  This is the first time she requests a loan with CEDPRODEL to purchase a sewing machine, in order to provide better service for her customers with her clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mariuxi Yesenia

texts.es:
Mariuxi Yesenia G. M.  tiene 29 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con el hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Mariuxi se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mayores ingresos en el negocio y dar lo necesario para la educación al hijo.
Le gusta leer.
texts.en:
Mariuxi Yesenia G. M. is 29 years old. She is in a common law marriage and lives with her partner and son. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Mariuxi is a farmer and specializes in growing corn which she has done for some 3 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in a market in the same city.

Mariuxi needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn crops. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. Some problems that she faces are plagues and disease and climate change. Her dream is to have more profits from her business and to have everything her son needs for his education.

Mariuxi enjoys reading.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Armando Pedro

texts.es:
Armando Pedro M. T. tiene 25 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y el hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Armando se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Armando Pedro M. T. is 25 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and son in the Ventanas settlement, located in the “de Los Ríos” province.

The members of the “UNIDOS SOMO MAS,” (United we are more) communal bank, located in Marañon, within the Puerto Pechiche parish; part of the Pueblo Viejo settlement.  This area produces short cycle crops, such as corn, beans, and rice.

Armando has specialized in raising corn, rice and beans for the past three years.  He buys his supplies at “Comercial López” in Ventanas and sells his harvest at the Ventanas marketplace.  

He is asking for this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.  This loan will help him to meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges, such as crop diseases and the weather.  Some day he would like to buy a house and his own house and some land.  He likes playing sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer
